loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 48 Years of age, married with 3 children. She is primary school teacher. The salary from teaching service was not enough to cater for her home expenses thus; she decided to start up a small retail shop in April 2006 this year to supplement her salary. The business is progressing and she is earning USD 73 per month. The business is situated in Githurai a busy market, this call for a well stocked shop in order to attract customers.

loans.use: The business is still under capitalized and therefore she wants to buy more of rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, soap, salt and bread.

loans.name: Nassor

texts.en:
Nassor is 33 years old and married with one son. He lives in Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. He owns a retail pharmacy selling medicines. His business is licenced with the local authorities.

His business often has to face running out of stock. The area where he lives is prone to malaria and waterborne diseases like cholera and amoebic dysentery, so drugs for these diseases have a high turnover in his pharmacy. Nassor has a plan to add a supply of medicines especially for malaria and waterborne diseases.

In the future, he plans to open another pharmacy. For now, he wants to expand the existing shop. This strategy will help him increase his family's income and take care of the school expenses for two children left by his late brother.

Nassor is in need of $750 to buy the stock he needs.

loans.use: To add to stocks of medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José Guadalupe is married and his wife is a housewife. He used to work making concrete blocks, but the salary was not very high and when his first son was born he did not earn enough to support his family. As he knew how to make concrete blocks he used his savings to buy a machine to make them and some benches to keep them on. His oldest son helps out by working in the business while studying. José Guadalupe currently has a lot of clients and wants his business to continue growing.

José would like a loan of $475 to buy raw materials to make the blocks and therefore give his clients what they want and so that he does not run out of materials. He will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. He thanks you for your support so that his business can grow and he can improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

José Guadalupe esta casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, él trabajaba como obrero en una blockera y su sueldo no era muy alto, por lo que decidió abrir su propio negocio cuando nació su primer hijo varón, ya que no le alcanzaba lo que ganaba para mantener a su familia, como el sabía como hacer los blocks, con su liquidación compró una máquina para hacerlos y unas tablas para apoyar los blocks. Su hijo mayor lo ayuda con los ingresos familiares trabajando como empleado y a la vez estudia. Guadalupe actualmente ya se hizo de muchos clientes y desea continuar con su negocio y creciendo.

José está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder comprar materia prima para la fabricación de los blocks y así poder entregar los pedidos que ya tiene y que no lo puede hacer por falta de materiales. Ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y agradece el apoyo que le brindes para continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy materials/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.en:
Hermenegildo lives in the town of Creel in Chihuahua. He's married and has two small children. From a very young age, Hermenegildo has worked as a carpenter. Faced with a lack of employment in his town, he decided to start his own carpentry shop in a converted room in his home. Today, thanks to his many years of experience and high quality work, he's become a well known carpenter and his business has grown.

To improve both the quality and efficiency of his work, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $275, to be repaid over a 6 month period, to buy tools. He thanks you for providing him the opportunity to improve his family's living conditions and to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Creel en Chihuahua vive Hermenegildo, él es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Desde muy pequeño Hermenegildo se dedica a realizar trabajos de carpintería y ante la falta de empleo en la localidad decidió comenzar su propio taller acondicionando una habitación de su hogar, gracias a la experiencia que tiene realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad y poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Para mejorar la calidad de su servicio y realizarlo en un tiempo menor Hermenegildo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Hermenegildo a mejorar la vida de su familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, él agradece sinceramente la ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
"I need to enlarge the space in one of the rooms in my home, since space is very tight. There are five people altogether in my family. I seek $800 to enlarge the space in one of the rooms in my home."

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito ampliar un cuarto en mi vivienda ya que es muy reducido el espacio que tenemos y somos 5 de familia” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para ampliar un cuarto de mi vivienda.

loans.use: to build a room for more space

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is a craftsman in metal workings; he makes metal troughs used to wash clothes which he sells all over the City of El Alto as travelling street vendor. His wife also helps by selling the troughs in her booth at the Feria 16 de Julio (street fair) on Thursdays and Sundays. He has four children aged 11, 8, 4, and 2 and they live in the Zona Villa Tunari Rio Seco in the City of El Alto.

The house in which they reside lacks a waste disposal system and this has become a very real problem for the entire family. The loan will be used to install a sewage system that will allow the family to have a better quality of life.

This is their first loan with IMPRO and our assessment allows us to approve Jose’s loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

José es artesano en metal mecánica, realiza bateas de metal para lavar ropa las cuales comercializa en toda la Ciudad de El Alto como vendedor ambulante callejero, la esposa colabora también con las ventas en su puesto de venta en la feria 16 de julio los días Jueves y Domingo; tiene cuatro hijos de 11, 8, 4 y 2 años de edad; vive en la Zona Villa Tunari Rio Seco de La Ciudad de El Alto.

La casa donde viven carece de sistema de desagüe y esto se ha convertido en un verdadero problema para toda la familia. El crédito requiere para la instalación de alcantarillados que ayudara a la familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por José.

loans.use: Installation of a home sewage system.

loans.name: Niyar

texts.en: Niyar A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She sells women's clothes in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has engaged in this business for fifteen years. She wants to increase the variety of her goods and expand her business; because of this, she needs a loan in the amount of $700.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

This is 32-year-old Jalia M.. She is married with three children, aged 4, 9, and 12. In 2006 Jalia established a beauty salon, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional hair care products and hairdressing equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional haircare products and hairdressing equipment.

loans.name: Asomiddin

texts.ru:
Asomiddin Safarof lives in the village Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 47 years old, married, and has 6 children. He has a high school education. He has been in the business of cattle breeding for 9 years. He purchases young bulls, feeds them intensively for 40-45 days, and resells at higher prices as those bulls cost more and are used later on for meat. After that, he purchases new bulls and repeats the process - that is how his business works. This business helps him to maintain his family, since this is a single main source of income for Asomiddin's whole family. Apart from that, development of these types of businesses help to supply markets with good meat at moderate prices. He plans to pay off the credit within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафаров Асомуддин Исоевич житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 47 лет, женат, имеет 6 детей.Образование среднее.Специальности не имеет. Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает около 40-45 ддней а затем продает по более высокой цене, так как откормленные и подросшие бычки стоят дороже и их используют на мясо.Затем он покупает новый молодняк , откармливает и продает. Так по этой схеме действует его бизнес.Этот бизнес помогает обеспечивать его семью так как клиент является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме того развитие животноводческого сектора позволяет обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом и по доступным ценам.Занимается животноводством клиент уже около 9 лет.Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить бычков. Погаситькредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a young bull

loans.name: Nyma

texts.en: Nyma is 32 years old and is married with 3 children.  Nyma sells food in the Kabala town market of Sierra Leone and has been running the business for three years.  With her previous loan from SMT, Nyma diversified the business; as a result, her profit increased and thereby enabled her to provide for the basic needs of her family.  She would like to increase her stock and produce tie dye materials to increase her income.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock of food products and to further diversify her business to include the creation and selling of tie dye materials

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Augusta S., who is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 31. In 2007, Augusta established her fish business. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of a small local fish called dagaa (similar to anchovies). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of a small local fish called dagaa (similar to anchovies), for resale at market.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A. was born in 1956 in Ghana. She currently reside in Havé, a village located a dozen kilometers from Tsévié, where she is a farmer and sells tubers and grains. Married, she is the mother of five children who are in their care. In addition, she takes care of three other young children. A courageous woman full of confidence, she continued her business thanks to an initial loan of $500 that she obtained. It enabled her to have a significant income for meeting the essential needs of the children. Although illiterate, she manages her business in an extraordinary fashion and always makes her loan payments correctly.

This loan that she is requesting will enable her to stock up on corn and black-eyed peas in order to better meet customer expectations during lean times. Thus, her bottom line can increase, and she will be able to invest more in the education, health, and schooling of the children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Abra est née en 1956 à Ghana. Actuellement elle réside à Havé, un village situé à une dizaine de kilomètre de Tsévié où elle fait l’agriculture et la vente de tubercules et de céréales. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants qui sont leur charge. En plus, elle a en charge trois (3) petits enfants. Courageuse et pleine de confiance, elle a continué son activité grâce à un premier crédit de $500 qu’elle a obtenu. Ce qui lui a permis de dégager un revenu substantiel aux besoins élémentaires des enfants. Bien qu’analphabète, elle gère de façon extraordinaire son activité et est toujours très correct dans le remboursement de ses crédits.

Ce crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire du stock de maïs et de niébé afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en période de soudure. Ainsi, son chiffre d’affaire pourra augmenter et elle pourra investir plus dans l’éducation, la santé et la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: To stock corn and beans

loans.name: Dorina

texts.es:
Dorina is a member of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" ("Battling Women") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin where she earns a living selling various bulk food items. She has a stall in the Numero 3 ("Number 3") market in Tarapoto. She started her business 8 years ago, with help from her niece. Because of her dedication and perseverance, the business has grown. When she started, she only had certain types of maize, but now she sells a variety of products including beans of various kinds, lentils, peas, ground coffee, etc.

With the S/.900 (900 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, Dorina will buy wholesale supplies of maize, beans, lentils and peas that she will then sell in smaller lots. She will also buy unprocessed coffee beans that she'll then toast and grind for sale to her regular customers.

Dorina, 67, is thoroughly committed to her business, despite her age, because she enjoys operating it and being with her customers. She says that she's always described herself as strong, determined, serene and up for a fight. She wants to have a business at home so that she can enjoy a quiet retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dorina T. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín y Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de granos de todas las variedades, en su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado nº 3 Barrio- Huayco Tarapoto. Se inició en el negocio desde hace 8 años, contó con el apoyo de su sobrina. Con dedicación y perseverancia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente, ya que cuando se inició solo tenia maíz en grano y maíz chancado, ahora oferta variedad de productos como fríjol, de distintas variedades, lentejas, alverjas, maíz canchita, café molido.

Con el préstamo de S/. 900.00, que será devuelto en 6 meses comprará maíz en sacos, fríjol de distintas variedades en sacos, lentejas y alverjas en grandes cantidades, para ser vendidos estos productos por kilos al por menor, además ella compró café en granos que después de ser tostados y molidos oferta a sus clientes que diariamente la visitan.

Tiene 67 años, que a pesar de su edad, ella se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y así se distrae con su clientela. Siempre se caracterizó por ser fuerte, perseverante, tranquila y luchadora. Ella anhela tener un negocio en su propia casa para así tener una vejez tranquila.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of food items for resale.

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru:
Bozorgul H. lives in Yavan. She is married and has 4 children. Bozorgul has worked in her business for 20 years. She owns a store in her village, where she sells food products. Bozorgul would like to take out a loan in order to increase her inventory. This will help her to expand her business and to increase profits. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдарова Бозоргул жительница города Яван. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. 20 лет занимается бизнесом. Имеет свой собственный магазин в своем кишлаке. Торгует продуктами питания. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет развивать ее дело и увеличить прибыльность бизнеса. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Hazat Allah

texts.en:
Hazat Allah is married. He lives with 11 members of his family, including his 3 married sons. He works in agriculture. He has been involved in this business for more than 20 years. During the war in Kabul, he was in Peshauer, Pakistan. All his crops that he had worked hard on were destroyed by rockets. When he came back 3 years ago, he went back to working on his land. Even now, he can't prepare all his land for cultivation because of some economic problems.

Now he wants to take an individual loan from AFSG in Kabul to have money to prepare his land for cultivation and complete his stock for agriculture. He intends to work hard and take good benefit in the future to help his family.

He is happy with this process of small loans in Kabul that help people, especially those who lost everything. It is a good help for any worker in Afghanistan. He would like to thank all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To ready his land for cultivation and complete his stock

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mr. Sim N. (shown in the picture while making the roof of his boat), 46, and his wife, Mrs. Doem Chun, 46, live along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have six sons. Three of their sons have full-time employment, and the other three study in a local school and help with the fishing business.

Mr. Sim has been fishing for almost twenty years. He works in Tonle Sab River and the lake behind the village and sells to villagers. His wife is assisting him in the business and takes care of the children. Sim needs a boat machine to fish in this season. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a boat machine for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a part for his boat

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 39 años, es madre de 3 hijos que están estudiando y necesitan mucho apoyo de ella y de su esposo José, quien trabaja lejos de casa, solo regresa cada 6 meses, pero siempre está pendiente de Noemí y sus hijos, y cuando puede, la apoya en su negocio. Noemí se dedica a brindar servicios de corte de cabello, peinados, entre otros, ya que para ello estudio. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues cuando puede vende ropa por los caseríos del río Ucayali, los deja al contado o cambio de algo (gallinas, plátanos, etc.) Noemí quiere implementar más su negocio, así como también quiere mejorar las estructuras de su vivienda, pero para esto, estima de un capital, monto que solicita, para lograr lo que quiere.
texts.en:
Noemí is 39 years old and is the mother of 3 children, who are studying and need a lot of support from her and her husband José. José works far from their home. He only returns every 6 months, but is always dependent on Noemí and their children. When he can, he helps her in her business. Noemí offers hair-cutting and hair-dressing services, among otherthings, because this is what she knows how to do. She is a very hard-working woman. When she can sell clothes in the towns of the Ucayali River; she sells them for cash or trades for something (hens, bananas, etc.). Noemí wants to improve her business more, and she also wants to improve the structure of her home, but for this, she needs capital, of the amount that she is requesting, in order to achieve all of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her hairdressing business and to repair some structures of her house

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a member of the Proyección Village Bank. She is 57 years old and married with six children and six grandchildren. At her home, she bakes chapla, a traditional Peruvian bread, and then sells it in a local market each day. She starts baking at 12AM each morning and by 5AM is at the market. She stays at the market until 8 or 9AM, and if she doesn’t sell all of her bread, she returns in the afternoon. She sleeps for a few hours each day after lunch. 

Filomena sells each roll for 10 or 20 centimos, depending on the size. On a good day, she earns 50 to 60 soles. Filomena is requesting a loan of 600 soles (US$200) to buy flour to make bread. Her dreams for the future are to keep working and to buy an automatic mixer for bread dough, which costs 1500 soles.

loans.use: Buy flour for bread

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Hello from Theogene N. from Rwanda! Theogene is 26 years old, married with one child and has one adopted orphan.

Theogene runs a butcher business where he sells beef to the local people. He has a shop where he employs 2 people to help him run the business. A kilogram of beef costs 1800 Frws ($3), and Theogene sells about 350 kilograms a day.

Theogene is requesting a loan of 500,000 Frws to be repaid in 8 months. He wants to buy two cows to slaughter during The Christmas festivals with the aim is to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy two cows to slaughter during Christmas festivals.

loans.name: María Rosly

texts.en:
Maria Rosly H. M. is forty-two years old. Her husband is a municipal worker and together they have four children. Maria has been a member of the Las Paykanas communal bank for one and a half years and has used the capital she borrows to support her motocar business.

Motocars are a popular form of transportation in Pucallpa, Peru where Maria lives. Motocars are three-wheeled passenger vehicles comprised of the front half of a motorcycle with a two-wheeled, two-seater passenger cart in the back. They are basically motorized rickshaws that are used as local taxis.

Maria uses her car to earn taxi fares, either by renting the car at a daily rate or a family member will drive the motocar to earn income for the family.

Maria is requesting a loan of 1,200 Nuevo Soles to fund the purchase of replacement parts for the maintenance of her motocars. She will repay her loan monthly over the course of four months.

loans.use: purchase of replacement parts for the maintenance of her motocars

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Traoré est une femme mariée de quarante huit (48) ans et mère de cinq (5)  enfants qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le village de Dialakoroba (deuxième administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle fréquenta l’école jusqu’au lycée où elle  abandonna pour le mariage. Après elle bénéficia des formations en santé maternelle et infantile qui lui ont permis  de mieux connaître les médicaments afin de les commercialiser.
En vu de mieux fructifier  son activité elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso auprès de laquelle elle bénéficia de quatre prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) et trois prêts individuels. Elle est à son quatrième  individuel et tous ses prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, une importante quantité de produits pharmaceutiques au dépôt de la pharmacie populaire du Mali à Bamako une fois par mois pour les revendre au Centre de Santé de son village qu’elle-même a la responsabilité de la gestion de la pharmacie.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110. 000  F CFA qui servira à payer l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré, age 48, is married and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her husband and her children in a monogamous family in the village of Dialakoroba (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She attended school up to high school, before abandoning her studies to get married. Afterwards, she was trained in healthcare for mother and child, which enabled her to get to know medications better in order to sell them. To bolster her business, she joined the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which she obtained 4 group loans (solidarity loans) and 3 individual loans. She's now seeking her fourth individual loan. All previous loans were repaid without problems. With this loan, she intends to buy every month large quantities of pharmaceutical products in Bamako, at the governmental pharmacy, in order to resell them in the health center of her village, where she's managing the pharmacy. She foresees an average monthly profit of XOF 110'000 (ca US$ 220), to be used to repay the loan and help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell medications

loans.name: Soeut

texts.en:
Soeut P., 47, lives in Battambang province. He is a construction worker, building houses, earning around US$ 3 per day, while his wife raises cows for sale and makes less than US$ 2 per day. This couple has four children, two of whom are construction workers; two are students.

Mr. Soeut P. would like to use this loan to purchase construction materials. (Soeut's wife is pictured from their home.)

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Subadhara

texts.en:
Mrs. Subadhara B. lives in Chetapati, Kathmandu. Chetrapati is one of the busy districts of Kathmandu. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores. Mrs. Subadhara lives with her husband and sons. Her husband, Mr. Gyan Prasad Bhatttrai, is retired. Her sons are now working.

Mrs. Subadhara is engaged in pickle-making as a business. She makes different sorts of pickles. She took a month of training for pickles-making. Nepalese people love to eat pickles while having lunch and dinner. She sells her products door-to-door in the local market. Now she is requesting Rs 20,000 as a loan to buy various food materials used for pickle making.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making pickles

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
This is Mosses T., Alhaji K., Emmanuel K., and Samuel L. K.. They named their group Tamensu. They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They had received several loans through SMT. Previously, each one of the group received a loan of Le 800,000. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mosses (right) is the leader of the group. He is thirty-five years of age. He was born in a village called Makump Bama, five miles from Makeni. His wife is a businesswoman and the two have three children – two of them are in secondary schools and the last is still not of school-going age. Mosses has been a businessman since 2000.

Mosses owes a small kiosk where he sells both soft and hard drinks. With this new loan, he will buy ten cartons of bottled drinks and ten cartons of canned drinks. Depending on the type of drink, prices for canned drinks range between Le 40,000 – 85,000, and prices for bottled drinks range between Le 30,000 – 85,000.

With this loan, Mosses' profit margin will increase and with the increase in profit, he will be able to develop his business by reinvesting the profit into the business, sustaining himself and family.

loans.use: Buy crates of hard drinks and soft drinks

loans.name: Maris

texts.en: Maris is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She sells provisions such as noodles, milk, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra O. has been tilling land ever since she was just a small kid. She is 33 years old with three children. She wants to send all her children to school until college, so that when they are older they will be employed and support their future families.

She is requesting a small loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will buy fertilizer to increase her yield. Sandra is hoping that someday she will be able to buy new lots. In that way, she could have a bigger harvest to support the educational needs of her children.

CEVI is helping Sandra to grow her business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farm needs

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
R. Bakhtiyor is working hard as he is the only breadwinner in the family. For 8 years he has been selling blankets and coverlets in the market. This market is very popular among the population because of his attractive prices. Bakhtiyor has a lot of clients. He tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which allows him to keep his clientele. R. is 32 years old, married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper. Bakhtiyor is requesting a loan of $1500 US for purchasing more goods in order to increase the range of them. Bakhtiyor would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises that he will repay the loan without any delay. The progress of Bakhtiyor’s business is in your hands

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase blankets and coverlets

loans.name: Trịnh Thị

texts.en:
T. Trịnh Thị (1437051081) is a 46 year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, T. owns & operates a business venture raising cattle for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. T. is requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 5th loan taken out by T. from TYM Fund.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Feauai

texts.en:
Feauai V., 63, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and the general public two days per week. Feauai expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about 166 USD). 
Feauai has three previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Feauai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer and a wheel barrow

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is 48 years old and happily married to Roelito. They were blessed with two children. She is a college graduate but due to lack of job opportunities, she ended up with her own business as a vendor of street foods in their village as her way of helping her husband earn a living.  

Her husband plants vegetables, rice and fruit trees, which is how they get some of their major family needs met. They help each other for the welfare of their family. Anna Marie also hopes to establish a typical village store somehow in order to increase her daily income. Thus, she is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional business capital.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Utulivu borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 30-year-old woman. She is single and the mother of 2 children, ages 3 and 13 years old. She also cares for 2 other dependents.

Paulina started her own business selling charcoal 11 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Paulina's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh to buy more charcoal to sell. With the additional profit that she gains from this loan, Paulina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Theresia is another member of the same group. She has also requested 150,000 Tsh to support her own business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Patwe Central Atimango Florence Group

texts.en: A. Florence is thirty-five years old, married with six children whom five are schooling. She is representing her group as well running a bakery business where she is baking madasi for sale and she has been in this business for over one year. She is using the loan to purchase madasi ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, etc. she is hoping for her business to expand. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase madasi ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in the business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs, drinks and provisions to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Djénèba

texts.fr:
Madame Djénèba D.  a  49 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants au quartier Noumouso de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Djénèba D.  fait ce commerce d’articles divers depuis maintenant 4 ans, en plus de ses obligations professionnelle, car elle est enseignante à l’école du quartier Noumousso. 
Elle est beaucoup sollicitée en cette période (approche de l’ouverture des classes et de la fête de ramadan) par sa clientèle en nette croissance.  
Afin de satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite son second prêt individuel auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, le premier s’étant  bien déroulé. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 7 pièces de pagnes bazins  et 4 paquets de fournitures  scolaires. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville chez les grossistes et  revend  dans la ville de Kadiolo et à l’école  où elle enseigne en détail, au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage  réaliser avec ce prêt, un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djénèba D. is 49 years old and the mother of 4 children - 2 boys and 2 girls. She lives with her spouse and their children in the Noumouso neighborhood of the city of Kadiolo (in the 3rd administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

Mrs. Djénèba D. has done this business for 4 years now, selling a variety of items. In addition to her professional obligations, she also teaches at the school in the neighborhood of Noumousso.

She is highly requested by her clientele during this period (with the approach of the opening of classes and the holiday of Ramadan). As such, she can satisfy this clientele more by growing and she is requesting a second individual loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, having fully repaid her first loan.

With this loan she intends to purchase 2 pieces of "pagnes bazins" (colorful wax cloths) and 4 packets of school supplies. She supplies herself from wholesalers in the market of the city of Sikasso and re-sells in the city of Kadiolo and in to the school, where she sells at retail prices for cash, or credit to a clientele consisting of men and women. With this loan she envisions earning an income of 15,000 FCFA, which she will use to increase her business' funds, contribute to family expenditures and pay the interest for her loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes and school supplies for resale

loans.name: Soaila Shiab Group

texts.en: Soaila Shiab is the leader of Soaila Shiab group. There are three members in this group. Each of them is requesting a loan to grow their businesses; they are requesting a group of loan 30,000 Afghani. Soaila requests a loan for her husband who has a electrical equipment repair business. Salma requests a loan for her husband who has video cassette shop. Gul Jan wants to request a loan for her son who is a tailor. They thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow businesses (repair shop, video store, tailor)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: María América

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y una de sus cinco hijos en el caserío Mocape, distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 27 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Su esposo adquiere los animales a los negociantes de la zona. Ella es la encargada de criarlos y su esposo el de venderlos todos los viernes en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Usualmente comercializan ovejas, cabras y chanchos. Este es el único ingreso estable con el que cuenta la familia.

Ella desea ampliar el negocio familiar con la compra de más animales para su posterior cria y venta por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y muy responsable. En la fotografía aparece en un potrero cerca a las ovejas que está criando. En la zona es muy común ver a las ovejas pastar libremente.

Su más grande anhelo es poder arreglar su casa, construida de material rústico y mejorar la calidad de vida con la que viven.
texts.en:
María is the mother of a family. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband and one of her 5 children in the Mocape settlement, Olmos district, in Lambayeque province. Mocape is about 2 hours from the City of Chiclayo.

For the last 27 years she has dedicated herself to raising and selling farm animals. Her husband acquires the animals from venders in the zone. She is in charge of raising them and her husband sells them every Friday in the city of Chiclayo. Usually they sell ewes, goats and hogs. This is the only stable income that the family can count on.

She wants to expand the family business by buying more animals to raise and sell. For this reason she is soliciting a loan of 1,000 new sols through Edpyme Alternativa. María is a happy woman, hard working and very responsible. In the photograph she appears in a pasture with the ewes she is raising. In this zone it is very common to see ewes grazing freely.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY ANIMALS TO RAISE AND SELL

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu J. sells used clothes in Makeni city. He wants a loan of SLL 2000000 to enable him to improve his business. With a loan, Abu will be able to add one bale of Ladies Tops, one bale of Girls Skirts, and one bale of Truck Pants. This will eventually lead to more sales and improve profits. He will thus be able to take greater care for his nine children and wife.

Abu was born in a village call Sanda Taindaran, in northern Sierra Leone. He is now forty years old. His wife is a businesswoman too – both of them are managing the same business. Their children are attending schools – three are in primary school and six are in secondary school. Abu has twenty years of experience in selling used clothes.

loans.use: Buy additional stock of used clothes

loans.name: Salceda

texts.en:
Salceda E. is from the city of Sta. Cruz Tangub City. She is 49 years old. Salceda is widowed and has 3 adult-age children. To make a living, Salceda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling foods and daily use products such as bread,candies, shampoo and etc.in the local community. Salceda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Salceda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Salceda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Salceda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 37 years old, is a married woman. She has four children and her oldest is 14 years old. Juliet is involved in rice farming. She works with her husband at the farm and still finds time to take care of her family. She wants to earn a better income to provide for the increasing needs of her family. She also wants all her children to have a proper education.

Juliet joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, to have access to its program. She requested a loan of 6.000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Johana

texts.fr: Johana S. est une femme mariée de 56 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle fait du commerce en détail d’huile de palme et de miel. Ce prêt lui permettra de maintenir son capital et de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de scolarité et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Johana S. is a 56-year old married woman, the mother of three children. She runs a retail business selling palm oil and honey. This loan would allow her to maintain her working capital and help better the living conditions, schooling, and health of her family.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in palm oil and honey

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old, widowed, and has five children aged between ten and twenty, all of whom go to school. The family rents a one-roomed house where Margaret lives with eight people. She also takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. Her biggest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication and feeding the family.
Margaret owns a stall selling second-hand clothes. She sells on a retail basis only. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Margaret has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She hopes to see her business grow, and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess A. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Maritess is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maritess joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maritess is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius K. is the proprietor of a mini-boutique. This shop is rented within the central business district.

He is married and his wife is also engaged in the running of the boutique. He spends part of his time as a social worker with a non-governmental organization (NGO) in Bo.

He has two years' experience in business. He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase land and educate his children.

He is industrious and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing for resale

loans.name: Asociación Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Asociación sin Fronteras está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras provenientes de Masaya ciudad de la flores y cuna de folklor nicaragüense. La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Lidia de los Ángeles P. S. ella comercializa artesanías y cosméticos desde hace cuatro años. 

P. con el préstamo adquirirá nueva mercadería en ambos productos para seguir aumentando el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 

La otras integrantes son Socorro   Benita Rodríguez la cual aproximadamente desde hace 15 años se dedica a venta de papel a las comiderias las cuales lo ocupan para servir la comida y Felipa Lorena E. vende en las calles del municipio de Tipitapa verduras y pan. Ambas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios para que estos progresen.
texts.en:
The group “Asociación sin Fronteras” (Association Without Borders) consists of three hardworking and enterprising women from Masaya, the city of flowers and the cradle of Nicaraguan folklore. The group coordinator is Sra. Lidia de los Ángeles P. S., who has been selling handicrafts and cosmetics for four years. She will use her loan to acquire new merchandise so that she can continue increasing her business and improve her living conditions.

The other members are Socorro Benita Rodríguez who, for approximately 15 years, has been selling paper to establishments that sell food. Felipa Lorena E. is a street vendor in the town of Tipitapa who sells vegetables and bread. Both of them will invest the loan in their respective businesses in order to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts

loans.name: Mawuena

texts.fr: Cet  homme de 36 ans est marié et père d’un enfant ; afin de pouvoir subvenir convenablement au besoin de sa famille, il s’est lancé en 2002 dans la vente de chaussures qu'il expose au bord de la route pour attirer le regard des passants. Il s’approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoé. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, il souhaiterait gonfler son stock pour mieux satisfaire ses clients raison pour laquelle  il demande un premier prêt pour l’achat de 40 chaussures.
texts.en:
This 36 year-old man is a married father with one child. Seeking to provide for his family he began to sell shoes for a living in 2002; he sells these at the roadside in order to capture passing trade, and sources his goods from the local market at Hedzranawoé. He is facing a stock shortage and would like to increase his stock levels to satisfy his customers' demands. For this reason he is seeking his first loan to buy 40 pairs of shoes.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia N. is from the village of San Jose, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old. Vivencia is married and has 3 adult children. Vivencia owns & operates an agricultural business. She buys copra and other crops such as cassava and sweet potato from the neighboring village and sells them in the city. Vivencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vivencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vivencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Vivencia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vivencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Luisa Solanda

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es socia de la Fundación desde hace 4 años en los actuales momentos es socia del Banco Comunal Umiña en Manta primer puerto atunero del Ecuador a orillas del Pacifico.

Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio de frutas, plantas y ropa, quizás parezca una combinación algo rara pero es así como ella junto a su esposo se ganan la vida, ya son 7 años en este negocio en Tarqui una parroquia de Manta con gran asentamiento comercial en la zona,   

Empezó con el negocio con un dinero que tenía ahorrado pero necesitaba de mas capital porque sus ventas fueron en aumento y tenía que surtir su almacén pero fue ahí que una amiga le hablo para que ingrese al banco comunal, y desde entonces le va muy bien con los créditos y ha ido incrementando su negocio.

En los actuales momentos la señora Luisa invertirá su nuevo crédito en gran parte a la ropa y el restante para surtir su negocio de las frutas,  junto al esposo trabajan en un local que le han dado los suegros, quien empezó con el negocio fue el esposo, y después fue la señora Luisa que invirtió en la mercadería de ropa porque una hermana de ella que vive en los Estados Unidos  le envía la ropa, zapatos, cartearas y bisutería.

Desde hace 10 años está en unión con su esposo, no han podido tener hijos, pero han sabido superarlo, ahora están dedicados a su negocio, el sueño de nuestra socia es tener una boutique de primera para brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa has been a member of Fundación ESPOIR for four years. She is currently a member of the Umiña Communal Bank in Manta, which is Ecuador's first tuna fishing port on the Pacific coast. She works selling fruit, plants, and clothing. Perhaps this seems like a strange combination, but this is how she and her husband earn a living. For seven years, they have run their business in Tarqui, a parish of Manta with a large business presence in the area. She began the business with money she had saved up, but she needed more capital because her sales were increasing, and she had to stock her store. At that time, a friend advised her to become a member of the communal bank, and since then the loans have worked well for her, and she has been expanding her business. Luisa will invest her new loan mainly in clothing and use the rest to stock her fruit business. She and her husband work together in a place her in-laws gave them. Luisa's husband was the one who began the business, and later on Luisa invested in clothing sales because her sister, who lives in the United States, sent her clothing, shoes, bags and costume jewelry. Luisa and her husband have been married for ten years. Then have been unable to have children, but they have learned to deal with that and now are dedicated to their business. Luisa's dream is to have a boutique in order to make her customers more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of assorted clothing

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia, D. 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal D. todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, debido a que cultiva olluco, zanahoria y papa, y que luego son llevadas a vender al por mayor en L. ciudad D. Tarma.  Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea invertir y sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista D. Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y L. cansan mucho. En adelante espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y asegura que ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil doscientos soles que solicita, comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Celedonia is 36 years old and a hardworking responsible woman. She lives in her own home with her five beloved children who are the main reason behind all of her endeavors. With great effort, she has worked her farmland and achieved extremely productive results. She grows ulluco, carrots, and potatoes and sells them in bulk in the city of Tarma. Her crops proviD. the necessary income to support her family. For this reason, she wants to continue investing so that she can succeed in her business. What she enjoys most about her job is caring for her crops. Celedonia has been in this business for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the wholesale market in Tarma since the sacks are quite heavy and the work exhausting. In order to get ahead, she hopes to improve her crops so that she can generate a better income.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Celedonia said that she submitted her payments from her previous loans on time, so she hopes to do the same now. In her Communal Bank, she is an active participant and is always aware of the agreements that are reached within her group. With the loan of 1200 PEN that she requested, Celedonia will buy compost and insecticides in hopes of improving her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Dolores Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Nena is married and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, Nena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like canned goods, noodles, vinegar, sugar, shampoo, soap, coffee, and more in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the expansion of her business. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Mambo from Kenya!

Charles has requested this 45,000 KSH loan to purchase an insured dairy cow.  He is a dairy farmer who has been in this business for 4 years and employs one farmhand on his farm.  In addition to selling milk from his dairy cows, he also sells tea leaves to the local tea factory.

He dreams of someday owning three high-quality cows, and of increasing the amount of land he has for planting feed.  He would also like to start a breeding farm for "heifer" cows.

Currently, Charles says he is challenged by the lack of sufficient land for his cows to graze on, and poor roads to the market.  

Charles is 25 and has a child who is one year old.  He says that with this loan he will be able to increase his milk production to a sustainable level.  He also hopes to receive a training course on dairy farming soon.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase of merchandise such as toys and childrens clothing

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 32 years old and is married with four children. She is well-known as a self-employed businesswoman selling styles of clothes for men as well as for women. She has been in this business for about four years and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Francine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she hopes that she will improve her business by adding modern styles which undoubtedly will increase her sales as well as her profits.

With the earned profits, Francine will keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To add modern styles of clothes

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, de 44 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene  dos hijas. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de adobe. Hace un buen tiempo atrás, Gilberto trabajaba para un productor de café, de lo cual recibía una remuneración justa, pero con el pasar de los años, tuvo que dejar trabajar de forma dependiente, para empezar con su propio negocio. Desde entonces produce y comercializa café y cacao, por  que le está dando buenos resultados, por ello se siente muy contento con el trabajo que realiza. Cuenta además con el de su familia, pero en época de siembra y cosecha contrata peones, que le facilitan la extracción de sus productos. Su plan a futuro es seguir con la agricultura, por lo que necesita comprar más terrenos de cultivo con el propósito de aumentar su producción agrícola. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente fortalecido con su grupo comunal, ya que le  brinda muchos beneficios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de producto de cacao y café de otros productores, para completar el pedido pendiente que tiene con sus compradores potenciales.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 44 years old and lives in the Villa Quintiaria community, in an adobe house, along with his wife and two daughters. The community is located within the tropical Peruvian jungle. In the past Gilberto worked raising coffee, where he received a fair salary, but after some time he decided to stop working for someone else and started his own business. Since then he’s been raising and selling coffee and cacao. Things have been going well for him, so he feels happy with his work. He gets some help from his family, but during the harvest season he hires workers to help with the harvest. He plans to continue farming and needs to buy more farmland so that he can increase his production. This will be his sixth loan through MFP and he is committed to making all of his payments. He also feels empowered by his communal group because it provides him with many benefits. He will use the money from this loan to buy cacao and coffee to complete orders he has from his potential customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Coffee and cacao

loans.name: Yader Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Yader Antonio  tiene 31 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. La ubicación es en su humilde vivienda, el es padre de tres hijos que junto a su esposa han logrado salir adelante, por lo que él es quien  va todos los días a buscar los productos necesarios para su negocio, ya que los precios de sus productos le resultan mucho más favorable porque también tiene a sus clientes en el mercado pues ya lo conocen porque el llega diariamente a realizar estas gestiones. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como frutas, verduras, golosinas, detergentes y otras cosas. Siempre sueña con lograr establecer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Mr. Yader Antonio is 31 years old. He runs a small grocery store, which is located in his humble home. He is the father of three children who, together with his spouse, he has enabled to get ahead in life. Every day, he goes out looking for the necessary products for his business. As a result, the prices of his products are much more favorable, because he also has customers in the market who know him because he goes there every day do business. This loan is to purchase merchandise like fruit, vegetables, candies, detergents, and other items. Mr. Yader always dreams of establishing a wholesale dispensary.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise like fruit, vegetables, candies, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta is married to a teacher and has one child.  She sells ready-made items and shoes in Makeni.  She is a jovial and very intelligent businesswoman. Originally, Fanta accessed funds to begin her shop from her husband and began trade on ready-made items, which she has now maintained for 4 years. She is in need of a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL to buy additional ready-made items. Fanta intends to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children to the university level and to save for her future retirement.

loans.use: To add more stock of ready-made items.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia tiene 32 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y comida. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este trabajo, por lo que se siente muy contenta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Vende sus productos de manera ambulante es así la forma en que obtiene más clientes pues le gusta hablar con sus clientes, no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos que son necesarios para ayudarle con su negocio. Solicita este crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que su negocio tiene demanda por sus clientes. Desea ampliar su negocio para sufragar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 32 years old and makes a living selling food and clothing. She has dedicated herself to this activity for the past three years and she feels very content. She sells products at different locations, and in this way she brings in more customers, whom she enjoys talking to. This is not the first time she has taken out a loan for her business, since it is necessary to help her business. She is requesting the loan to increase her working capital since her business is in high demand by her customers. She wishes to expand her business so she can cover household expenses.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kiko

texts.en:
Kiko J. is currently in the business of selling bread at home and is requesting a loan to stock baking flour to make the local Sudanese bread to sell.  

Kiko is 28 years old and married to a driver. She has four children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land.

loans.use: Stock baking flour to make local Sudanese bread to sell

loans.name: Wilde David

texts.es: El señor Wilde tiene casa propia, tiene una flota que trabaja en la ruta de Cochabamba a Toro Toro, desde hace veinte dos años, también trabaja en compra y venta de movilidades, el señor es casado, recibe el apoyo de su esposa que también ayuda en la empresa, tienen dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, esta sacando este crédito para poner a su nombre los papeles de su flota y así poder regularizar esa documentación. La empresa de transporte interprovincial es familiar por lo tanto también ellos se dedican a administrar el negocio, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Wilde has his own home. He has had a bus that works the route from Cochabamba to Toro Toro for 22 years. He also is in the buying and selling of cars. He is married; he has his wife's support; she also helps with the business. They have two school-age children. He is taking out this loan to register his bus under his name in order to have the proper legal documents. The interprovincial transport business is a family business so they also run the business. He is very grateful to this organization for its support.

loans.use: Register his bus in his name

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech C. is 56 years old and lives in the village of Roteang, in Kandal Province.  He and his wife, Vorn Lorn, are farmers who own a plot of land.  They cultivate vegetables and peanuts for a living.  They do not have enough money to support the farm, so Pech C. is asking for a loan to purchase a pump machine, fertilizer, and pesticides to cultivate rice.

The couple have three children: one is a teacher, one helps with the farm, and the youngest one is a student in the local village.  The photo shows Pech C. with his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El señor Hector Mantarî P. es cliente de la Caja Señor de Luren desde el año 2005 ha cancelado sus crèditos puntuales. El solicitante trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo de la localidad de Santiago de igual manera su esposa trabaja como obrera de campo en Ica Pacific donde es estable ambos se ayudan en los gastos familiares, viven en casa propia tienen cuatros hijos los cuales uno de ellos tiene a su cargo los demàs son independientes. Està solicitando el crèdito para mejoramiento de su vivienda y otros gastos adicionales, se propone otorgale el crèdito por presentar buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor Mantarî P. has been a client of Caja Señor de Luren since 2005.  He has repaid his loans on time.  

He works as a field worker for a large farm in Santiago; his wife is a regular employee working as a field worker for Ica Pacific.  Together they contribute to family expenses. They live in their own home and have four children one of whom is still in their care; the others are independent.

He is asking for funds to do some home improvements and for some other additional expenses.  

Because he has good personal references, the loan will be granted.

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: El señor Ismael nacido el 12 de Diciembre de 25 años, nació en Pucara, Valle grande convive con la señora Lucia tienen 1 hijo de 5 años de edad. El tiene su pequeña parcela en Santo Corazón el se dedica a la agricultura lo que el mas siembra es el maní por que rinde mejor y también siembra Papa su esposa le ayuda y comercializa sus productos en el mercado de la zona y cuando todo esta sembrado el se dedica a trabajar como conductor, el tiene su vagoneta hasta que madura su cosecha su movilidad también le ayuda a transportar su mercadería, con el dinero de crédito comprara semillas y lo utilizara en el preparado de la tierra, es una persona mu trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ismael was born on December 12th in Pucara, Valle Grande.  He is 25 years old.  He lives with his wife, Lucia, and they have a five year old child.  

He has a small plot of land in Santo Corazón.  He is a farmer, and he plants mostly peanuts because they yield better.  He also plants potatoes.  His wife helps him and sells his products at the fair in the area.  When everything is planted, he works as a driver using his van.  He does this until the crops are ripe.  His vehicle also helps him transport his merchandise. 

He will use the loan to buy seeds and to prepare the land.  He is a very hard-working person, and he is grateful to the institution for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: For planting corn

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun S. is 30 years old.  She lives with her husband and two young children in Kompong Chhnang province. She works at home doing housework and cooking for her family. Her husband is the head of the family, earning US$7 every day to support the family. He has been a carpenter since 2009. He makes tables, chairs and beds, and sells them at the local market. Every month, this family spends about US$50 on food, US$10 on utility and US$30 on public transportation. Soun S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnankouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de bétail, des poissons, d’articles divers, de condiments et des tubercules                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt.                                                                
SITAN T. s’approvisionne en poissons auprès des pécheurs du village presque quotidiennement. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F  CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi are married and are 42 years of age on average. They each have 4 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Gnankouma, in the prefecture of Dioila. It is located in the region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They are known through family and as neighbors. They sell livestock, fish, assorted merchandise, condiments, and tubers. 

The women members of the Benkadi group request their first loan. 

Sitan T. acquires fish from the fishermen in the village every day. She makes her sales from her home and completes them in cash and on credit. Her clientele is made up of women and men. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 20000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to cover health care expenses, and to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old, single, and has adopted children.  She owns a restaurant. Her business has helped her to pay the children’s school fees. She is requesting for a loan in order to purchase milk, foodstuffs, and beer. She hopes to expand her business and pay her children’s school fees with the profits she makes.

loans.use: To purchase food, milk, and beer for her restaurant.

loans.name: Tamara's Group

texts.en:
Tamara M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, an ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan near Osh. She is 57 and married to a bookkeeper. Together they have raised two children: a son and a daughter. The son, 33, is handicapped and the daughter, 18, works in a bank. In order to earn additional money, Tamara cultivates agricultural products. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase wheat for cultivating. In the near future, Tamara plans to celebrate her son’s wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo I. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Charo is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Charo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. Charo has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Charo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Charo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Charo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Charo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. Over the years, he has proven to be a successful entrepreneur with his printing and photocopy shop with 23 years of experience in the same occupation. In parallel, he works with his sister in their own small grocery shop. He cooperates with his wife who works in a supermarket to earn a good income and be able to pay the heavy life expenses. 
Today, he is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase ink for his printing and photocopy machines. This will allow him to significantly increase his productivity and income by serving more customers. He is positive about his business prospects and plans to further expand his business. He is hoping to open a new branch of his shop in the coming year. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase ink for his printing and photocopy machines

loans.name: Khatoon's Group

texts.en:
In order to meet her family's basic needs, Khatoon, a widow, started a boutique business after the death of her husband. She displays her stitched clothes in her boutique, selling them to different community members and clothing shops for good profits.

Khatoon has a son and 2 daughters. Her son, a motor mechanic by profession, is 25 years old. He couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints. Khatoon’s elder daughter, 17 years old, also left school after 5th year and she helps her mother in her business. Khatoon’s youngest daughter is 16 years old. The family lives in a 2-room brick house in the area of Jaswant Nagar in Khanewal, a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry.
