Khatoon is a very hardworking woman, managing her household duties very well, along with her business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her boutique business. She will use the loan to buy clothes, beads and lace in bulk to prepare better and larger quantities of simple and designer dresses to sell and to earn better profits. Khatoon has good experience in her business and hopes that an investment will bring better profits to her and an expansion of her business.

Khatoon is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client by repaying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

loans.use: to buy clothes, beads and lace for her boutique

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma R. is from the village of Talisayan, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Norma is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Norma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the third loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a young woman from Qalqilia. She is married and has no children. Hiba's husband runs a computer accessories store in the city. He sells accessories such as printers, mouse pads, hard disks, memory sticks, etc. Hiba took out a loan from FATEN as her husband wants to purchase a large number of these items to increase his sales and profit. 

Hiba's husband appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories to sell in a computer store.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla P., 31, and her husband, Mr. Sopheak Kul, 29, have been married since 2001 and have three daughters, two of whom are in school while the third is yet too young to attend. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Both Phalla and her husband are farmers, and they also buy flowers and bananas from fellow villagers and transport them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Phalla is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Junelie

texts.en:
Junelie works hard to support her family. Junelie is married and has a business buying and selling personal-use items in the Philippines.

Junelie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Junelie has been in this business for 3 years, and also earns additional income from selling food.

In the future, Junelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell

loans.name: Walter Agustin

texts.es:
Walter es un padre de familia de 56 años, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposa e hijos, la cual  cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque su gente se  dedica al comercio de productos al por mayor y menor y a manejar vehículos de transporte público.

Walter labora desde algunos años  manejando su carro haciendo taxi a los diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Chiclayo como fuera de ella, cuando realiza servicio a otros lugares puede cobrar un poco más por eso le conviene, trabaja en  su vehículo mañana y tarde, esto le permite tener más ingresos para poder solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Por lo mismo ha visto la posibilidad de pedir un préstamo a Edpyeme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para realizar mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo (vehículo) y cambiar algunos repuestos para que siga brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con más seguridad.  Walter es una persona muy conocida por la zona donde vive por ser muy responsable, respetuoso con sus  pasajeros y con mucho trabajo desea brindarle una mejor oportunidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Walter is a 56 year-old father; he has his own house where he lives with his wife and children, and which has water and electricity service.  It is located in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, which belongs to Chiclayo province.  This district is characterized by its people working in wholesale and retail commerce, and in operating public transport vehicles.

Walter has been working for some years driving his car as a taxi to different places in the Chiclayo city and beyond.  When he provides this service to other places, he can charge a little more for the convenience.  He works in his vehicle morning and evening, this allows him to earn more income to meet his family obligations.

It is for this that he saw the possibility of taking a loan through Edpyeme Alternative for 1,600 New Soles.  This will be for maintaining his means of work (the vehicle) and replacing some parts to continue to provide good service to his customers with more safety.  Walter is well-known in the area where he lives for being very responsible, respectful of his passengers and with hard work he wants to give his children a better opportunity in life.

loans.use: to conduct maintenance and replace some parts in his taxi.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Raymundo le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior de un cuarto que tiene de madera. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el materia que necesita que es madera, pintura y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Raymundo planea pagar el crédito con la pensión que recibe ya que los gastos familiares le ayudara su esposa la señora Hilda. 
Desea que la recamara de su hijo el más pequeño este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
In Raymundo's house there is some pending work to finish the exterior and interior wooden walls of a room. He is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials, which are wood and paint, and pay the person who will carry out the improvement. 

Raymundo will pay for the loan with the pension he receives, as his wife Hilda helps him with household expenses. He wants his youngest son's room to be in good condition.

loans.use: to pay for the internal and external finish of a room with wooden walls.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and a mother of one infant-age child. She is 24 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Irene is a farmer. She grows pineapples to earn a living. She sells pineapples in neighboring places. She has been doing this for two years. She earns PHP 40,000 twice a year in this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay labor costs for harvesting and transportation.

Irene has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Irene hopes to expand her business and purchase a hectare of land for pineapple farming.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for harvesting and transportation.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is a hardworking 29-year-old business woman. She is a single mother to a 4-year-old child who is going to school. For the last three years, she has been making her livelihood by supplying laboratory materials. She supplements her income by selling beauty products. Previously, she used to operate a beauty salon. In the next five years, Judy wants to be a major supplier and importer of laboratory chemicals. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy laboratory chemicals to supply schools for educational purposes.

loans.use: to buy laboratory chemicals.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her old father). Rose has a charcoal stall.  She has been in this business for one year and she works seven days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail. Rose has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  She generates additional income through poultry farming. The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to sell at wholesale only. Rose lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes:D. 52 años ella se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales,nos cuenta que esta contenta porque le ha ido bien en su negocio,y le gusta muchos su negocio porque le gustan los animales,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales para crianza como cerdos,ganados.etc el sueño D. ella es agrandar mas su venta y tener una cantidad mas granD. D. animales para la venta y D. la misma manera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Mercedes:D. 52 años ella se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales,nos cuenta que esta contenta porque le ha ido bien en su negocio,y le gusta muchos su negocio porque le gustan los animales,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. animales para crianza como cerdos,ganados.etc el sueño D. ella es agrandar mas su venta y tener una cantidad mas granD. D. animales para la venta y D. la misma manera aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de Animales Para Crianza.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.fr:
Etienne  est né au Rwanda et a 48 ans. Il est marie et il a 6 enfants de 3 à 12 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. .Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans poste primaire. Etienne est salarie. C’est son troisième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter du ciment, les fenêtres et des portes pour le finissage de sa maison de location en vue d’augmenter la valeur de sa maison pour avoir plus des revenues.  
Son stratégie pour la croissance de son business est réhabiliter sa maison pour avoir beaucoup plus les revenue. Dans les prochaines années, Etienne voudrait continuer à être pasteur et évangéliste, et améliore le bien être de sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Etienne was born in Rwanda and is 48 years old. He is married and has 6 children between the age of 3 and 12, of whom 4 attend school. His own education level is second year secondary school. Etienne is a salaried employee. This is his third loan from ACB, he will use his credit to purchase cement, windows, and doors to finish his house for rental in order to increase the value of his house to make more revenue.
His strategy to enhance his business is to renovate his house which will give him much more income. In the coming years, Etienne wishes to continue to work as pastor and evangelist, and improve his family’s well being and send his children to school.

loans.use: to puchase cement,windows and doors to finish his house for rental to increase its value and have more income.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Modou est commercant dans un marche au sud du senegal qui vent des vetement chausures avec moins de force,Modou a demande un credit a UIMCEC pour augment sa quantite des vetements : pantalons, des chemises,   chaussures pour les enfants et les adultes.Il achette des marchandises à dakar ou dans une grande ville au sud du senegal

Modou est un marie avec quatres enfants 2 garçons 2 filles dont un garçon qui est l'ecole coranique une fille qui soutienne sa mere dans son commerce au marché les deux autres enfants une fille et un garçon pour d'autres occupations dans la maison.

Modou veut developper son commerce en esperant des credit beaucoup plus consequents pour lui aider à maximiser les opportinites  ammener par la fete prochaine de Tabaski,la fete des moutons,qui est tres important au senegal.
texts.en:
Modou is a salesperson in a market in the south of Senegal. He sells clothing and shoes. Modou has asked for a loan from UIMCEC to add to his stock of clothing: pants, shirts, and shoes for children and adults. He buys his merchandise in Dakar or in a big town in the south of Senegal. 

Modou is married with four children, two boys and two girls. One of his sons is attending a Koranic school. One daughter helps her mother in her small-scale retail business in the marketplace. The other two children help around the house. 

Modou wants to grow his business and hopes that even bigger loans will help him to maximize the opportunities offered by the feast of Tabaski (the Feast of the Lamb) which is very important in Senegal.

loans.use: to add to his stock of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Genoveva es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos.  Su esposo es empleado público.
Lleva 10 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir para damas, por estos días se encuentra convaleciente a causa D. una fuerte gripe ocasionada por el cambio D. clima.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: una mesa granD. para poder trabajar con sus telas, 10 metros D. tela, 15 kilos D. algodón, ½ docena D. cierres, 6 hilos 1 ciento D. botones, 2 paños D. agujas.
Su trabajo le quita tiempo para poder atender  su casa por eso tiene una persona encargada para los quehaceres  del hogar, D. esa manera pueD. trabajar tranquila. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda y confianza.
texts.en:
Señora Genoveva is a member of the communal bank Nuevas Amigas del Distrito Calleria, in the departamento of Ucayali. She is 57 years old, married and has 6 children. He husband is a public employee.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for 10 years and she makes ladies garments. She is currently convalescing after suffering a bad cold caused by the change in climate. 

With her new loan of 2,500.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she is going to buy: a large table to be able to work with her fabrics, 10 metres of fabric, 15 kilos of cotton, half a dozen zippers, 6 units of thread, 1 hundred-pack of buttons and 2 packages of needles. 

Her work takes time away from her housework which is why she has someone to take care of the household chores. In this way she can work in peace. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the help and confidence shown her.

loans.use: to buy 15 kgs of fabric, cotton and a table.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: El señor  Wilber, nacido en Comarapa Santa Cruz, tiene un hijo pequeño, tiene  una parcela hace 15 años en la localidad de la Planchada a 32 km. De Jorochito, donde vive y trabaja en la agricultura, también cuenta con un tractor con el cual trabaja, el se dedica a la siembra de: maíz, papa, sandia, poroto, todo lo que el siembra lo vende en el mismo lugar,  el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de sandia y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra,   es cliente antiguo de la institución ya que trabaja hace cinco secuencias, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con  el pago de sus cuotas,  se siente muy agradecido con la institución por apoyo que le a brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilber was born in Comarapa Santa Cruz. He has a young son. Wilber has owned a parcel of land for 15 years in the town of Planchada, which is 32 km from De Jorochito, where he lives and works as a farmer. He also owns a tractor that he uses for work.

Wilber grows corn, potatoes, watermelons, and beans. Everything he grows is sold in the same place. The money from this loan will be used for planting watermelon and everything he needs for preparing the land. Wilber is a longtime client of Emprender and has worked in five loan cycles. He is a person who is hardworking and responsible with his payments.

Wilber is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting watermelon.

loans.name: Alfredo Tomas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alfredo Tomas; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de gaseosas, el vende gaseosas en forma independiente llevando a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes, el socio también se dedica al transporte, el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio urbano en el distrito de Calca, por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y negocio de venta de gaseosas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y para el mantenimiento de su carro como para comprar llantas.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “Valle Sagrado De Calca” (Sacred Valley of Calca).  The communal bank is located in the Calca Distrct of Calca Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Sr. Alfredo Tomas.  He is 50 years old, is married and has 3 children.  He spends his days selling carbonated beverages.  He sells them independently to various groceries.  Sr. Alfredo Tomas also makes his living in transportation.  He has a car and offers urban transportation service in the district of Calca.  Through these businesses, Sr. Alfredo Tomas is able to help his children to get ahead.  He wants to expand his transportation business as well as his business selling carbonated beverages.  He is requesting the loan to purchase carbonated beverages and for vehicle maintenance, like purchasing tires.

Sr. Alfredo Tomas is happy about the loan and he promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase carbonated beverages and to provide maintenance for his vehicle, like purchasing tires.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 60, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Judencio, who works with her in the business, and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Norma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 22 years old and still single. He lives with his parent at the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. At his age, Robert has been able to manage their corn field for two years and with his hard work he has been able to earn about PHP 10,000 per crop season.

Robert is a local farmer cultivating their corn field. He would like to improve the soil of their farm by using the chemicals needed to be more productive. Because of his determination for his family's situation, he would like borrow additional capital in the amount of PHP 27,000, which will be used to buy farm inputs to improve his corn field business. He hopes that he can maintain his farm business for his future and do so with his whole family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to improve his corn field business.

loans.name: Stanely Gavole

texts.en:
Stanely used his first loan to rent more land for farming, and he also bought seedlings for planting. He got good harvest, with an income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES). Stanely paid his previous loan well and in good time.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will boost his wife’s business. His hopes to have enough money to educate his child and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To rent more land for farming and to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Agnettah is the facilitator of the Umoja group. Agnettah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnettah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to ensure food security for her family and the community and to have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Agnettah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnettah was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Agnettah will save for the future and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Agnettah with her group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lolua

texts.en:
Lolua is 32 years old and married with 2 children.

Lolua owns & operates a business venture, selling banana chips.  She has many years of experience in this business. Lolua needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Lolua  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lolua 's 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ydmen

texts.es: Ydmen, de 37 años lleva las fuerzas de una madre soltera. Se separó hace algunos años de su esposo, con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos, que son su motor de progreso y desarrollo. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Cuando se separó de su esposo, tuvo que ingeniarse para sostener los gastos económicos de la familia. Gracias a ello perfeccionó la habilidad que hace algunos años adquirió,  “la costura”, pero esta vez de trajes típicos para danzas oriundas de los diferentes pueblos, caseríos y ciudades peruanas. Según cuenta cuando comenzó tenía muchas ganancias. Pues era la única, ahora tiene más competencia, pero ella no se desanima; pues es conocida por su buen trabajo. Los meses donde tiene mayor demanda, son a partir de mayo hacia septiembre. Su ganancias mínimas son de 600 nuevos soles por mes. Ahora ella desea juntar dinero y abrir una tienda de alquiler para obtener una ganancia extra. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, dende está segura que logrará muchos objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ydmen, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá le dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus disfraces de la danza de “trilla”, que tiene como pedido.
texts.en:
Ydmen, 37, has the strength of a single mother.  She divorced her husband several years ago and has three beautiful children who are the ones who motivate her to get ahead.  They live in their own house located in the town of Chilca.  When she divorced she had to come up with a way to support her family.  Because of this situation she was able to put to use a skill she had learned years before, sewing, but making typical costumes for the traditional dances from different Peruvian villages, communities and cities.  She claims that when she started up she earned a good profit because she was the only one in busness.  But now she has more competition.  However, this does not get her down because she is known for her good work.  The period with the highest demand is from May to September.  Her minimum profits are 600 PEN per month.  Now she wants to save and open a rental shop to earn extra income.  This is her first loan through MFP, and she is sure to meet her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  

Ydmen plans to use the loan to buy materials to make the "trilla" dance costumes she has on order.

loans.use: To buy materials to make costumes for traditional dancing.

loans.name: Elisee

texts.en:
Elisee is 50 years old and married with two children between the ages of 20 and 25 years old. She sells charcoal. She works from from 7 am until 5 pm every day, and she has four years of experience. 

Elisee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her business by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. With this profit, Elisee will be able to reinvest in her business and to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Selfida

texts.es:
Selfida, vive en el Telpaneca un pequeño pueblo ubicado en las afueras de Estelí, donde el comercio y las siembras forman parte de su economía. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 10 años elabora como se le conoce popularmente comida casera con este negocio mantiene  sus dos hijas. Empezó con este negocio cuando se separo del padre de sus hijas ya que no tenia recursos para mantenerla su madre la apoyo para  que empezara con este negocio el cual la ha ayudado a independizarse y valerse por si misma. Pues feliz y contenta se levanta a su humilde cocina a elaborar sus platillos para vender y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de comprar materiales de construcción con el objetivo de mejorar la infraestructura de la comideria. Pues esto le ayudara a dar un mejor servicio en un ambiente mas agradable a sus clientes y los haga sentir cómodos. Ya que le gustarías ampliarlo mas y asi poder contratar a personas que le ayuden atender su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Selfida lives in Telpaneca, a little town located in the outskirts of Estelí where commerce and farming are part of the economy. She has been working selling food for 10 years making what is commonly called home-cooked food and with this business she has taken care of her two daughters.

She began this business when she separated from the father of her two daughters as she had no way to maintain their upkeep. Her mother helped her  so she could open this business which has helped her to become independent and to take care of herself. Well, happy and content, she gets up to her humble kitchen to make her dishes to sell and to see that her children get ahead. 

She asked for a loan to buy construction materials in order to improve the infrastructure of her food stand, as this would help her give better service in a more agreeable environment to her customers and make them more comfortable. She would like to expand more and thus be able to hire people to help her with her food stand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to improve the infrastructure of her food stand

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs  avec  MINATA, 1ere debout de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Benkadi 3" are married women averaging 35 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Djigonso, a village in San (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the wet season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with MINATA, the first one standing from the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to buy some farm inputs, seeds, and sundry farm equipment and supplies and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1.5 hectares.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women.

The profits will enable her repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry farm supplies, and some seeds

loans.name: Henry Rodolfo

texts.es: Henry tiene 24 años de edad es de estado civil soltero, vive con su madre a quien le ayuda económicamente, el es una persona responsable y muy dedicado, Henry se dedica desde muy joven a la crianza y venta de pollos, esta actividad es su único sustento económico, el solicita el crédito para invertir en mas crías de pollos, para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende ayudar a su madre.

loans.use: para la compra de mas crias de pollos

loans.name: Gladiz Isabel

texts.en:
I have had my small grocery store, located on one the the main roads to other communities, for five years. Everyone knows me to have good customer service and fair prices on all the products needed for basic consumption. I know that by stocking my store more, I can have higher earnings and can help my family in their studies.

Loan Use: Buying water, sodas, bread, over the counter drugs, eggs, cornmeal, coffee, sugar, rice and others

Tengo cinco años de tener una pequeña pulperia ubicada en uno de los principales desvios a otras comunidades, todos me conocen por darles un buen trato y precios accesibles en todos los productos de la canasta basica. Se que surtiendo mas mi negocio, puedo tener mejores ingresos y ayudar a mi familia en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de agua, refrescos, pan, medicamentos de uso comun, huevos, harina de maiz, cafe, azucar, arroz y otros.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca K. sells a variety of beads. In Ghana, men, women, and children wear beads in daily dress and give them as presents for special occasions.  Rebecca is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and has participated in the TEACH lending program. A KIVA loan in the amount of $600 will make it possible to grow her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mazita

texts.en: Mazita S. was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of three children. She started her business in 2000, with a beginning business capital of $80 selling smoked fish. After she joined Hope’s Group (a DRCongo Microfinance Institution), her business developed. Her current business capital is $980. As the smoked fish demand is high in her community, with a loan of $800 Mazita will be able to meet the customer demand and generate additional profits.

loans.use: To buy big baskets of smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Q. Shamama started her business in 1998 when she bought a dairy cow.  She is now 43 years old, married and has 6 children.  The difficult economic situation in her family pushed her to sell the cow, and buy a calf.  Now she is planning to adjust her business and purchase a dairy cow.  To achieve her aim, Shamama has applied for a loan of $900.

loans.use: Going to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Mr. K. is a vulnerable low income person. He is married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alim and his son (he is shown in the picture) run the family business together. Alim sells milk in the Saatli town, while his son takes care of their cows. The income from one cow is not enough to develop the farm. That’s why Alim applied for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But Alim has some of his own money to contribute.

loans.use: Mr. Khuseinov would like to buy a pedigree cow to sell its milk.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga is 55 years old and has seven independent children. She is an artisan who makes cloth blouses and then embroiders them with colorful flowers around the neckline. She is part of the group called "Mujeres para Progresar," together with another artisan, Antonia Pérez López. With the loan they will acquire fabric and thread at wholesale prices to reduce their purchase costs and therefore achieve greater earnings with their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DOMINGA tiene 55 años, siete hijos ya independientes. Ella es artesana, confecciona blusas con tela de manta y posteriormente las adorna con flores de diversos colores en el cuello. Forma parte del grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar, junto con doña Antonia Pérez López (artesana). Con sus prestamos adquirirán tela e hilos al por mayor para rebajar los gastos de compra y así lograr mas ganancias en sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread in order to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
" A few months ago, I finished construction of a couple of rooms in a lot that I bought, now I need to put the cement roof, but to tell you the truth, I run out of money. I need to put the roof as soon as possible so I can live there with my family ". I’m requesting $800 to put the concrete roof on the two rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace algunos meces termine dos cuartos que hice en un terreno que compre, ahora necesito poner el techo de cemento pero la verdad me falto dinero, necesito ponérselo lo más pronto posible para poder habitarlos con mi familia”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para la poner el techo de concreto a dos cuartos.

loans.use: Put concrete roof on two rooms.

loans.name: Eti

texts.en: Eti is a 39-year-old woman who sells vegetables door-to-door in her village, thus earning US$11.50 a week. Previously, she sold food, but the business did not grow very well, so she decided to concentrate on vegetable sales. Her husband A. has no regular income. Eti is asking for a loan of US$150 to expand her vegetable retail business, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of a business

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im D., 35, is a mother of three school-aged children and lives in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work as silversmiths, producing bracelets, earrings, rings, necklaces and various kinds of jewelries, making collectively around $9 each day of income. Mrs. Im D. has lately requested a loan to purchase more raw silver to increase the amount of products to meet growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more raw silver to increase amount of products to meet growing customer demand.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Grace K.. She is married with two children, aged 14 and 17.

In 2005, Grace established a seamstress business. Working 1 to 4 hours a day, seven days a week, she earns about $10 per month from this business. Grace has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase material and sewing accessories which she will use to sew new stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $15. In the future, Grace also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase material and sewing accessories in order to sew new items for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther C. is a fishmonger. She is a single parent of two children. She wants to increase her income to enable her to meet the needs of her children.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, 55, sells many different items ranging from kitchen products (such as saucepans) to home decoration products (such as curtains). He sells his products door-to-door and travels by motorbike.

His business has been very successful and he has so many customers that he cannot keep up with demand on his own. As a result, he employs poor people from his neighborhood to help him sell things. He enjoys serving his community and because people in town know that he is a generous person they also want to support him. Consequently, people are more likely to buy his products.

Juan is married to Claudia Penayo. They have three children: two go to college and the youngest is in high school. Juan’s dream is to see his children earn a Bachelor’s degree so they will be well-prepared for the future.

Juan has applied for this loan to buy more products to sell, such as sheets, saucepans, and curtains.

loans.use: To buy sheets, saucepans, curtains and other products

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. is a fishmonger. She is married and has 4 children. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then later sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet customer demand. Therefore she is asking for a loan to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina studied cosmetology and began practicing her profession in a friend’s beauty salon. Her friend asked her to stay on and work at the salon, and Karina accepted. Before that she sold pantyhose and socks in anther person’s store. Now she works in the salon as a business partner with her friend, so long as she invests in the business. She has been working under this agreement for 6 months. The loans that she has requested have served to buy the supplies that she needs in the salon. Karina would like to put her own beauty salon in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Karina estudió cosmetología y empezó a hacer sus prácticas profesionales en el salón de belleza de una amiga. Ella le pidió que se quedara en el salón trabajando y Karina aceptó. Antes ella se vendía medias en la tienda de otra persona. Ahora, Karina trabaja en el salón como socia de su amiga, puesto que invierte económicamente en el negocio. Ya tiene 6 meses trabajando de esta manera. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los materiales que necesita en la peluquería. A Karina le gustaría poner su propio salón de belleza en su casa.

loans.use: To buy the supplies she needs in the beauty salon where she works.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío is a health professional; she is an obstetrician. With a great deal of effort, she opened her own pharmacy in her house, which is located in the central plaza of her community, in a strategic area for business. She offers her professional services, giving guidance about medicines and watching over the expectant mothers. At the same time, she works in the medical clinic in her community that is managed by the state. Because of her treatment and the quality of her attention her clients continue to increase. Soon, she hopes to be able to open an obstetric office in her house and, in turn, to improve her pharmacy. Rocío has a five-year-old son; she watches over him and saves money for his studies. Rocío feels satisfied that in a year and half she was able to achieve these successes. This encourages her more to continue going forward. With this goal, she requests a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of medicines for her pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva volunteer.

Rocío es una profesional de la salud, ella es obstetra, con mucho esfuerzo abrió su propia botica en las instalaciones de su casa, la que está ubicada en la plaza central de su comunidad, zona estratégica para el comercio, de esta manera ella ofrece sus servicios profesionales, dando orientación sobre fármacos, y velando por las de madres gestantes. Paralelamente, trabaja en la posta medica de su comunidad que está regentada por el estado. Por su trato y calidad de atención su clientela va en aumento, entonces ella espera próximamente a poder abrir un consultorio obstétrico en su casa, a su vez, mejorar su botica. Rocío tiene un hijo de 5 años por el que vela y ahorra para sus estudios, Rocío siente la satisfacción de que en un año y medio haya podido conseguir estos logros, eso la anima mucho más para seguir adelante. Con ese motivo solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de fármacos para su botica.

loans.use: To buy medicines to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is 46 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three children. Through this business, she supports her three kids in school. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot peppers and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey at breakfast, lunch and supper.

Abena wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the community group called St. Pauls Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to cook the food she sells

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mr. Sokun C. (not in the picture), 52, and his wife, Mrs. Soklay Hout (shown in the picture with new house), 46, who live in a small village along National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1980 and have eight children: one son and seven daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. One child has full-time employment and the other four children study in local schools.

Mr. Sokun has been a mason for twelve years, while his wife does housework and takes care of their children. The couple is building their new house but lack the money to roof the house. Therefore, Sokun is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to roof his house.

loans.use: To roof his new house

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela tiene 57 años D. edad, estudió segundo año D. primaria, es casada, madre D. 08 hijos mayores D. edad y vive en el Centro Poblado D. Acari, Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo, Puno.

DesD. el año 2004 es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” en Acari. Con su crédito inicial D. S/. 300 compró 02 bolsas D. azúcar, 02 sacos D. arroz, 01 bolsa D. fideos, ya que en esas fechas se dedicaba a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad (abarrotes), negocio al que se dedicó por pocos años. A los 17 años D. edad convivió con su esposo y desD. entonces se dedican a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino a la fecha. A los 30 años D. edad empezó a comercializar ropa (pantalones, llicllas, chompas), compraba al por mayor en la ciudad D. Desaguadero y vendía en la ciudad D. Juliaca  al por menor, este negocio lo dejó por cuidar a sus hijos porque eran menores D. edad.

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, aumentará el capital y comprará 01 vacuno mejorado con S/. 3,000 para su engorD. y posterior venta.

Su sueño es volver a vender productos D. primera necesidad  (abarrotes) en la ciudad D. Yunguyo al por mayor y menor y apoyar a sus hijos en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Angela is 57 years old. She finished second graD., is married and the mother of eight grown children. She lives in the town of Centro Poblado D. Acari, in Yunguyo, Peru. Since 2004, she has been a member of Las Triunfadoras community bank in Acari. With her first loan of approximately $100 (300 nuevos soles), she purchased two sacks of sugar, two sacks of rice and a bag of noodles, because at that time she dealt in grocery staples, an endeavor to which she dedicated her time for a few years. Angela has lived with her husband since she was 17, and from that time to the present has engaged in the rearing of cattle and sheep. When she was 30, she began to sell clothing—pants, llicllas (hand-woven Peruvian ponchos), and sweaters—purchased wholesale in the city of Desaguadero and sold retail in the city of Juliaca. She quit that business to care for her children while they were young. With this $350 (1000 nuevos soles) loan to be repaid in three installments, Angela will have the increased working capital to put towards the $1050 purchase (3000 nuevos soles) of one head of improved cattle for fattening and subsequent sale. In order to help her children with their businesses, Angela’s dream is to return to selling grocery staples, both wholesale and retail, in Yunguyo.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one head of improved cattle

loans.name: Lidia Susana

texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Los Claveles (“The Carnations”) Village Bank. She is married and has four children; two are in school and two work. Lidia has a hardware store where she sells construction materials like cement, iron rods, bricks, and tubes. She works every day and her children also help out. 

Lidia needs a loan of 3000 soles (US$975) which she will use to buy cement. Her dreams are for her children to finish school, to open up another hardware store for her children to run, and for her business to prosper. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.

Lidia es casada, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 estudian y 2 trabajan, Lidia tiene una ferretería en donde vende materiales de construcción como cemento, fierros, ladrillos, tubos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Lidia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cemento.

Lidia sueña que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, tener otra ferretería para sus hijos y que prospere su negocio.

loans.use: Buy cement

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel García es padre de familia y como tal desea lo mejor para sus hijos.
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le faltan los acabados interiores.
Está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la mejora y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene en una iglesia, como guardia e intendente.
Él y su esposa la señora Rosalía Gómez desean que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto para que estén cómodos y felices.
En el momento de la visita no se encontraba Don Miguel, estaba trabajando, ya que practicamente pasa muy poco tiempo en su casa por los tipos de empleo que tiene (ya mencionados en este texto). Llega muy tarde y por tal motivo solo sale su esposa en la fotografía.
texts.en:
Miguel García is a father and as such wants the best for his children. With two previous loans from FVP, he has built a room but there are still the exterior finishes to be done. He is asking for this loan in order to complete the home improvements and will repay the loan with the income he makes at a church, as a guard and manager. He and his wife, Rosalía Gómez, would like their children to have their own room so that they can be comfortable and happy. Miguel is rarely home because of the many jobs he has, so pictured above is his wife, since he was not available at the time of the visit..

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the exterior of his home

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is married to Mary Nefor and they are blessed with one child who is below 15 years of age. As a very hard working young man, he has come across some problems in life: his parents interrupted his educational career, lack of capital to expand his business, ill health, and the issue of theft that took away his chainsaw. These challenges made Philemon’s life disturbed until the year 2007 in which he saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member. In that same year, Philemon obtained his pioneer loan of 40,000frs and was able to make his repayments promptly.

Given this loan, he plans to buy timber for 50,000frs, Dunlop for 50,000frs, gum, varnish, sandpaper, etc. for 50,000frs and will buy cloth for 50,000frs. He will commence repayment from the same day of disbursement. He is convinced the business will progress because the demand for his product is high, he has had experience in the business; he has working material at any time. Those in his community will benefit from his business because he will train those who are interested, he will supply them with modern furniture, and will even increase the circulation of finance in his locality.

With the profit from the loan, he plans to buy a chainsaw so as to produce timber and create an outstanding fund so that those in his family can benefit from it when need arises. Philemon prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying timber, Dunlop, varnish

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Esperanza Cáceres R. tiene la edad de 68 años, su estado civil es viuda, Doña Esperanza tiene 2 hijas que trabajan por cuenta propia y no dependen de ella, sus propósitos son mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que tenía que proveer el sustento diario de su familia ya que a pesar de la edad que posee es una excelente clienta sus sueños son que su venta sea una distribuidora para que tener mas afluencias de clientes y proporcionar la estabilidad de su familia ya que en esta situación que nos encontramos pero ella tiene todo el interés de salir adelante con su negocio por muy pequeño que sea pues sus intereses de mantenerlo activo son la oportunidad de su vida.

La actividad económica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 16 años, esta actividad la inicia porque en el momento tenia la necesidad de proveer el sustento diario de su hogar por lo que tenia una serie de gastos al sufragar los gastos de la muerte de su compañero de vida para el año del 1996 conoce a la Fundación León 2000 y se incorpora al programa de recibir financiamiento con el objetivo de invertirlo en el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y al mismo tiempo ha sabido demostrar las cualidades de una microempresaria con una visión bien definida y deseosa de mantener su línea de crédito y dada las circunstancias que atravesó decidió establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación ya que a su edad era muy difícil obtener un trabajo y dio inicio con pocos productos como: granos básicos, hielo y golosinas pero Doña Esperanza logra captar la atención de sus clientes y es así como logra establecer este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar las compras de sus productos y estas compras las realiza en las diferentes distribuidoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza Cáceres R. is 68 years old and a widow. Esperanza has two daughters who are financially independent. She would like to improve her quality of life so that she can continue to support family. In spite of her age she has an excellent client base. She dreams of her store becoming a distributor so that she can attract more affluent clients and provide stability for her family. Esperanza would very much like to get ahead with her business, even though it is small, because keeping it active is the opportunity of a lifetime. Esperanza has owned a local store for 16 years, located in her home. Esperanza was prompted to start the store when her husband died. His death left her with a number of expenses, as well as the responsibility for providing for her family. In 1996 she approached the Fundación León 2000 and became part of the loan recipients program, with the objective of improving her quality of life. Esperanza had already demonstrated the qualities of a micro-entrepreneur, with her well-defined vision and the desire to manage a line of credit. Esperanza overcame a number of difficult circumstances in establishing her store, including the hard work for someone of her age and starting with very few products. Esperanza opened the store with only: basic grains, ice, and sweets. In spite of this, she was able to capture the attention of her clients and establish her business. This loan is for working capital so that Esperanza can buy her products from a variety of distributors.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alfrido

texts.en:
Alfrido C., 53, is married to Susana C.. They have three children, the youngest of whom needs special care and medication.
	
Alfrido C. owns a small house with a small store. Previously, this store was full of various goods available for sale, but when a landslide made the roads impassable to the city, they had to use their goods for personal consumption. In a year time, he was able to take out two loans from HSPFI that helped him start his business again. Presently, he sells food items such as fried chicken legs and cooked vegetables. But he now needs to fully stock his store, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000.00.

loans.use: To stock his store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en: Madina T. has a small home-restaurant business.  Madina started her business last year after her husband died.  She has four children that she is looking after.  The two who are at home helped her start her restaurant and the others who are in school helped over the holidays when they were at home.  Her restaurant has enjoyed great success so far because she sells her food out of her house and many people in her community know her very well, so she attracts many customers. She is requesting a loan to stock some supplies for her restaurant.  She will buy things like potatoes, flour, sugar, salt, and other things she can get in bulk. Madina hopes that someday she will be able to build a standalone restaurant.

loans.use: To buy flour, salt, sugar, potatoes, and other bulk food

loans.name: Jackline Anyango

texts.en: Jackline Anyango O. is a 25-year-old mother of two children, aged 7 and 3, both in school. She is a dressmaker and is wearing her own product in this photo. Typically, she purchases the material she uses for her dresses in Busia, about an hour from Kisumu. She is married to a farmer who grows tomatoes, kale, tomatoes, and onions. She is asking for 30,000 KSH to stock her business as well as to buy farm vegetables and poultry to increase her food security.

loans.use: dress-making material

loans.name: R.c Masomgbo Group

texts.en:
Pictured are teachers from the R.C. Masomgbo Primary School in Masomgbo, one of the villages surrounding Makeni City. This school was established by the Roman Catholics in 1950 to train children of the Masomgbo community, and villages close to it, as future leaders. Over the years, the school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and other professionals in different walks of life. Currently, the school has 554 pupils and a staff of 17 teachers.  

With this loan, some of the teachers will start small businesses, and those who already run businesses will invest their loans into them. Some staff members will be using their loans to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or their own further studies, while others will use their loans for home-building projects.  

Fifty-five-year-old Alie A. S. (right) is the headmaster of the school, and has been a teacher for over 32 years. He was born in Masomgbo village, and is married with ten children – some of his children are in primary school, some in secondary school, and others are in college. Alie will use his loan to pay his children's school fees. Educating his children is a priority to Mr S., as these children will, in turn, assist him when he is old and retired.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old and makes a living running a small general store. She is married to Abner M. and has three children: Janice, 16, Jerwin, 14 and Jennelyn, 8. Her children are all in school: the oldest is in college, while the two younger ones are in primary school. She hopes to continue generating income from her business as a way of giving her children a better future.

Susan has run her store for almost two years. She would like to expand it, but lacks capital to buy more products. If she could expand her store, she could also increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Susan has applied for this loan to buy more items that will satisfy her customers’ demands. She would be very thankful if this loan is granted, and will not waste the opportunity it will give her to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila has been a juice and crisps seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the Nyota njema group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $65. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more fruits, sugar, potatoes and bananas for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for a future use.

Jamila is 29 years old, married and has two children, ages 12 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, sugar, potatoes and bananas for her business

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
H. Hoàng Thị makes a living primarily from raising pigs for sale. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-age children. They live in the town of Quảng Xương. H. has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2008, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. H. is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase new livestock to raise and sell. This will be her second loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

No. 1721080820.

loans.use: To purchase new livestock

loans.name: Puapuagatia

texts.en: Puapuagatia Fafitu, 39, is married with five children. She has 2 years of experience in the food stall business. She sells to the general public five days a week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Puapuagatia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sack of flour, sugar, cooking oil and fish

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Doña Maria Teresa L., reside en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano en la capital de Managua, tiene 62 años de edad, sus hijos son mayores de edad y viven independientes, su negocio es un preescolar,  el cual inicio desde hace cinco años. Este es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por la oportunidad que le ha dado para cubrir sus necesidades en su negocio. Con este préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción como: madera, clavos, pintura entre otros para remodelar el preescolar y poder estar en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa L. lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is 62 years old. Her children are adults and live independently. She runs a preschool, which she started five years ago. This is her ninth loan cycle with Afodenic and she is thankful for the opportunity given her to cover the needs of her business. With this loan she wants to purchase construction materials such as wood, nails, and paint, among others to remodel the preschool so that it is in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel the preschool.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita L. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Nenita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 28 year married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years. All her children go to school She resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with five people. Grace doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She doesn’t incur any extra transport as she buys from her place of work running a restaurant   She sells to 30 customers a day. Grace sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus medication. She has been in this business for the last two years Grace has been with MCDT for four years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil and store other food stuffs like beans ground nuts rice maize flour. Grace and is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger. owning a fully accomplished hotel 
 

.

loans.use: To  stock more  cooking oil  ground nuts maize four nad bananas

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijas en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeña se dedica a la siembra de los productos nativos de su zona, como la papa, el maíz y la oca. Actualmente lo hace con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijas, con quienes se siente muy a gusto de trabajar. Elsa comercializa sus productos en el mercado principal de su localidad y en algunas ocasiones, también los lleva a otra ciudad aledaña a la suya. Ella prefiere vender directamente sus productos, pues así obtiene mejores ganancias que cuando vende a mayoristas desde su chacra. Su deseo a futuro es incrementar y mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
Esta es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y una de las cosas que más valora de esta metodología, es el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de semillas y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Elsa is 55 years old and lives with her husband and her daughters in her own house. Since she was very little she has grown the native products of her region, such as potato, rice, and oca. Now she works with the support of her husband and daughters, with whom she is very pleased to work. Elsa sells her products in the main market in her town and on some occasions she also brings them to another city close to her own. She prefers to sell her products directly, since in that way she has better earnings than when she sells to wholesalers from her farmhouse. Her desire for the future is to increase and improve the quality of her products. This is the 4th opportunity in which she has had a loan from MFP. She is part of a community bank and one of the most valued things about this methodology is working in teams. The money that she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita P. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 46 years old. Pacita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a business cultivating decorative trees for sale. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 brothers. He has owned a bus since 2001 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Mohamad is asking for a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance to the bus after being in bad circumstances to continue his work properly.

loans.use: perform maintenance to the bus

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya T. is a widow. She has a grown son. She lives and works in Novomoskovsk.

Natalya started her small venture selling footwear in the central market 14 years ago. Since then she has grown her business to 15000 UAH in inventory and her business is constantly growing. Natalya realizes lending services are very helpful to her business as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and grow her business even further.

Natalya is requesting a loan of 6400 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and expand her trade.

She is hoping to generate enough profit to keep her business running and improve her living standard as a result.

loans.use: To develop her trade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell sheets

loans.name: Dios Proveerá 4, 5, & 6 Group

texts.en:
Andy has a little store where he sells mainly shoes and clothes. He is looK. forward to seeing his business expand and has several objectives which he hopes to achieve with his first loan. First, he is thinK. of buying more merchandise to sell. Then, he is planning to move his business to Las Terrenas’s main street, which is the only paved street in town and, indeed, the one with more economic activity. Finally, he would like to buy a computer which would help make his business steadier. Andy is committed to expanding his business and maK. profits. He would like to buy a car and is dreaming of travelling to the US. He also hopes that he will soon be able to hire an employee to help him carrying out his work.

Andy lives in Las Terrenas, in the rural province of Samana in the Dominican Republic and he is the group coordinator of “Dios Proveerá”. His story and business are representative of the other group members. Thank you for lending to Andy and “Dios Proveerá” group.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and move the business to a better location

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia N. lives in the village of Prk. Purita Tanulo, Brgy Pilar, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 44 years old. Her husband, Ricardo, operates their motorboat for fishing and also helps her in running an oyster and crabs business. They have four children ranging in age from 4 to 24 years old. Alicia wants her children to finish their studies and get good jobs, to help her husband for additional income, and hopes that their businesses will continue to bring more blessings to the family.

When Alicia was still single, she would help her parents in running the business of oyster breeding until such time when her parents gave her a portion of their oyster breeding business for her to manage. She managed it well and was able to contribute income to her family. When she got married, she continued her business and her husband invested in the oyster business for expansion. 

In 2001, Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have an additional capital for her business. To expand, she needed bamboo, nets, rope and other materials for good results and better income. As the loan continued, she was able to buy a motorized boat for fishing, which was used in catching crabs. In their business she was able to earn a minimum of 10,000 PHP per month. This income was utilized for the education of their children and some were used to defray family expenses.

Alicia's previous loan of 19,500 PHP was fully utilized for her oyster breeding and the amount was fully paid on time without any delay. Now on her eighth cycle loan, the same amount of 19,500 PHP will be used for fishing and oyster breeding.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Working capital for fishing and oyster breeding businesses

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is 43 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her husband makes a living selling medicines and works hard to help support his family. Lola is a LAPO client who sells cosmetics at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the chance it gives her to have one-on-one interactions with people. She has applied for a loan for NGN 70,000 to buy more cosmetics to sell, and wants to extend her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.  

LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and else where in Africa.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Las Delicias Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento LAS DELICIAS fue fundado el abril del 2009 a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en su negocio. Se encuentra situado en el B/ 7 de Julio compuesto por 13 personas.

Como Presidenta tenemos a la señora Elda, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta de bijouteria, comida, costura y sastreria, promotoras de cosmeticos, venta de pastillas y refresco de mocochinchi, venta de helados, venta de horneados y panaderia; las reuniones se llevan a cabo los dias viernes a las 15:30 en el domicilio de la Sra Elda.

La Sra. Wilma es una de las fundadoras del grupo, ella se dedica a la sastreria, vive en casa de su hermana que vive en España, ella desea poder implementar más maquinas de costura en su taller para poder brindarles mejores oportunidades a su familia. 

La Sra. Eusebia sale todos los dias a vender helados en su carrito y cuando el clima esta un poco frio  ella vende pipocas, no dejando de trabajar, ella y su esposo trabajan muy duro para poder comprar una casita para criar a su familia, ademas ella es una persona muy responable y puntual con el grupo. 

La Sra. Ana es nueva en el Banco pero es una persona muy dinamica que tiene en su casa su venta de abarrotes y ademas por las noches vende hamburguesas y pollo frito, vive en casa propia, su familia esta muy orgullosa de ella ya que es una persona trabajadora.

Todos los integrantes estan agradecidos con Emprender  y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Delicias” (The Delightful Ones) was founded in April 2009 by a group of women who wanted to grow their small businesses. They are from the July 7th District and consist of thirteen members.

Sra. Elda serves as the group president. The women in this group engage in the sale of costume jewelry, food, handmade clothing, cosmetics, medicine, beverages, ice cream, and baked goods. Their meetings are held on Fridays at 3:30pm at the home of Sr. Elda.

Sra. Wilma is one of the founders of this group. She provides tailoring services out of the home of her sister, who currently lives in Spain. Wilma wants to acquire more sewing machines for her workshop so that she can provide better opportunities for her family.

Every day, Sra. Eusebia sells ice cream from her cart. When the weather is a bit cold, she sells popcorn. Eusebia and her husband always work very hard so that they can buy a house where they can raise their family. She is a responsible person and one of the more punctual members of the group.

Sra. Ana is new to the Communal Bank, but she is a dynamic person who sells groceries out of her own home. In the evenings, she sells hamburgers and fried chicken. Her family is very proud of her because she is a hard worker.

All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette, 31, spends much of her time managing her rice farming business. She also has a sari-sari store as an additional source of income. She enjoys working on the farm and in the store because it provides for food, shelter, and clothing of her family.  She is married to Hilario and they have 5 children.  

She would like to continue working on her farm to help feed her family but she is limited with financing the business.
