That’s why she joined the  Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to be able to avail herdelf to a loan that would improve her business.  She requested a loan of 15,000 Php, enough to buy groceries and supplies that she needs for the farm.

loans.use: To buy supplies of groceries and farm supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita Z. is from the village of Baluarte, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has five adult children. She is shown in the photo with her infant child. Lolita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling cellphone electronic loads, processed food and thirst quenchers like ice candy, ice water and soft drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Lolita plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Bidemi

texts.en: Bidemi sells groceries and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her years of experience to attract and retain customers. She is 38 years old and married with a child. Her child is 10 years old and attends school and this makes her happy. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
Madame Rokhaya D.  est une femme mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est âgée de 54 ans et sollicite pour la première un prêt de 500 000 FCFA pour les besoins de son activité. En effet, elle est commerçante de divers produits et gère depuis 2008 sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale dans son quartier à Fahu II dans la ville de Thiès.
C’est après avoir constaté que le quartier manquait de boutique de ce genre, qu’elle décida avec l’aide de son fils qui l’a financé, de satisfaire les besoins de boutique de ce nouveau quartier de Thiès.
Cependant, avec l’argent demandé, elle compte renouveler le stock au niveau de sa boutique en s’approvisionnant en marchandises nécessaires.
texts.en:
Ms. Rokhaya D. is a married mother of 5 children. She is 54 years old and is seeking her first loan of 500,000 FCFA to support her business. Indeed, she sells various goods and has run her own general food store since 2008 in the Fahu area in the city of Thiès. It was after having noted that the area lacked a store of this type that she decided, with the help of her son who financed her, to open her store and satisfy the purchasing needs of this new area of Thiès. With the money from this loan, she intends to replenish her stock by supplying her store with the necessary merchandise.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store with various products

loans.name: Agbidi Séraphine

texts.fr: H. Agbidi Séraphine est née le 27 Novembre 1975 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, Séraphine vit depuis cinq ans avec sa famille au quartier Dogoudo à Allada. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leurs charges. Séraphine vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Séraphine n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Depuis 15 ans environs, Séraphine mène comme activité la vente de bouillie de maïs accompagnée de beignets de blé à Allada. C'est également à Allada que Séraphine s'approvisionne. Séraphine avait déjà obtenu de ALIDé, trois crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Séraphine désire renforcer un peu plus son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Agbidi Séraphine H. was born 27 November 1975 in Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic. She is married and the mother of four children, all in school. For the past five years Séraphine has been living with her family in the Dogoudo borough of Allada. The couple care for two other children, and Séraphine helps her husband in handling the family’s various expenses. Séraphine has never been to school. For about 15 years, she has sold cornmeal mush accompanied by wheat fritters in Allada, where she also gets her supplies. She has already been granted three loans from ALIDé, all of which have been repaid in full. Now Séraphine wishes to strengthen somewhat more her business and increase customer satisfaction. This is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy one bag of wheat flour, one basin of corn, and 1/2 bag of powdered sugar.

loans.name: Sharlene Margie

texts.en:
Sharlene Margie V. is a 36-year old married woman who lives in Sawangan Brgy Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living from her general store business. Sharlene’s husband, Ernesto V. Jr., is a security guard. They have 3 children who are between 1 and 12 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Sharlene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 9,000 from her business activities.

Sharlene is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 20,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and had a positive impact in both the business and her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 11th cycle loan in the amount of Php 18,000, which she intends to use for her general store. Sharlene is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which include providing them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: We Are One Group

texts.en:
Beatrice T., the leader of the five-member group called We Are One, is 32 years old, single, and has four children who range from 1 to 13 years old. She was only able to attend school through ninth grade due to a lack of financial support.

For five years, Beatrice has been selling quality cooked food at the Pipelines Road in Paynesville, Liberia, enjoying much return patronage. She started by selling vegetables that she planted herself, and now plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice, oil and fish to improve her business, her goal being to grow and expand her enterprise to other communities in Monrovia.

In the accompanying photo, Beatrice is holding the sign. Yassah is inset at the lower right.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and fish to improve her business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo, de 37 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Marleni de 34 años y sus 5 queridos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Leonardo, es cultivar olluco, papa y habas, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposa, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Él ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Lima, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos mejoren para que se pueda comercializar a un buen precio y de esa manera aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos y contratar un operario para que le ayude en la siembra.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 37 years old and a responsible hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Marleni, age 34, and their five beloved children for whom he wants to have a better life. Leonardo is a farmer who grows ulluco, potatoes, and lima beans. Together, he and his wife work hard to provide their children with a good education. He found it more advantageous to bring his products to the city of Lima where he can get the best prices. What he enjoys most about his job is caring for his crops and protecting them from pests that can threaten his productivity. Leonardo has been in this business for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting his products because the travel can be long and exhausting. Over time, he hopes to improve his crops so that he can obtain better prices and increase his income.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Leonardo feels obligated to submit all of his payments on time because he does not want to cause problems for the other members of his Communal Bank, where he is greatly admired. With the loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, Leonardo will buy more compost to apply to his crops and hire workers to help with the planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & hire workers to help with planting

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda P. is from the village of Bigaan. She is 50 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosenda is engaged in child care. Through this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 5,000. 

In 2005, Rosenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Rosenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosenda from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
34-year-old Juvy D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She has been married to her husband Tirso for ten years and they now have six school-aged children. Both of them want their kids to be given a proper education, that's why they both work hard to achieve their goal. Juvy is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for sale for over five years now. She says that despite the difficulties she experienced with her business, she still continues to work hard for her family.

Juvy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Juvy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 42 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 10 años se dedica en la venta de comida, en donde lo realiza desde su domicilio, o también de manera ambulante, pero cuando hay festividades se establece con una pequeña carpa para disponerse a vender. En ocasiones la ayudan sus hijos en la preparación, pero generalmente realiza sola este negocio. Durante este tiempo ha demostrado tener buenas ganancias que la satisfacen y la motivan a continuar con esta actividad. Una de sus metas es tener un restaurante campestre para tener mayor margen de ganancia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles así como condimentos, arroz  entre otros, de esa manera pueda abastecer de ingredientes y preparar sin dificultad su comida.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 42 year old widow and lives in the house of her parents with her two children. For more than ten years, she has sold food from home and also as a street merchant. Whenever there are festivals, she sets up a small tent so that she can prepare to sell food. Sometimes her children help with the preparation, but she generally works in her business alone. Throughout this time she has demonstrated that she can generate good earnings to satisfy her needs, which has motivated her to continue her business. One of her goals is to open a country restaurant so that she can earn more income.

This is her first loan with MFP. Sonia is happy to know that she has financial backing and is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks those individuals who will approve her loan request since the funds will be very useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of non-perishable ingredients such as condiments, rice, and other products so that she can be well-stocked and prepare her food easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase non-perishable ingredients

loans.name: Kiira Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
S. Soprano exudes self confidence and self esteem at first glance. He has invariably believed in his worth from his early 20s. These traits have been winning trump cards for him in successfully operating his 15-year-old retail and charcoal sales businesses in Kyaliwajjala-Mukono. At 43 years, S. has a success story connected with him that can act as motivation for today’s youth. Most youth lack that self-initiative, which normally comes about as a result of low self-esteem. For this happy-go-lucky married father of 5, a strong belief in your own abilities is a big plus especially from the point of view of running and consolidating any business enterprise. 

S. surprisingly got inspiration from his wife. His wife impressed upon him to try his luck at brick laying. This was his first business and with savings from that, he embarked on his current businesses. In a week, his net profits add up to 105,000 shillings. With this loan, he is looking forward to restocking his retail shop with an array of purchased items such as sugar, bars of soap, salt, plastics, soft drinks and bread that he will at length resell.

loans.use: The purchase of bars of soap, salt, sugar, soft drinks and bread for resale.

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet, de 30 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Desde hace tres años viene trabajando en su tienda, por lo que le está dando buenos resultados económicos, y no se arrepiente por nada del mundo el haber dejado la actividad agrícola. Ahora con su negocio trata de ofrecer productos de primera necesidad, en donde tiene buen acogida por parte sus clientes debido a la variedad de precios según el poder adquisitivo de su clientes. Normalmente traba por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja. Anhela en el futuro ampliar su negocio con la finalidad de que pueda captar mayor clientela. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete en cumplir con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, por el buen clima cordial que existe. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería de primera necesidad, para que no pueda tener ningún contratiempo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lizet is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and three children. Together they live in the beautiful tropical Peruvian forest, located in the Villa Quintiarina community, where they have their own wooden house. She has been working in her store for three years which has given her good financial results and does not regret leaving the agricultural work. With her new business she now offers essential products and she is received well by her clients due to the variety of prices depending on the client's purchasing power. She usually works on her own but occasionally receives her partner's help. In the future she wishes to increase her business to have the highest amount of clients possible. This is her first loan with MFP with which she commits to repaying the scheduled payments. In addition, she is thankful for her communal bank for the friendly atmosphere that exists. She plans on investing her loan to buy essential merchandise to prevent having any setbacks with her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her store with various products.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, de 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical cusqueña, donde tiene su propia casa. A Flora desde siempre le gustó trabajar en colectividad, y desde luego que lo hizo durante su adolescencia, en la cual ayudaba a sus padres a sembrar y cosechar cacao, por el cual afirmaba, que la tarea les hacia demasiado fácil, cuando laboraban juntos. Con esa enseñanza  marcada en su vida, se arriesgó en aperturar una tienda con su querido esposo, en donde siempre le ayudaba durante el día y fruto de mucho empeño y ahínco resultó exitoso, debido al precio y a la buena atención que ofrecía a sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de que pueda captar mayor clientela y por ende aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecha con grupo comunal, ya que percibe un buen clima cordial. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería de primera necesidad, con el propósito de que pueda atender oportunamente a sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Flora is 40 years old, married, and has four children of school-age. The family lives in the town of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful tropical Cuscan rainforest, where they have their own home. Flora has always liked to work in a group. When she was a teenager, she helped her parents to plant and harvest cacao, and recalls that the job was much easier when everybody worked together. With this philosophy in mind, Flora took a risk and opened a shop with her beloved husband. Together, as a result of much hard work and enthusiasm, the shop became a success due to the reasonable prices and good customer service afforded. Flora plans to expand the grocery shop with the aim of attracting more customers and therefore increase earnings. This is Flora’s second loan with MFP, and she promises to comply with the repayment plan, and is happy with this lending group, as it ensures a pleasant business environment. Flora will use the loan to purchase essential merchandise in order to meet the needs of her more demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock the shop with essential merchandise.

loans.name: Luís Wilton

texts.es: Luís vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Miraflores, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero, y de oficio cerrajero, trabaja en un taller como asalariado, con los ingresos que obtiene logra mantenerse. El crédito será destinado para la construcción de una cocina para su casa. Luís es cliente de Impro con 3 créditos. Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito y es un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Luis lives in his own home in La Paz’s Alto Miraflores neighborhood. He’s single and is employed as a salaried worker in a locksmith’s shop. His income allows him to support himself. The loan will be used to build a kitchen in his house. Luis has had three Impro loans. His credit history qualifies him for a new loan and he’s a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus menores hijos en el caserío San Antonio, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar diversos granos, adicionalmente cría animales menores como ovejas para comercializarlas a los negociantes de la zona y también se dedica a trabajar como jornalero en los campos de cultivos cercanos, específicamente en cultivos de legumbres y menestras.

Luis desea implementar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales para poder obtener ingresos mas estables, ya que sus otras ocupaciones sólo le brindan ingresos temporales. Por este motivo ha decidido adquirir mas animales y alimento balanceado para lograr su objetivo. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luis, al igual que la mayor parte de pobladores del lugar, es una persona bastante trabajadora y con conocimiento de manejo de cultivos. Es alguien que diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder sacar adelante a su familia y otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a 38 year old father who lives with his wife and young children in the village of San Antonio, a rural area that is part of the agricultural district of Mochumí. This community is part of Lambayeque Province and located approximately an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Luis has been a farmer for more than fifteen years. He has land on which he grows different types of grain. In addition, he raises small animal such as sheep and sells them to local merchants. Luis also works as a laborer at the nearby farms where he helps with the legume and vegetable crops.

Luis wants to continue his business of raising and selling animals so that he can have a more stable income. His other jobs only provide seasonal income. For this reason, he has decided to acquire more animals and balanced feed to accomplish his goal. Since he does not have sufficient capital to take further action, Luis decided to apply for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Like most of the villagers in the area, Luis is a hard worker who knows how to manage his crops. He does his best every day to succeed on behalf of his family and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase animals & animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married woman living with her husband in Lebanon. She has owned a poultry shop in her town since 2008. With her business income, she helps her husband who works as a driver with the family expenses. She is thankful for her decision to establish her own business and she feels independent and supportive. Her shop is well known in the region because she always offers a good quality of chicken to her customers. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her purchases, her sales and her income.  In the future, she is planning to continue expansion of her business,  enlarge her shop and start presenting chicken sandwiches for sale.

loans.use: to increase her purchases

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Manuela, tiene 70 años D. edad, es muy trabajadora y a pesar D. su edad cuenta con un carisma para realizar la ventas y es la característica que la tiene a ella desD. hace mucho tiempo al frente del negocio,  venD. medicina natural, es casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 20 y 26 años D. edad, estos trabajan y le ayudan para los gastos del hogar, residen en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel y el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal D. este mismo lugar, trabajando desD. las 7 D. la mañana hasta 5 D. la tarD..
Actualmente quiere invertir en el negocio para mejorar su atención a los clientes contando con más medicinas y para distintas enfermedades es por eso que hoy solicita un préstamo para solventar esta situación ayudándole a seguir con un negocio más fuerte y capaz D. satisfacer la demanda D. los clientes.
  El objetivo D. ella es tener un negocio estable y generar para su familia los ingresos que sean suficientes para cubrir las necesidades.
texts.en:
Manuela is 70 years old.  She is very hard working and, in spite of her age, has charisma which she employs when making her sales.  This is a trait which she has had for a long time when working in her business.  She sells natural medicines, is married and lives with her husband and two children who are 20 and 26 years old.  Her children both work and help her with household expenses.  They live in the El Transito department in San Miguel and the business is located in the town market.  She works from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.

Manuela would like to invest in the business in order to improve her service to her customers by stocking more medicines for different illnesses.  She is requesting a loan to achieve this goal.  It will help her to continue with a stronger business which is able to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Manuela's goal is to have a stable business and make sufficient profits to cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of natural medicines

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha R. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Editha is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés, de 56 años, está casado con alejandrina, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Eulalia, de 16 y Rosario, de 15 años. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio. Este alegre y pícaro hombre, pasa la mayor parte del día en sus terrenos agrícolas; donde cada día agradece a Dios por la tranquilidad que recibe, y los 10 años que tiene dedicándose a lo que más le gusta “la agricultura”. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátanos, pero desde hace un tiempo el apoyo mancomunado de los habitantes de su comunidad, le sirvió para incrementar sus plantaciones gracias a la cooperativa, que formaron, donde el café que siembra tienen mayor precio de venta. Pero consiente que le falta trabajar en la calidad de sus granos, está saliendo a la ciudad de La Merced, para poder incrementar sus ganancias y poder invertir más en el logro de sus objetivos, que es aumentar sus sembríos de café. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y siente que su banco comunal, le enseñó muchas cosas para salir adelante en sus problemas con su sembrío, por ello agradece los consejos recibidos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de 20 sacos de abono, que oscila entre los S/. 180.00 nuevos soles cada una.
texts.en: Andrés, 56, is married to forty-six-year-old Alejandrina.  They have 5 children, but only two of them - Eulalia, 16, and Rosario, 15 - live with their parents.  They are a close family and live in their own home in Sanchirio.  Andrés is cheerful and crafty.  He spends most of his day at his cultivated plots, where every day he thanks God for his tranquil life and the 10 years he has spent working as a farmer, which he enjoys more than anything.  His principal crops are coffee and bananas, but some time ago he joined other members of his community in forming a cooperative to increase plantings of coffee and obtain a better price for their coffee.  But agreeing that he needs to work more to produce high-quality coffee, he is going to the city of La Merced to increase his earnings and invest more in reaching his goal, which is to increase his culitvation of coffee.  This is his fourth loan from MFP (local lending institution), and he feels that his village bank has taught him many things about resolving agricultural problems.  He is grateful for this advice.  And because of this advice he decided to invest the loan proceeds in 20 sacks of fertilizer, which sell for about $64 (S/. 180.00 nuevos soles) per sack.

loans.use: Purchase 20 sacks of feritlizer.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the village of Bato Plaridel. She is 57 years old, married and has 3 adult children. Rosalinda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 16th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Phard

texts.en:
Phard S., 34, produces rice wine and grows rice, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for  the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 8 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase pigs to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Juntas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: Es grupo D. personas muy trabajadoras viven en la zona D. Oroncota, la representante  es la Sra. María tiene su tienda D. barrio, es casada,  el préstamo lo utilizara en la compra D. mercadería, como ser refrescos, galletas, abarrotes, dulces, helados, aceite, etc. para surtir su tienda y así incrementar capital D. trabajo, es una persona muy responsable y dinámica, todas las personas del grupo son muy trabajadoras con actividad propia y el préstamo les ayudara a obtener mas ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en: This group of very hard-working people live in Oroncota neighborhood.  The group's representative is María who is married and owns a neighborhood store.   She will use her loan to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, cookies, groceries, candy, ice cream, oil, etc. to stock her store and thereby increase her working capital.  She is a very responsible and dynamic person.  All the members of this group are very hard working and have their own business activity.  The loan will help them to make more profits and to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel E., a farmer, lives in Banga, South Cotabato. His income as a farmer is enough to support his family's basic needs. He grows rice. Most of the production of his farm is reserved for family consumption; the rest is sold to rice traders in their location.

He was glad to join the CEVI micro-credit program because of the micro-insurance benefits. He believes that by accessing funds from CEVI, he will be able to expand his business and better support his family's needs.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino L. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 60 years old. Marcelino is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as snack foods, canned goods, and fish paste in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marcelino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and canned goods. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with eight children, three of whom attend school while five are adults. She has been running a clothing store selling Lesos (Kenyan women's attire) for the last 15 years. She always presents new collections to attract more customers to her shop. She cooperates with her husband who helps in selling clothes to meet the family needs. Mbeyu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of new clothing to help diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to sell shoes, as well as clothes, from her store.

loans.use: To purchase bales of new clothing.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Фазилова Каромат жительница города Душанбе. Ей 27 лет. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. У нее средне - специальное образование, швея. Она шьет национальные и свадебные платья. В основном она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки. Так как её имеющаяся машинка стала плохо шить, и она не успевает с заказами.
texts.en: Karomat F. is a resident of Dushanbe. She is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She has a vocational education as a seamstress. She sews traditional and wedding dresses. Basically, she takes orders and works from home. She has been doing this work for six years.  She is taking out a loan to buy a new sewing machine.  Her old machine has begun to sew badly, and she is behind on her orders.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 47 years old.  She is married and has 6 children.  Pacita works hard to provide for her family.  To earn income, Pacita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.    She has been running her sari-sari store for the past 3 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Pacita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase shampoos and grocery items to sell in her sari-sari store.  Pacita has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. 

Pacita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose K. is 22 years old and is currently in a business of selling alcohol.  She is married to a working man and they have three children, but only one goes to school.  Her future goal is buy more goods.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase buckets, crates, jugs, clothing and other items.

loans.name: Borbandi

texts.en:
Mr. Borbandi is a 36-year-old truck driver. He lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife runs a used clothes business at the outdoor market. Borbandi’s family temporarily live on Borbandi’s elder brother’s land in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. In March this year Borbandi bought a plot of land and now he is planning to build a proper fence using cement blocks. Later on, he is planning to build a family house.
Borbandi runs a delivery business at the timber market using his truck. He has permanent customers who use his service. He will use this loan to buy cement blocks and to build a fence around his plot of land.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks to build a fence around his plot of land.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun is a 37 year-old businesswoman.    She buys all kinds of fish from domestic fisherman at a low price and then resells it at the local market in Siem Reap Province for a profit. From her selling business, Sun can earn about $3 per day to help support her family. In order to share responsibility with Sun, her husband works as a building construction worker and is making an income an average of US$5 each day. Every day, Sun uses her old bicycle to pick up the fish, but it is often late and she is not able to ride very far.  Mrs. Sun would like to ask for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to transport her fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to transport her fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair products.

loans.name: Nerling

texts.en:
Nerling is 31 years old.  She is married and has 4 children who are currently going to school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Nerling runs a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  Nerling has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ginger to sell.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy ginger

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a hard working 33-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with three children aged 13, 10, and 4 who go to school. She has been operating a beauty salon for the last five years as her source of livelihood. She wants, in the next five years, to have opened up several beauty salons to get enough capital to open a hairdressing college in the future.

Ann has benefited from her earlier loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has repaid. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair drier and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier and cosmetics

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta tiene 25 años, casado con julio de 30 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de nueva fortaleza de Mantaro del distrito de Pichari. Marta es consciente de las limitaciones que tiene, ya que solamente curso de manera incompleta la educación secundaria, pero eso no lo tomó como pretexto para no seguir con el sueño que ella tiene, que era tener u negocio. E así que por consejos de su familia incursionó en la producción de cacao. Gracias ala perseverancia y al entusiasmo que tiene, ha logrado unos de sus objetivos, con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida. Hoy ya tiene dos productos de vanguardia como: el café y el cacao, en donde le está resultando buenas satisfacciones personales y económicas, no sin antes agradece a su pareja por la ayuda que le brinda, tanto en la plantación así como en la cosecha, aunque para éste último trabajo requiere de peones para agilizar la extracción de sus frutos. Ya que deben ser llevados a los centros de acopio de su comunidad, para así venderlos a un buen precio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en:
Marta is 25 years old and married to Julio, age 30. They have two children and live in their own home in the community of Nueva Fortaleza de Mantaro in the District of Pichari. Marta is aware of her limitations since the only courses she completed were in high school, but she did not graduate. However, she does not allow this to be an excuse that prevents her from pursuing her dream of having a business. Following the advice of her family, Marta started producing cacao. Thanks to her perseverance and enthusiasm, she was able to achieve one of her goals which was to improve her quality of life. Today she produces two outstanding products, coffee and cacao. Through her good results, she has achieved personal and financial satisfaction. None of this would have been possible if not for the support her partner provides, both in planting and harvesting. However, the latter requires the help of workers who can easily gather the fruit. Her harvest is carried to the collection center in her community and sold at a good price.

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to submit her payments on time. This loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married with two daughters. He runs a business that specializes in vegetable seeds, light-shade clear film for greenhouses, crop protection supplies and simple farming machinery. Some of the attractions of his business are convenient location, a big assortment of inventory, consistency in working with clients and affordable prices. 

Anatoliy has been in this business for seven years. During this time he was able to open two more locations. Anatoliy is always looking to grow and develop his business and improve his entrepreneurial skills. He is very ambitious, determined and is a leader in his community. 

Anatoliy is requesting a loan of 20,000 hryvnas to  help him purchase machinery - cultivators and tillers -for retail sale. He believes that offering high quality products in combination with the best customer service is a win-win strategy for both his customers and himself as a businessman.

loans.use: to purchase machinery - cultivators and tillers

loans.name: Boyambi Plus Group

texts.en:
Boyambi Plus is a Community Bank of 19 owners of small businesses, chaired by Charlotte. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DR Congo to grow their businesses.

Charlotte, 53 years old, is divorced and sells plates, and carrots, and spices. She started her business in 2004. Today, Charlotte is happy to be one of Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC’s clients. 

She intends to use the next loan to purchase some more plates and carrots and spices to resell in order to reinforce her working capital. Currently, she earns a profit of $40 per week. Charlotte’s ambition is to open a store in her area. She is the mother of seven children whose ages vary between 16 and 31 years.  All of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase some plates and some carrots and spices to resell in order to reinforce her working capital

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 64 years old and married with five children.  He operates a butchery to earn a living for his family. He also practices livestock farming for more income.  He has employed one person to assist him in the business.  He hopes to open other butcheries in the future.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dademia es integrante de la Alcancía  Comunal “Luz de la Esperanza” la cual está conformada por 08 socios  entre hombres y mujeres trabajadores comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad.
Dademia tiene 58 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos independientes, ella nos manifiesta que  lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a la venta de queso, esta idea  comenzó ya  que su esposo se dedica a la ganadería (crianza de vacas), con sus conocimientos que el adquirió la    motivo a Dademia  para que emprendiera su  propio negocio, es de esta manera como a progresado. Gracias a  su esfuerzo y trabajo Dademia  ha logrado  terminar de construir su vivienda, y de apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo invierte en su negocio y también los ahorra, ya que su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro donde pueda transportar sus quesos. A fin de seguir progresando Dademia  solicito su último préstamo para la compra de quesos la cual tiene que viajar hasta la Provincia de Yauyos, que es de donde trae dicha mercadería. Dademia  junto a la Alcancía Comunal “Luz de la Esperanza” están muy agradecidos el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dademia is a member of the 'Luz de la Esperanza' (Light of Hope) community bank which has eight members, hard-working men and women who are committed to the 'Prosperidad' (Prosperity) program.  

Dademia is 58 years old, married, and has four children who live independently.  She tells us that she has been selling cheese for more than 20 years.  She started out in this business as her husband raises livestock (cows).  With the knowledge that he gained, he motivated Dademia to start her own business and she has made progress in the business.  Thanks to her efforts and hard work, Dademia has managed to finish building her house and support her children's education.  She currently invests her income in her business and also saves some money as her biggest wish is to buy a car which she can use to transport her cheese.  In order to continue making progress, Dademia requested her latest loan to buy cheese.  She has to travel to Yauyos province as this is where she buys her merchandise.  Dademia and her 'Luz de la Esperanza' community bank are very grateful for the support they receive.

loans.use: to buy cheese

loans.name: Maria Milena

texts.es:
Perfil María Milena
Comercio y Belleza 
600.000

	Es una mujer joven de 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella decide trabajar en su casa hace cerca de 4 años con el objetivo de cuidar a sus hijos y apoyarlos en su educación.  En la parte educativa tampoco se queda atrás, sus títulos en belleza y tratamiento de uñas la muestran como una persona con deseos de superación, al demostrar interés en capacitarse. Este nuevo negocio le ha permitido  brindarles apoyo económico para la  educación de sus hijos. Muy ordenada en su actividad, lleva un libro diario con sus cuentas y elabora su contabilidad mensual, por lo que sabe exactamente cuánto le entra y cuanto sale de su negocio. Su Tienda Milena, está inscrita en la municipalidad por lo que su negocio cuenta con todos los permisos para su funcionamiento. El cual  Inició con un dinero que su esposo le dio su esposo,  70000 colones,  con el cual invirtió en mercadería, con este capital empezó a desarrollar su negocio y le ha permitido capacitarse para diversificar sus servicios (tratamiento de uñas).

	En lo que respecta a la parte económica  la actividad tiene una recuperación semanal, una vez realizado el análisis de sus libros, se obtiene que sus ingresos generen una utilidad de   71000 colones, incluyendo la cuota del préstamo y el pago a proveedores, lo que indica su capacidad para cubrir el pago de esta operación.

	 En su casa cuenta con un local y su Tienda Milena está legalmente inscrita, está llevando su tercer curso en un conocido Instituto especializado  en Costa Rica  de estética corporal y ha empezado a trabajar desde hace 2 años el cuido de pies y uñas. Cuenta con el equipo de belleza. En lo que respecta al comercio, maneja una cartera de clientes a crédito, los cuales le están comprando constantemente, gracias a sus facilidades de pago. 

	El préstamo se va a utilizar para la compra de mercadería (ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, ropa interior) y materiales (esmaltes, y otros para pies y uñas) Con esto espera incrementar los ingresos de su actividad ya que una limitante ha sido el capital de trabajo, pero después que asistió a una reunión y escuchó de Fundación Mujer  y Kiva, vio la posibilidad de cumplir sus sueños, que es  empezar a ahorrar para su casa propia y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad en sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
María Milena Profile
Business and Beauty
600,000 CRC 

She is a young woman, thirty years old, married, and with two small children. She decided to work from her home four years ago with the intention of caring for her children and providing for their education. As far as education is concerned, she is not behind. Her certificates in beauty and nail care demonstrate that she is a person who wishes to do better, especially by showing her interest in preparing herself professionally. This new business has provided her the opportunity to offer financial support for her children’s education. She is very organized, carries a journal with her accounts and takes care of her monthly bookkeeping. As a result, she knows exactly how much her business brings in and how much she spends on expenses. Her store, Tienda Milena, is registered with the municipality, and so her business possesses all necessary permits to operate. She started her business with 70,000 CRC [$140] that her husband gave her, which she invested in merchandise. With this capital she began to develop her business, which has allowed her the training to diversify her services (nail care).
With respect to the financial aspect of her business, it recovers weekly. An analysis of her books shows that her revenues generate a profit of 71,000 CRC [$140], including the loan payment and supplier payments, which indicates her ability to cover the cost of this transaction.
Her place of business is in her house, and her store Tienda Milena is legally registered. She is currently in her third year at a well-regarded institute in Costa Rica that specializes in body cosmetics, and began to work on foot and nail care two years ago. She has the support of a team of beauticians. With respect to business, she manages a portfolio of clients on credit who, thanks to her credit facilities, are constantly making purchases.
The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (clothing, perfume, cosmetics, and undergarments) and materials (nail polish and others for feet and nails). With this loan, she hopes to increase her business revenues since working capital has been a limiting factor. After attending a meeting and hearing about the Fundación Mujer and Kiva, she saw the possibility of realizing her dreams of starting to save for her own house and to be able to offer her children a better quality education so that they can have professional careers.

loans.use: To invest in her beauty and nail care business, with a portion for the purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carnes, ella vende en el mercado de Calca, la socia también se dedica al negocio de llevar productos como verduras a lugares como Espinar, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de carnes y negocio de venta de productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor y para comprar verduras como cebollas, tomates y zanahorias al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María Elena, 49, belongs to the “Valle Sagrado de Calca” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.  She’s married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with meat sales in the Calca market.  She also takes products like vegetables to places like Espinar.  Through these small businesses she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the meat sales and the products sales business.  She requests a loan to buy meat at wholesale and to buy vegetables like onions, tomatoes and carrots at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale and to buy vegetables like onions, tomatoes and carrots at wholesale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes aims to improve her family's status of living and give her children a bright future. She is engaged in a candymaking business to generate additional income. She is 53 years old and has three school-aged children. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she sacrifices her time by making and selling candies on the school campus to finance the education of the children. She wants them to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy eggs, flour, sugar, sticks, and plastics needed in making candies. She believes that through this loan, she will make and produce more candies to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow and that it becomes viable of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, sugar, sticks, and plastics needed in making candies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and has three children; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in Yei South Sudan for five years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase maize and ground nuts. She hopes to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, ground nuts, and avocado for sale.

loans.name: Kav's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kav, 42, is a group leader in this team that consists of four members, three of whom work in fields related to the fishing business, while the other one sells merchandise. People in this group have different purposes in using this fund. 

Mr. Kav works on the River of Tonle Sap from Siem Reap province. He earns a living by catching fish from this river alongside his wife. Fishing provides the sole income for this family. Together, they typically earn an average of $8.50 per day through his business. Recently Mr. Kav has encountered difficulty because the machine of his fishing boat is old and breaks down too often, which affects his income. Thus, he decided to take out a loan from HKL, a L.-standing partner of Kiva to purchase a new machine to replace the old one. He is very happy and thankful to all Kiva’s lenders who kindly help him and his group members.

loans.use: to replace the machine in his boat.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: Zakia is married and has one child, age 1. Zakia sells bread. She would like a loan to buy more baking powder, sugar, and baking items to make more bread to sell. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and create savings for her future. She would love to see her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more baking powder, sugar for making breads.

loans.name: Luafulufa

texts.en:
Luafulufa is 38 years of age and married, with five children.  She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Luafulufa needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Luafulufa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Luafulufa 's third loan with SPBD. 


*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Elda Soray

texts.en:
Elda is 40 years old and resides in Cofradía, a town located on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula. Elda is single and doesn't have any children. For the past two years, she's been running a pulpería where she sells trinkets and groceries like soda, dairy products, meat, snacks (chips and cookies), fruits and bread. Her grocery store is open seven days a week and she attends clients from eight a. m. to 11 p. m. 

Over the years, Elda has invested her time and money in the pulpería, which has allowed it to grow steadily. Elda will use this 15,000 Lempira (HNL) loan from ODEF to increase her inventory with the purchase of soft drinks, snack foods and dairy products. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and that her quality of life will continue to improve.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, snack foods, and dairy products.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 34-years-old and married to Peter. They have four children.

She has been in business for the last 6 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 5,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 30,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more stock of vegetables for selling and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino tiene 46 años, está casado con Cerafina de 47 años, fruto de este gran amor tienen  4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre, del distrito de LLochegua. Marino se dedica a las labores agrícolas, cultiva cacao, plátano y papaya. En un incio, hace más de 20 años solo contaba con una pequeña parcela agrícola, en donde habia algunas plantas de cacao. Pero con el tiempo fue aumentando y esto es gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos que intervenian en el trabajo agrícola, así lograron contratar personal para que lo ayudase en la faena. En un futuro desea abrir un hostal para vivir de las rentas. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles invertirá en preparar un nuevo campo agrícola para instalar plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Marino is 46 years old, married to Cerafina who is 47, and the fruit of this great love is 4 children. They live together in their own house located in the population center of Canayre in Llochegua district.

Marino works in agriculture, cultivating cacao (chocolate), plaintain, and papaya. Initially, more than 20 years ago, he only had a small parcel of agricultural land with just a few cacao plants. But in time, this grew, thanks to the help of his children who became involved in the agricultural work. Now he contracts personnel to help him in the task. In the future Marino hopes to open a boarding house and live off the income.

This will be Marino's 3rd loan through MFP, and he promises to make the payments promptly. He will use these 3,000 new sols to prepare a new agricultural field for planting cacao.

loans.use: to contract laborers to prepare a new field for cultivating cacao (chocolate).

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is from the village of Minadze, South Georgia. He is 64 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Noemzar, two sons aged 36 and 21, and his mother. 

All the members of the family are involved in the family's agricultural business, which is their main source of income. They have a dairy farm. Suliko and Noemzar produce cheese and sell it on local market. The family has 30 years experience in dairy farming. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including the monthly pension of Suliko’s mother. 

Suliko requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow. The family will be able to produce and sell more cheese and increase their income. According to Suliko’s plan, part of the additional income will be reinvested in the agricultural business and the rest will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala , Uganda. She is married with three children, all attending school.  She operates a boutique selling used clothes. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges include seasonality of used clothes.  She also takes care of one additional family members. The family lives in a house with access to  piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food. She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her goal is to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 53-year-old married father of two. His children are 12 and 11 years old. Their family lives in the city of Korce, where both he and his wife work for a monthly minimum pay that is not enough, according to the national family living standards.

This is what urged them to start a rural activity by investing in 20 goats. The old building situated on their elderly parents' 3.3 dynym (0.82 acre) property, seen in the background of the photograph, would be used as a stable for the animals.

"We have been struggling financially for years and our children along with us. We now want to move to the village and run our rural activity. This will be a good opportunity for our children too, to grow well and breathe fresh air and experience first-hand all the great things rural life offers to humanity," said an excited Omar to the loan officer during the interview.

loans.use: to start up a rural activity by buying 20 goats

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 35 years old father of 2 school-aged children and lives in Dusheti district. He has wife, who is temporarily unemployed and only income, that family gets is from hiring a phaeton. He gets private orders and gets approximately 400 GEL per month. It is hardly enough on food for 4 members-family for covering even basic needs. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Giorgi has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of an agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 
Giorgi will buy a milked-cow and start production of cheese and sell it at the open market.
As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase greatly. Giorgi and his wife will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves.

loans.use: To buy a milked-cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Martha Lilian

texts.en:
I have a grocery store in which I sell products for daily use like rice, bread, milk, eggs, coffee and other items. It is located en the Montañita, a community in which there are not many businesses and the demand is strong. I need the financing to increase my inventory and to increase sales, so that I can help and support my family more.

Loan Use: milk, bread, eggs, cheese, butter, drinks, over the counter drugs

Tengo una pulperia en la que vendo productos de consumo popular como arroz, pan, leche, huevos, cafe y otros. Esta ubicada en la Montañita una comunidad en la que no hay muchos negocios y la demanda es grande, el financiamiento lo necesito para incrementar mi inventario y mejorar las ventas, para poder ayudar y apoyar mas a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de leche, pan, huevos, queso, mantequilla, refrescos, medicamentos de uso comun.

loans.name: Manka Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a monogamist, married to Ade Marcus with six children. The death of both parents when she was still young left her with responsibilities that she was ill-prepared for. So getting younger ones and her children through school is her dream since she lost her parents. She has received training in crop cultivation, business techniques, credit and other survival skills. With constant supervision and support from group members she took her first loan of $40 in 2003, and two subsequent loans in 2004 and 2005. From previous investment she succeeded in providing lunch at job sites.

With a loan of $500, she plans to increase her stock by buying a truck load of firewood to provide dry cooking fuel to households in the community. She will also buy fertilizer, groundnut, yam, sweet yam and corn seeds. 

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first  repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Firewood selling and crop cultivation

loans.name: Nazile

texts.en: Nazile is a Deplaced Person from the occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. She fled to Baku in 1993. She is married, and has two children. She started her business in 1997. She plans to borrow a loan of $1200 from Normicro Baku branch to purchase more computers.

loans.use: To increase the number of computers

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.es:
Karina is married and has two chilren, a girl age 4 and a boy age 2. Her husband works as a laborer. She started her business because they needed another income to help with the expenses of the household, since her husband's salary did not cover them. Because her children were little, she needed to evaluate various options to not leave her children alone, and a friend recommended catalog sales. She decided to do that, so she could be at home and not neglect her children. She started selling shoes by catalog among her relatives and neighbors, and now she has a portfolio of regular clients.

Karina is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to fill the orders she already has from her customers, in order to maintain them, to meet their demand, and to have stock. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She thanks you for your support in fulfilling her orders, and even more for helping her get ahead and be able to offer a better quality of life to her family and little children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Karina esta casada y tiene dos hijos, una mujer D. 4 años D. edad y un hombre D. 2 años D. edad, su esposo trabaja como obrero. ElL. empezó su negocio por L. necesidad D. obtener otro ingreso para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, ya que con su sueldo no les alcanzaba, pero como sus hijos estaban pequeños, elL. tuvo que evaluar varias opciones para no dejar solos a sus niños, una amiga le recomendó L. venta por catálogo y elL. decidió dedicarse a ello y así estaba en su hogar y no descuidaba a sus hijos. Empezó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo con sus familiares y vecinas y ahora ya tiene una cartera D. clientes frecuentes.

Karina está solicitando un préstamo por L. cantidad D. US $ 250 para poder surtir los pedidos que ya tiene D. sus clientes y así mantenerlos y poder cubrir su demanda y tener stock, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, y te agradece tu apoyo para que pueda cumplir con sus pedidos y sobre todo por ayudarL. a salir adelante y poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus pequeños hijos y familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Madam Rugiatu B. is thirty years old and married with four children.  Her husband is a primary teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet the family's expenses.  To supplement her husband’s salary, Rugiatu runs a palm oil shop where she sells to retailers on wholesale.  With the previous loan, she increased the capacity of her business.  She is requesting more loans to purchase 55 gallons of palm oil to meet the demand of her customers and double her profit.

loans.use: Increase wholesale items for sale.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada is a hard working entrepeneur from Huancayo. Her shingle business was started a generation ago by her parents. Fourteen years ago she married and now she has two young children. The children are a great source of joy for the blessed couple.

Thanks to their business, Ada and her husband have been able to provide an education to their offspring. She is very happy with the scholastic aptitudes of her children and one of her greatest wishes is for them to become succesful in life.

Ada would like to improve her family´s quality of life which she will accomplish through self-sacrifice and hard work. To this end, she addresses herself to your generous hearts to obtain the $850 in financing to start her projects as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Ada es una mujer emprendedora que día a día trabaja diligentemente para generar el sustento diario de su querida familia, ella es natural de Huancayo y de sus padres heredó el oficio de fabricar tejas (láminas fabricadas de arcilla) que sirven para techar las casas construidas de material rústico.Su labor se acentúo hace 14 años cuando contrajo matrimonio con su querido compañero y fruto del gran amor que se tienen actualmente cobijan en su hogar con mucho cariño a sus dos pequeños niños quienes les dan mucha alegría y sentido a sus vidas.Gracias a este oficio en poco tiempo ha fortalecido la educación de sus hijos y contempla con mucha satisfacción su desempeño escolar. Ada tiene grandes anhelos y uno de ellos es poder observarlos convertidos en unos exitosos profesionales. Así mismo desea incrementar la comodidad y calidad de vida de su familia, entiende que este propósito sólo puede alcanzarse con sacrificio y mucho trabajo y por ello recurre a cada uno de vuestros generosos corazones para obtener el financiamiento solicitado a fin de iniciar sus proyectos pronto.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for the fabrication of roof shingles.

loans.name: Josefa Vicenta

texts.es:
Josefa has a business selling fruits and vegetables such as pomegranates, rambutans (a relative of lychee), oranges, and other produce, buying in bulk and selling individually. She has worked in this business for more than 12 years, and she started by investing her savings (at that time C$2000 cordobas), traveling to Masaya to buy the fruit and selling it in the street as a walking vendor with a basket on her head.

Prior to becoming a fruit and vegetable vendor, Josefa worked as a maid, but she told us that she was unable to maintain her young son with the salary that she earned. For that reason she thought seriously about better options, and after selling on the street she succeeded in saving enough money so that, along with her first loan, she was able to rent a module. The module does not provide the ideal conditions to give her business a good presentation for her clients, but Josefa is determined to work hard in order to refinish and make the location beautiful so that her clients will be attracted to buy there.

Josefa is a single mother who is happy to see that her son has done well in his studies. She is satisfied because she feels confident that her economic situation is getting better and her child will be able to attend the university. She is hopeful that through loans she will be able to reach a better quality of life, and her business capital will grow little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Josefa tiene un negocio de ventas de frutas y verduras, tales como Granadilla, Mamon Chino, Naranja entre otros, comprando a los mayoristas y vendiendo al detalle. Lleva mas de 12 años trabajando con este negocio que lo inició invirtiendo sus ahorros (en ese momento C$2000, dos mil cordobas), viajando a masaya a comprar las frutas y hacer sus ventas en la calle caminando con una canasta sobre su cabeza.

Antes de dedicarse a vender las frutas y verduras su trabajo era de empleada doméstica, pero nos comenta que no podia mantener a su pequeño niño con el salario que le daban. Así que seriamente pensó en superarse y despues de vender en las calles logró recoger algo de dinero mas su primer crédito que le permitió adquirir un módulo alquilado, actualmente este no cuenta con las condiciones ideales para tener buena presentacion ante sus clientes, pero esta decidida a trabajar bastante para lograr construir y dejar bien bonito este local para que los clientes se vean atraidos a comprarle.

Ella es una madre soltera que se siente feliz de ver como su hijo ha logrado mucho con sus estudios y esta satisfecha porque confia en que la situacion economica irá mejorando y así su niño pordra ir a la universidad. Se siente feliz porque con los créditos a logrado tener un mejor nivel de vida que antes, y su capital de trabajo va aumentando poco a poco.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits and vegetables in order to sell them to customers

loans.name: Ursina

texts.es:
Ursina is 55 years old. She is single and has no children. She is an architect and although she works in her profession, her biggest source of income comes from the three passenger buses she owns and runs as a business.

She tells us that she started in the transportation business 13 years ago ago when her mother died, which forced her to look for something with which to pass the time since she was going through a rough period.

This is how she got the idea of buying a bus to offer transportation services throughout the city of Itá. First she bought a bus with the savings she had, and then she hired a chauffeur, while she worked as a security guard for the passengers on the bus. Later, due to the success of her business, she had the opportunity to acquire two other buses, and to date, she has three buses that continue to make these trips.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase new roofing for one of her buses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Ursina tiene 55 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es arquitecta y aunque aún ejerce su profesión, su mayor fuente de ingresos económicos lo constituyen los tres autobuses de pasajeros que son de su propiedad.

Comenta que se inició en el negocio del transporte hace 13 años atrás, cuando falleció su madre, motivo que la obligó a buscar algo con qué distraerse para hacer pasar el mal momento que dicha situación le ocasionó.

Tal es así que surgió la idea de comprar un autobús que hacía su itinerario por diferentes pueblos de la ciudad de Itá. En un principio adquirió un bus con los ahorros que tenía guardados y contrató a un chofer, mientras ella oficiaba de guarda (persona que cobra el pasaje). Más adelante, debido al éxito de su negocio, tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir otros dos transportes más y a la fecha cuenta con tres unidades que continúan haciendo dichos viajes.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para la compra de cubiertas nuevas de uno de sus buses.
