loans.use: To purchase a new roof for one of her buses. (compra de cubiertas nuevas)

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is Edina T., who is widowed with one child, age 11, and has two other dependents, who are her nieces. Edina runs two businesses, one selling fish and the other clothing, and she requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish and clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati S. is 40 years old and her family's sole means of support because her husband is not employed. She earns a small income making fermented cassavas, which she sells in a local market. Her income of $5 a day generates a very small profit. She is a member of MBK and has applied for a loan of $150 to expand this small business. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand a small business

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
Señora Baltazara Y. A. is an associate of the “Angels” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, Picota district Picota province. She is dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables in the market Nº 02 position 14 of the area. She also sells delicacies in the door of the school that is found in the plaza. The lady has been dedicated to the business since she was very small, when her parents passed away and she took charge of her brothers and studied at night. But she could not finish her studies and began to work in order to get ahead and give her best to what up to now she has continued doing.

With the loan of 1000 soles which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of more fruits and foods such as bananas in bunches, yucca in bags, crackers in boxes, yogurt, pulp in packages, and sweets in boxes.

Señora Baltazara is 47 years old and has 4 children, 3 of whom are already independent. One child is still in her charge with whom she works and who she takes care of so that he will do well and in order to offer him a better future. She plans to grow a grocery business in her house. She now feels good, pleased to be achieving her goals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Baltazara Y. A., es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Picota distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras en el mercado Nº 02 puesto 14 de la zona, y también vende golosinas en la puerta de la escuela que se encuentra por la plaza, la señora se dedico al negocio desde muy pequeña y cuando sus padres fallecieron se encargo de sus hermanos por las noches estudiaba ella, no pudo concluir y se puso a trabajar para seguir adelante y dar lo mejor de si que hasta ahora lo sigue haciendo

Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas como: plátanos en racimos, yuca en sacos, galletas en cajas, yogurt, pulpin en paquetes, dulces en cajas.

La señora Baltazara tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, 3 ya son independientes y 1 esta a su cargo con quien trabaja y por quien se esmera en salir adelante y brindarle un futuro mejor, dentro de sus planes es incrementar un negocio en su casa de abarrotes, ahora se siente bien, tranquila de estar logrando sus metas.

loans.use: To buy fruits and foods such as bananas, yucca, crackers, yogurt, pulp, and sweets for sale in her food business.

loans.name: Erenia Margarita

texts.es:
Erenia Margarita is an enterprising 21-year old young woman who is single and dreams of enlarging her business which she started 3 years ago. She offers home appliances, cell phone accessories, etc. for sale, and works hard at this endeavor so she can improve her living conditions. She seeks a loan so she can buy more merchandise to better supply her business and to provide an enhanced level of service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Erenia Margarita es una joven muy emprendedora con sus 21 años de edad, soltera sueña con tener un negocio grande el cual tiene iniciado desde hace 3 años ofreciendo electrodomesticos, accesorios de celular etc, en el cual trabaja duro para poder mejorar las condiciones en su casa, solicitando el credito para comprar mas productos y acondicionar mejor su negocio y brindarle mejor atencion a los clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of product and improvement of her business.

loans.name: Bassiratou

texts.fr:
Bassiratou C. was born in 1977 in Lomé (Golfe prefecture). She is married and the mother of two children with another child in her care. She sells various goods in her district in Lomé. The income from her husband does not allow him to entirely support the family. And so, most expenses are taken over by Ms. C.. This is possible thanks to the income from her commerce.

But to be effective in this role, she needs more substantial funds for bolstering her commerce. This is why she is requesting a loan as working capital to buy and sell her various goods. Strengthening this business is going to enable the family to rise above daily difficulties.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame C. Bassiratou est née en 1977 à Lomé (Préfecture du Golfe). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants avec un enfant à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits dans son quartier à Lomé. Le revenu financier de son mari ne permet pas de supporter toutes les charges de la famille. Ce qui fait que la majorité de ces charges sont prises en compte par Madame C.. Ceci est possible grâce aux revenus de son commerce.

Mais pour jouer efficacement ce rôle, elle a besoin des moyens financiers plus consistants pour renforcer son commerce. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente de ses divers produits. Le renforcement de cette activité va permettre à la famille de sortir des difficultés quotidiennes.

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Clémence Sourou

texts.fr:
Ms. Clémence Sourou D. was born on March 20, 1975 in Ekpè, located in the village of Sèmè-Podji, which is in the region of l'Ouémé, southeast of Benin. She is married and a mother of two - Rosaline, aged 9 and in 4th grade and Roger, aged 3. She married Romain HOUSSOU, a tire mechanic. Clémence Sourou has customers to whom she distributes corn and uses the rest of her supply to prepare corn paste that she sells in the evenings in front of her home. The costs of corn is rather expensive nowadays due to the world economic recession and rising food costs. Her finances can no longer permit her to buy three sacks of corn, which is the reason she seeks this loan.

Translated from French from Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20/03/1975 à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud-Est du BENIN, dame D. Clémence Sourou est mariée et mère de deux enfants que sont Rosaline âgée de 9 ans en classe de CE2 et Roger âgé de 3ans. Elle a épousé HOUSSOU Romain vulcanisateur de profession. Dame D. Clémence Sourou a des clientes à qui elle distribue des basines de maïs et utilise ensuite le reste pour la préparation de bouillie qu'elle vend les soirs devant sa maison. Le maïs coûte assez cher ces derniers temps à cause de la crise alimentaire mondiale. Ses seuls moyens financiers ne pourront plus lui permettre de s'acheter trois sacs de maïs, raison pour laquelle elle a sollicité ce crédit.

loans.use: Achat de 03 sacs de maïs et 1/2 sac de sucre en poudre.  Buy 3 sacks of corn and 1/2 sack of powdered sugar

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es:
Mr. Felipe H. S. is 61 years old, and a widower. He has grown children, and has been working with Fudacion Leon 2000 for 8 years. Felipe is from telica, but moved to Leon and purchased his own home, where he now lives. Felipe owns a taxi, which he operates with one of his sons. He has been in the transportation business for 32 years, starting first as an apprentice to other drivers and then acquiring his own vehicle. Felipe would like a loan to pay for repairs to his taxi, which is having mechanical problems. He doesn't have a source of income besides the taxi, and his son also depends on it. Felipe's dream is to continue improving his home and in the future, to buy a new vehicle to replace his current taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Felipe H. S., tiene 61 años de edad, es viudo, no tiene hijos menores de edad, todos trabajan por su propia cuenta, tiene mas de 8 años de trabajar con fundacion leon 2000,. El se dedica a brindar los servicios de transporte especificamente taxi, actividad que desarrolla en conjunto con un hijo, su negocio es de forma ambulante, tiene 32 años de ejercer este trabajo, dicho negocio suge como una alternativa de empleo ya que inicio siendo cadete de otras unidades es decir le trabajaba a otra persona, posteriormente se le dio la oportunidad de adquirir su propio medio de trabajo hasta la fecha continua desempeñandolo El financiamiento lo necesita para poder adquirir unos respuestos para reparar su unidad de trabajo, ya que le esta dando problemas de origen mecanico. En cuanto sus condiciones de vida vive en casa propia, el era originario del municipio de telica, actualmente vive en Leon donde compro su casita, le ha venido haciendo mejoras, no tiene otro apoyo economico, ademas del que le genera el taxi, su hijo que tambien trabaja con él depende de esta unidad. Sus sueño es continuar acondicionando su casita y mas adelante comprar otra unidad es decir otro vehiculo para sustituir el actual.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 39-year-old businessman. He is married with 4 kids and is very dedicated to his work. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc in the local market of Obuasi. Stephen supports his family with proceeds from his business. He wants to use the loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc to expand his business. Stephen hopes to save more toward his kids' education. He belongs to the community group called "Nyame na aye Trust Group." The group members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To buy more rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38 year old Shella K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 18. Shella K. has been running a tailoring business since 2003. Her business is doing very well. She works at the business for four hours a day, 6 days a week. Shella K. currently earns about $200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 USD to purchase additional cloth and other sewing materials such as thread. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

Shella K. thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Yolanda tiene 48 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada, madre D. siete hijos (02 hijos con familia y 03 hijos aún son menores D. edad) y vive en la parcialidad D. Alintuyo, distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio” en Alintuyo. En un inicio obtuvo un crédito D. S/.300, el cual aumentó su capital y compró una vaca con S/.500. Yolanda quedó huérfana D. padre a los 08 años D.  edad, ellos eran 05 hermanos, 03 fallecieron y su madre apenas conseguía dinero para comer, no les alcanzaba el dinero y no pudieron estudiar. A los 19 años D. edad tuvo su pareja. Durante 4 años empezó a vender fruta y hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno conjuntamente con su esposo, compran en Acora y venden en Ilave.

Con este crédito D. S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 02 toros los cuales serán comercializados en Ilave.

Su sueño es traer ganado vacuno directo D. Ayaviri y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias, también apoyará a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old, completed primary school, is married, is the mother of 7 children (2 children with their own families and three who are still children) and she lives in the Alintuyo neighborhood, Llave district in the province of El Collao, Puno. She is one of the founding members of the "24 D. Junio" Communal Bank in Alintuyo. In the beginning she obtained a credit of S/.300, which increased her working capital and she bought a cow for S/.500. Yolanda lost her father at age 8 and they were 5 siblings, 3 of whom have passed away. Their mother just got enough money to feed them and she did not have enough for them to study. At 19 years old she already lived with her spouse. For 4 years sold fruit and for the past 10 years she has worked in the purchase and sale of cattle together with her husband, which they buy in Acora and sell in Llave. With this loan of S/.3,000, which will be repaid in three installments, she will buy 2 bulls which will be sold in Llave. Her dream is to bring cattle directly to Ayaviri through which she will be able to obtain higher earnings. She will also support her children in their studies until they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Severa

texts.es: Severa tiene 52 años es divorciada vive con su hijo pedro de 16 años de edad. Severa es una mujer muy emprendedora, y siempre le ha gustado las artes culinarias, haciendo que hace 02 años decida poner un restaurante para deleitar a la clientela con sus ricos potajes. La venta de desayunos, almuerzos y cenas es muy buena, motivando a Severa a poner una sucursal de su restaurante, pero ella sabe que para eso aún debe trabajar mucho más para cumplir todas sus metas. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita Severa ella comprara algunas cosas para implementar su nuevo restaurante.
texts.en:
Severa is 52 years old, divorced, and lives with her son Pedro, who is 16 years old. Severa is a very enterprising woman and she has always liked culinary arts. Two years ago she decided to open a restaurant to delight her clientele with her delicious dishes. The sale of breakfasts, lunches and dinners is very good and motivates Severa to open a branch of her restaurant, but she knows that to do this she needs to work much harder to accomplish all of her goals. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance. With the money that Severa is asking for, she will buy various items to open her new restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open her restaurant with various furniture and utensels

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek L., 52, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and four children. She works as a farmer, making US$1 a day, and is supported by her husband who has a business grinding rice husks, making US$3 a day.  In light of these times of economic difficulties, Ek L. is asking for a loan of US$200 to purchase a cart that can produce sugar cane juice. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of her home for one of her children. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane cart.

loans.name: Maribel Olga

texts.es:
Maribel  es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Maribel es casada, tiene  43 años y tres hijos  de 12, 8 y 6 años, sus tres hijos están en el colegio.
Maribel  tiene su negocio que se llama “IVANKA”, realiza trabajos de fotocopiado, anillados, casi siempre ella atiende  sola, pero algunos días cuenta con la ayuda de su sobrino, si no tiene que cerrar su Tienda  por las tardes
Desde que Maribel esta en Finca se siente más tranquila, orientada puede solucionar los problemas de su  negocio.
Maribel necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero los cuales  serán invertidos en la compra de una cortadora y arreglar el stand del local, quiere ampliarlo y remodelarlo.
Maribel sueña con  tener un propio local muy grande  y también implementarlo con una librería.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of Triunfo Community Bank. Maribel is 43 years old, married, and has three children in school who are 12, 8, and 6 years old. Maribel has a business called "IVANKA," where she offers photocopying and binding. She almost always runs it alone, but some days gets help from her nephew if he does not have to close his store in the afternoon. Since Maribel has been with Finca, she has felt more calm and focused, and can resolve problems with her business. Maribel needs a loan for 2,400 soles which she will use to invest in a paper cutter and to fix the store's stall - she wants to remodel and expand it. Maribel dreams about having a large location of her own that she will also add a book store to.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maribel needs a loan for 2,400 soles which she will invest in the purchase of a paper cutter

loans.name: Ni Putu Raka

texts.id:
Usaha warung yang dikelola Ni Putu Raka masih tergolong kecil dan sederhana.Usaha yang sama pun tidak ada di sekitar rumahnya,kalaupun ada sudah sangat jauh dari lokasi usahanya.Anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah sehingga saat ini Ni Putu Raka hanya tinggal bersama suaminya saja.
Warungnya adalah merupakan bagian dari rumah yang ditempatinya.Barang-barang yang dijual seperti makanan tradisional dan aneka macam barang-barang kebutuhan sehari - hari seperti beras, aneka makanan ringan, sabun, detergen dan lain - lain. Karena keterbatasan modal yang dipunyai, Ni Putu Raka belum mampu melengkapi warungnya dengan semua kebutuhan pelanggannya. 
Melalui Yayasan DINARI Ni Putu Raka mendapatkan dana pinjaman ayng dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya.Saat ini aneka keperluan macam dagangananya sudah terlihat lebih lengkap lagi. Semua kegiatan untuk menjalankan usaha, baik memasak dan istirahat dapat dilakukan diwarungnya. Keuntunagn bersih dalam setiap harinya mencapai Rp. 30.000.- s/d Rp.50.000,- Hasil dari usaha ini Ni Putu Raka dapat memenuhi keperluan hidup bersama suaminya.
texts.en:
Ni Putu Raka is a housewife. She lives with her husband. Their children are married and live on their own.

Ni Putu Raka has a small warung (stall) that sells various daily necessities such as rice, snacks, soap, detergent etc. Due to limited capital she cannot really expanding her business.

She got a loan from DINARI foundation for her working capital. With this she can add more merchandise to be sold at her stall. She can earn a net profit of USD 3 to USD 4/ day.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en:
Maylyn B., a 28 year old mother with two children, grows rice for a living. Previously, she previously worked as a personal maid in Bohol. She was not happy with her job so she decided to get married. Her family has been engaged in farming for eight years. Through her family experience, Maylyn knows the importance of fertilizer and insecticide to achieve maximum yield. 

She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy fertilizer and seeds. She will also use the loan to buy insecticide for her farm. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest. Consequently, she will be able to give more support to her children who are currently studying.

CEVI helps Maylyn grow her business. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is fifty-four years old. She is married and has three children – two females who have completed senior high school. The last-born, a male, is still in junior high school. Felicia lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in Kwahwu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Her husband cultivates food crops.

Felicia is a trader and has been in business as long as nine years. She trades in groundnuts (peanuts) and sells on a small table-top. Groundnuts are one of the popular food ingredients used in many homes for the preparation of soup and sauces. They have a very good flavor and people enjoy eating them roasted.

Felicia sells her groundnuts on one of the principal streets in her community where most of the townfolk are normally found. She says she buys the groundnuts from the distributors in her community and surrounding towns. She wants a loan to procure bags of groundnuts in bulk. Felicia belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure bags of groundnuts in bulk

loans.name: Dioso

texts.en: Mr. Dioso B. is a 48-year-old fisherman from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Mr. B. wants to have a new set of fishing nets so as to have additional earnings to support his family. He applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 for this project. His wife supports him by selling his catch in the neighboring barangay (township). He plans to do his project continuously and be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Ahmad has been working as a furniture sewer since 2002. Ahmad requested a loan of 2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase merchandise for his work. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well and knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and he didn’t have a lot of clients. Ahmad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a new and bigger sewing machine.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Sahliyali

texts.en:
Sahliyali was born in 1970. He is married, with 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in the Fizuli region, in a Kayidish settlement. This settlement was built for IDPs.

He has been in the sheep breeding business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 18 sheep for improving his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 18 sheep.

loans.name: Naziran Kathvein Paloos Sanwal Group

texts.en:
Naziran kathvein baji is the wife of P. S. who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines.

Her husband runs a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo at their home. They both get up at 4 o’clock and get milk from the buffalo. Then her husband goes to the milk shops to sell the milk to earn a profit. Naziran baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for their dairy business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

Amera baji and Katherin baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie P. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old. Jossie is married and has 14 adult children. To make a living, Jossie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jossie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jossie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jossie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jossie is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jossie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario M. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 44 years old. Rosario is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns & operates a rice field business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosario from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
A 29-year-old single woman, Genevie L. has long been engaged in the rice farming business. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl. Her parents taught her everything she knows about farming from preparing the soil until harvest.

Because she wants to expand her business, she is appling for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. Thus, will provide her farm an abundant harvest.

CEVI helps small business grow. She receives loans, training and insurance coverage while joining in the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa B. is from the village of Danao. She is 60 years old. Felipa is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Felipa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Felipa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Sènoumè Anne

texts.fr: Sènoumè Anne est née le 26/07/1970. Anne est mariée à Noël, un couturier de profession. Anne et Noël ont six enfants à charge. C’est ensemble avec son mari que Anne assure les dépenses de la famille. Auparavant, Anne vendait des œufs. Mais depuis quatre ans, Anne vend à manger. Anne vend en effet la pâte de maïs et la pâte de manioc accompagnées de la sauce de viande de porc. C’est à Djeffa que Anne vend ses repas. Anne fait ses provisions à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Anne a déjà bénéficié de six crédits de la part de ALIDé pour ses activités ; crédits que Anne a bien remboursés. Anne sollicite un septième crédit de la part de ALIDé pour développer d’avantage son activité.
texts.en:
Sènoumè Anne was born on 26 July 1970. Anne is married to Noël, a dressmaker by profession. Anne and Noël have six children in their care. Together with her husband, Anne provides for the family. Earlier, Anne used to sell eggs. But for the past four years, Anne has been selling ready-to-eat meals. Anne actually sells maize paste and manioc paste accompanied by a sauce made from pork. Anne sells her meals at Djeffa. Anne obtains her supplies at Dantokpa, the grand international market in Benin. Anne has already received six loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) for her business; Anne has repaid all of these loans properly. Anne is seeking a seventh loan through ALIDÉ to further develop her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, bags of manoic flour, and pork

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is thirty – two years old. She is married and has give birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. She trades in food items such as rice. She sells on a table top at the local market. She also supplies to food vendors. Diana buys bags of rice from nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy T., 36, is married and resides with her three young children and her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorator of handicrafts. Since 1996, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothes to earn a living, typically making US$2.5 each day. She decorates a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and the price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer handmade than machine made. She said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she started doing that business before she was married. Navy T. would like to take out a loan of US$400 to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy silk and beads.

loans.name: Alex Mauricio

texts.es:
el joven Alex Mauricio C. C. se dedica a la venta de producto de consumo popular, el tiene una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de DA "SONIA". esta pulperia es su unica fuente de ingresos, el nos comento que este negocio es muy bueno ya que esta ubicado en un punto estrategico, por ahi pasan muchas personas ya que queda cerca de una estacion de buses.
se siente muy feliz ya que a su corta edad logro poner su negocio propio, dice que trae en la sangre el ser comerciante.
texts.en:
Alex Mauricio C. C. sells basic need items for a living. He owns a general store called DA "SONIA," which is his sole source of income. He states that his business is very prosperous because it is located in a very strategic location with a lot of foot traffic from the nearby bus station.

He feels very content because at his young age, he has been able to launch his own business. He says that retail is in his blood.

He wants to purchase beverages, churros (fried dough pastries), pills, sardines, pasta, lard, cooking oil, eggs, bread, milk, coffee, cookies, candy, beans, rice, sugar, sausages, butter, ham, bologna, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for his work

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y tres de sus seis hijos en el sector Manco Cápac, distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace treinta años se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir junto a su esposo. Adquieren las prendas en las ciudades de Trujillo y Lima y las venden en los mercados de algunos distritos y caseríos cercanos a la zona en donde viven. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso del hogar y gracias a él han sacado a sus hijos adelante.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas para venderlas durante la temporada navideña. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es tener su negocio más estable, funcionando dentro de su casa. También quiere terminar de cosntruirla. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado resposabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos por lo que es considerada un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Juana is a mother of 45 years of age who lives with her husband and three of their six children in the Manco Capac sector of the Paiján district in the Ascope province in La Libertad region, located 3 hours away from Chiclayo. For thirty years she has been in the business of selling clothes with her husband. They buy clothes in the cities of Trujillo and Lima and sell in the markets of some districts and villages near the area where they live. This business is the only source of household income and thanks to it have helped their children grow and benefit. Juana wants to expand her business in the purchase of more clothes to sell during the holiday season. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles to help achieve her goal. Her greatest desire is to have her business become more stable, operating within her home. She also wants to finish constructing her home. She has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her payments, which is why she is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale during the holiday season

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with five children. Her husband is a trader and he also supports the home. She is 38 years old. She owns a stall in the market in Agbor, Delta State, where she sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers. Yams can be eaten boiled, roasted and fried in Nigeria. The demand for her tubers of yam is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. This is the festive season and she hopes to make more profits. 

She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea V. is a villager in Pou Roung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she earns income as a fish seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fish to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Chea V. is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to resell to earn more income

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 7 Group

texts.en:
Lenel is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their six children.

Lenel is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown in her business and her loan amount. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of running a "colmado" (small corner store), by purchasing rice, sugar, cooking oil and other supplies. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing school supplies and to save toward her long-term goal of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil and other supplies

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is 48 years of age, married, with five children. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah's greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication, and feeding the family. Hadjah owns a stall selling second-hand clothes and she serves an average of 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over ten years. She incurs transport costs to and from buying clothes from Owino. Her main challenges are seasonality and transportation of second-hand clothing from Owino Market to her place of work in Bwaise market. She sells retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for ten years, servicing her twentieth loan.

Hadjah wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting importing clothes herself. .

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo manages a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato and his harvest will reach up to eighty sacks of rice. He is 42 years old with six children, the eldest being 20 years old. He strives hard at his work to let his children finish their studies.

Danilo would like to have additional capital for his business and joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it has a low interest rate. He’s now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 to buy supplies needed for his farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Maluku Cell A. Zemeyi Florence Group

texts.en:
Z. Florence is the President of Maluku Cell Group; she is a hardworking business lady, twenty-eight years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are schooling.

Florence owns a restaurant and her business is one year old. She is using the loan to purchase foodstuffs (cassava, sweet potatoes, bananas, sugar, salt, and so forth) for her business. She is a promising business lady who is looking forward to the expansion of her business and to a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant business

loans.name: Alofohoin

texts.en: Alofohoin D. sells flour and cooking oil outside of her home in Lomé, Togo. She is divorced and has four children. She began her business in 2000 and is now asking for her second loan from WAGES to replenish her supply of stock. Specifically, she plans to purchase 15 sacks of flour for resale. This loan will help keep Mrs. D.’s customers satisfied and ensure that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: To purchase flour for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beer and soda.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel P. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Liezel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Liezel sells seafood products. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish and shrimp to local community members. Liezel has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Liezel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Liezel from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora  Gloria está casada tiene 4 hijos se dedica a comercializar los productos de Yanbal, Avon  a la vez tiene la venta de productos varios a través de un sistema llamado cartilla en los que resaltan los electrodomésticos, para poder manejar este sistema tiene que  compra los artículos de contado y para eso tiene que utilizar el crédito, no se conforma con esto nuestra socia a ella se considera una mujer muy activa en los negocios, por eso en la casa también tiene un negocio que es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, como el arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros.

La señora Gloria le ha tocado pasar por momentos difíciles en cuanto a lo económico pero desde que se unió al banco comunal sus condiciones fueron otras. A pesar que le toca madrugar para salir a comprar los productos de la tienda no lo ve como una carga que se le impone más bien es como una gran ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos, a pesar de que su esposo también tiene su trabajo ya por más de 12 años en un local de pintura ella está segura que no es suficiente el ingreso para la cantidad de gastos que tienen.

En los actuales momentos la señora Gloria está muy bien en sus ventas, con este nuevo crédito podrá hacer mas pedidos de Yanbal y Avon y a la vez surtir su tienda, tiene que invertir todo el crédito que recibe para poder dejar a crédito a sus clientes los productos así les brinda la oportunidad que el cliente desee.
texts.en:
La señora Gloria is married and has 4 children. She sells Yanbal and Avon products and sells products through a system called Cartilla, which is mainly concerned with electrical appliances. In order to use this system, she has to pay for items in cash, and her loan proceeds will be used for these cash purchases. But she is not content with just these businesses. In her home, she also has a business selling necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, and other items. La señora Gloria has endured economic difficulties, but since she joined the communal bank her situation has improved. Although she must rise at an early hour to buy products, she does not feel it is a burden but a great way to give her children a good start in life. Her husband has worked for more than 12 years in a painting business, but she is certain that his income will not pay for all the family expenses. Currently, la señora Gloria is doing very well in her businesses. With this new loan, she will be able to purchse more from Yanbal and Avon and at the same time replenish the inventory at her home. She will have to use all of the loan proceeds to grant credit to her customers and give them the opportunity they want.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies, Avon and Yanbar cosmetics, and electrical appliances for resale

loans.name: Julia Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Julia tiene 48 años es casada tiene hijos, son una familia muy unida, por eso aparte de compartir ese sagrado amor familiar, Julia también  junto a su  familia  comparten un negocio,que tiene por algún tiempo, y que ha ayudado para que todos sigan adelante; ellos se dedican a la venta  de ropa,  venden blusas, pantalones y demás prendas de vestir;  sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo, sabe que hay ciertos lugares donde venden ropa de buena calidad, y ella ofrece eso a sus clientes, ropa de buena calidad para que ellos y ellas estén satisfechos.

 
Esta familia lleva con este negocio desde que ella ingreso a la Fundación Espoir, Aura  junto a su cuñada venden la mercadería,  cada mes hace sus compras.
Su esposo es albañil, dedicado y responsable en su hogar y trabajo, por eso su vida matrimonial ha sido positiva, los dos entregan todo de sí para seguir adelante, sobre todo su dedicación al trabajo y a la familia.

Su mayor sueño es poder seguir trabajando, para seguir aportando en su hogar, económica y amorosamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is 48 years old and married with children. Her family is very close, so sharing is more sacred than family love. Julia and her family have been working together in business for some time and help each other so that they can succeed. They sell clothing such as blouses, trousers, and other types of garments. Their merchandise is sold in the city of Portoviejo. Certain areas are known for selling good quality clothing, so she goes to these places to offer goods to her customers. They are satisfied because they know the clothing they buy is of good quality.

Julia’s family started their business after she joined Fundación ESPOIR. Together with her sister-in-law, she sells merchandise and buys inventory every month. Her husband works as a bricklayer and is dedicated and responsible at home and at work. For this reason, married life has been positive. The two of them give their all in order to move forward and are extremely dedicated to their work and family.

Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can have a home that is both loving and financially stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, trousers, and pajamas

loans.name: Nerita

texts.en: Nerita B. is from the village of Awallan, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 45 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Nerita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. Nerita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mrs. Ream P., who lives in Srae Vong village in Takeo province, was born in 1959. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare (5-acre) plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She is a pig breeder, too. Her husband, Mr. Noun Yoem, is a big pot maker who is able to earn some money to support his family.

Now, Mrs. Ream P.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, she is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan for making more big pots.

Mrs. Ream P. is the mother of two children, one of whom is helping her to farm, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and make more big pots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a variety of clothing and underwear

loans.name: Bien Fait Plus Group

texts.en:
Patrick N. N. is the chairman of this community bank called “Bien Fait Plus” which means “Well done” in English. It is composed of fifteen members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Patrick, 31, is married and became a micro-entrepreneur in 2006 with beginning capital of $100. Today, his telephone booth business has prospered thanks to his hard work, good management and determination.

Patrick is a trustworthy client of HOPE DRC, having twice received and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with this next loan by purchasing phone accessories and prepaid cards to resell at a profit.

Patrick’s business brings in $60 per week and is located to the South-west of Kinshasa. His dream is someday to open a large general store in his area.

loans.use: To increase his business stock by buying phone accessories and prepaid cards to sell

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael, de 34 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. Siempre admiro a sus padres, por el arduo t5rabajo que realizaron para salir adelante, a pesar que vivían una época de carencias económicas. Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando cacao, haciendo que cada día mejore su producción, por el cual sus clientes siempre quedan satisfechos, es así que sus ventas mejoraron paulatinamente. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, con la finalidad de que lo puedan extraer su producto de cacao y de esta manera pueda venderlos en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. En el futuro piensa comprar más terrenos de cultivo con la necesidad de que pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente fortalecido con banco comunal, debido al compañerismo que existe en cada uno de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, para ello comprará insumos y abono.
texts.en:
Misael, 34, is single and has no children. He lives in the beautiful jungle near Cusco, in the community of Villa Quintiarina, where he has his own wooden house. He always admired his parents for the hard work they did to get ahead in life, despite living in a time of economic hardship. Misael is a cacao farmer, working to improve his production everyday, for which reason his customers are always satisfied. This is how his sales gradually improved. Normally he does the work himself, but on occasion he receives his family's help with extracting the cocoa beans from the cacao so they can sell it in the community's collection centers. He is thinking of buying more farmland in the future so that he can improve his quality of life. This is Misael's fourth loan with MFP, so he promises to follow his payment schedule faithfully. He feels strengthened by his communal bank because of the comradeship that exists among all the members. He intends to invest this loan to adequately maintain his cacao fields, and to do this, he will buy supplies and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for cacao fields

loans.name: Auria

texts.es: La Sra. G. R. Auria, vive en el caserio Santa Petronila perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Trabaja como obrera de campo en parcelas de la zona de santa petronila desde hace 2 años . Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Su sueño según nos comenta es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para poder brindarle asu familia una mejor calidad de vida. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados su vivienda. La Sra. G. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
G. R. Auria lives in the Santa Petronila housing area; part of the Santiago district. She has four children that she cares for and has been working for two years as a field hand on parcels within the Santa Petronila zone. She has her own home on which she is placing the finishing touches. She tells us that her dream is to be able to complete her house so that she can give a better quality of life to her family. She is asking for this loan so that she can put the finishing touches on her house. G. is grateful for the support that we are able to give her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Luis Alverto

texts.es:
Luis de 52 años, tiene una tienda en la ventana delantera de su casa (sus hijos de 12 y 10 aparacen en la foto), vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Paraíso”. 

Hace año atrás el tenia muchas metas para hacer con su familia, pero cuando su esposa lo abandono con sus tres hijos pequeños el tubo que hacerse cargo de ellos y comenzar a trabajar como cargador en las madrugadas en un mercado para dedicarles tiempo a ellos. Con sus ahorros y un préstamo el pudo comprar víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda en la ventana de su casa, poco a poco construyo mejor su casa y la hizo de cemento. Ahora sus hijos de 16,12 y 10 años le ayudan en la tienda cuando regresan de la escuela. Mientras el sale a buscar mas trabajo para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere con el préstamo comprar arroz, bebidas, azúcar, golosinas. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida y poder hacer separaciones en su casa para que cada uno tenga su propio cuarto.
texts.en:
Luis is 52 years old and has a store at the front of his house (his children, ages 12 and 10, appear in the photo). He lives in a periurban area with dirt roads called “Paraíso”.

Last year Luis had many goals for his family to accomplish, but his wife left him alone to take care of their three young children. He started working as a porter in the early morning hours at the market so that he could spend time with them. Using his savings and a loan, Luis bought provisions and opened a store in his house. Over time he improved his home by constructing it out of cement. His children are now 16, 12, and 10 and help him manage the store when they return from school. Meanwhile he goes out looking for more work so that he can provide his children with a better life.

To continue his business, Luis wants to use this loan to buy rice, beverages, sugar, and candy. In the future he wants his children to have a better life and create separate spaces in his house so that they can have their own rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beverages, sugar, and candy

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Estrella,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Helen is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising carabao (water buffalo), cows and pigs for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Helen is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals

loans.name: Mbijiwe

texts.en:
Mbijiwe is 32 years old and a single mother of 3 children ages, 6 years and 5 months old twins. Her eldest child attends school. She is a farmer from Nkubu town in eastern Kenya. She has been farming for eight years and employs 4 farmhands. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans and potatoes which are sold to the local market.

She has requested this loan of 47,700 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income from the sale of milk will enable her pay school fees for her child and take care of her children. Her major challenges are diseases, poor market for her products and unreliable labor. In future, she plans to acquire two more dairy cows that will improve her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El Sr. Nelson tiene como actividad el servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros, un pequeño minibús con el cual genera sus ingresos para el y su familia que esta compuesta por su esposa y su pequeña hija, su esposa ayuda también al sostenimiento de su hogar trabajando como ayudante de cocina. El sr. Nelson es una persona muy amigable, esta vez solicita el crédito para comprar un motor para su automóvil y ponerlo en perfectas condiciones para continuar su trabajo y brindar un mejor servicio al sus clientes, el esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Nelson provides urban transportation services for passengers. He owns a small minibus that is used to generate income for himself and his family, which consists of his wife and young daughter. His wife also helps support their household by working as a kitchen assistant.

Sr. Nelson is a friendly individual who is requesting a loan to buy a motor. This will allow his vehicle to run in perfect condition so that he can continue with his work and provide good service to his customers. He is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support being provided through this loan.

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Rechard

texts.en:
Rechard A. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 37 years old. Rechard is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, he provides motorcycle (or habal-habal) services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rechard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his service. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to continue his service

loans.name: El Escondite Group

texts.es: La presidenta es la Sra. Damiana, casada tiene tres hijos tiene un local, donD. venD. comida y bebidas,   su esposo es albañil, ambos colaboran en los gastos del hogar, el local  es muy conocido en la zona , como las reuniones se realizaran en la casa D. la Sra. Damiana es por eso que el banco D. emprendimiento decidieron las socias denominar el escondite, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración D. sus ricos platos y también para la compra D. refrescos, este banco D. emprendimiento este conformado por vecinas D. la zona  que viven hace varios años en la misma, cada una D. ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan D. lunes a domingo  , se conocen bastante bien entre ellas en el grupo  existe la participación D. 2 varones D. igual manera son muy conocidos con su respectiva actividad .es un banco muy organizado dinámicos .
texts.en: The president is Mrs. Damiana. She is married with three children and has a business where she sells food and drinks. Her husband is a construction worker. Both contribute to their household expenses. The business is very well known in the area. Because the meetings are held at Mrs. Damiana's house, the members of the communal bank decided to call it El Escondite ("The Hideout"). With the loan, she will buy the ingredients to make her rich dishes and also to buy beverages.  This communal bank is maD. up of neighbors in the area that have lived there for several years. Each one has an independent activity; they work from Monday to Sunday. They know each other very well. Two men participate in the group and are very well known for their respective activity. It is a very organized, dynamic bank.

loans.use: PURCHASE OF INGREDIENTS AND BEVERAGES

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong T., age 34, owns and operates a handicraft business in the province of Kompong Tom. Mr. Kong T. and his wife work together in this business and earn a profit of approximately $10 per day. Most of output consists of beds and cupboards, which they accumulate and sell as sets. Their furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. The couple has two children. Both of the children are in school and (when school ends for the day) help their parents make furniture. In order to increase his income, Mr. Kong T. has applied for a loan to buy some pieces of wood to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To buy some pieces of wood to make beds to sell.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum S., 39, is a garment factory worker in Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with three children who are still living at home, and her husband works as a policeman. She and her husband typically make about $4 USD combined. Oum S. is asking for a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El sr. Pedro tiene 51 años de edad y tiene una familia muy unida que son su esposa y sus cuatro hijos viven por la zona de la colorada son propietarios de casa y además cuentan con un vehículo al cual lo hacen trabajar como taxi el dinero lo necesita para la compra de llantas y algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar , el sr. Pedro indica  estar feliz con la vida que lleva y que a veces el dinero falta pero con trabajo y esfuerzo todo lo que a deseado y querido lo ha logrado y todo gracias al apoyo que siempre tuvo de su esposa esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Pedro is 51 years old and he has a very close family. He and his wife and their four children live in the La Colorada region. They own their own home and they have a car that they use as a taxi. The loan is needed to purchase tires and appliances for their home. Pedro states that he is happy with the life he has and eventhough sometimes they don't have enough money, with work and effort, he has always achieved what he has set out to do. This has been possible only with the support of his wife. He is very grateful to the organization for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is married with three children. He owns a retail business and sells clothes and shoes at the market. Hasan has been in this business for 30 years already. He is an experienced salesperson and has a stable position at the market. He works by himself and knows how to organize this business well. His business goal is to grow bigger.

 Hasan would like to receive a loan of 7000 Somoni to increase the assortment of his goods. Having more profit would help him to take better care of his wife and children.  

                                                                  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more palm oil and caustic products used in the production of soap

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.en:
Maria Elisa S. is from the village of Linangkayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Elisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, detergents, seasoning, spices and toothpaste in the local community. Maria Elisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Maria Elisa joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maria Elisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and beverages. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 39 years old and is married, with two children who are 1 and 3 years old. She also takes care of two relatives. Selina is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Among those goods are cosmetic products like body lotion and Colgate (toothpaste), and foods like rice and sugar.

Selina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of sugar and rice, as they are highly in demand. With this large quantity she will also start wholesaling. In doing so, Selina hopes to earn more profits.  That will allow her to renovate her house and continue to pay school fees for her two relatives as well as to build a secure future for her two children.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Шукуров Махмадшариф проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 53 года. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Махмадшариф предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей по маршруту Гулбутта-Душанбе. В этой сфере имеет богатый опыт, так как он более 15 лет водит машину. Кредит берет для ремонта машины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Mahmadsharif S. lives in Dushanbe.  He is 53 years old. He is married, with five children. His wife is a homemaker. Mahmadsharif provides taxi services. He transports passengers along the route between Gulbutta und Dushanbe. He has a lot of experience as he has been a driver for over 15 years. He is taking out a loan in order to repair his car and provide a safe driving service.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Sanobarkhon

texts.en:
I. Sanobarkhon is a widow who lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She lives with her two children, and that’s why she needs a normal income which can ensure her children of everything they may need. She started her activities in the business of trading industrial goods. Today she sells fabrics in the market of Sakhovat. She has been in this business for 11 years. 

Sanobarkhon would like to get a loan of 7000 Somoni for purchasing new modern fabrics.  She thanks all lenders who enable her to ensure her children’s needs are covered and improve their lives.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est née en 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elisabeth a deux enfants, qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent avec elle. Elisabeth ne vit plus avec son mari. Il y a douze ans que Elisabeth s'est installée avec ses enfants à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Elisabeth assure seule les charges de ses enfants. N'ayant pas été à l'école, Elisabeth  vend des gâteaux faits à base de la farine de manioc de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Elisabeth achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Elisabeth sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont tous été bien remboursés. Son ambition est de renforcer davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Elisabeth was born in 1981 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She has two children who attend school and live with her. She no longer lives with her husband. She moved to Agblangandan in the town of Sèmè-Podji 12 years ago, and she takes care of her children alone. 

Elisabeth never attended school. She sells cakes made from cassava flour door to door. The income earned from this activity allows her to support herself and her children. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

In order to bolster her business and better serve her customers, Elisabeth is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were correctly repaid. Her goal is to further strengthen her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and peanut oil to make cakes

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 41 years old and married with five children. Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy rice, canned goods and supplies for her store. Marissa has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Marissa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned foods and supplies for her store.

loans.name: Yonoussa

texts.fr: Né le 27 Juillet 1964, Yonoussa est marié à Marie une marchande. Le couple à six enfants vivant toujours à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Yonoussa et sa femme vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Yonoussa a arrêté l’école au secondaire. Yonoussa a appris le métier de soudure; ce qui lui permet de satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle et d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Yonoussa désire agrandir son atelier en s’approvisionnant en matériels de soudure. Yonoussa s’approvisionne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Yonoussa demande l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité,  d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en:
Yonoussa was born on July 27, 1964. He is married to Marie, a shopkeeper. The couple support six children, who are still living with them. Some of the children are in school. Yonoussa and his wife live in the same house with their children. The various family expenses are covered by the couple.

Yonoussa dropped out of secondary school. He learned how weld as a trade. It enables him to meet the requirements of his customers and to ensure that family expenses are covered. He would like to expand his workshop by acquiring welding supplies and equipment. He gets her supplies from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.
