This is the second time that Yonoussa has asked for financial support from ALIDé, so as to boost his level of business and to grow his customer base and his revenues.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies and equipment (bottles of gas,crossbars, blowtorches, etc.)

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap, pictured here with her loom, runs a weaving business. She hopes to build and strengthen this business, since it is a traditional profession at which she is skilled. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $300 USD in order to purchase weaving materials.

Pheap is a widow with two sons and a daughter. All of her children are in school. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen forma parte del banco comunal “Los Luceros” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa y producir longanizas desde hace 8 años. Su mercadería, específicamente ropa la compra en el barrio Meiggs, ciudad de Santiago. Para la realización de las longanizas Carmen compra un cerdo y lo faena. Estas compras las realiza usualmente 2 veces al mes, para abastecerse. 
Carmen se dedica a vender sus productos 4 veces a la semana, especialmente cuando sus clientes reciben sus respectivos sueldos. El sistema de ventas de las longanizas, es de acuerdo a los pedidos que realizan sus clientes, en cuanto a la cantidad y tiempo. En ocasiones realiza 40 kilos de longaniza para vender y entregar. Carmen cuenta con mucha clientela frecuente, que la sigue de muchos años. Su horario laboral cuando sale a vender es de 8ºº a 5ºº de la tarde.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para su negocio y un cerdo para la producción de longanizas.
Sus metas son instalarse con un local establecido para vender ropa, si este no se concretara le gustaría comprarse una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería a sus diferentes clientes. 
Carmen vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Gracias a su negocio y emprendimiento ha podido pagar la educación de sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza. Además comenta que el grupo del banco comunal es muy solidario y las socias son muy esforzadas. Realizan diversas actividades para juntar dinero para tener un resguardo monetario. Los talleres realizados en las reuniones los ha podido incorporar en su propio negocio para organizarlo.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Los Luceros" in the city of Temuco.  She has been selling clothing and making sausage for the past  8 years.  She buys the clothing in the Meiggs neighborhood in the city of Santiago.  To make her sausages she buys a pig and slaughters it.  She usually makes these purchases two times a month to restock.  Carmen sells her products 4 times a week, especially when her customers receive their paychecks.  She sells her sausages on a order basis with regards to quantity and time.  At times she makes 40 kilos of sausage to sell and deliver.  Carmen has many return customers that have been coming to her for many years.   Her work schedule is from 8:00 until 5:00 in the afternoon.   With the loan she will buy clothing for her business and a pig for making sausage.  Her goals are to establish a local from which to sell her clothing, but if this doesn't work out, she would like to buy a truck to transport her merchandise to various customers. 

Carmen lives with her husband and their two children ages 15 and 12.  Thanks to her business and entrepreneurship she has been able to pay for her children's education.  She is very happy and grateful for the support given by Fondo Esperanza.  Additionally, she says that her communal bank is very supportive and that the members are very hard-working.  They engage in various activities to raise money to have financial protection.  She has been able to incorporate what they have done in the workshops at the meetings into her business to organize it.  

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In the surrounding area there is a series of lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and striking native flora and fauna concentrated in natural areas nearby.  Notably, 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people, that exist in the country live in this region.

loans.use: buy clothing for her business and a pig to make sausage.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita works hard to support her family. She is married and has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 40 years. Anita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment. In the future, Anita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a determined and hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children.  He uses his motorbike for his transport business to earn a living for his family. Thanks to Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially, he was able to buy a motorbike. He hopes to own a van for his transport business in the future. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón Santo Domingo en la parroquia de Zaracay vive Juana, una mujer de 47 años divorciada. Es madre de tres hijos pero únicamente vive con su hijo de 13 años. Sus otros dos hijos, una mujer de 20 años y un hombre de 23 años, tienen ya su vida independiente.

Hace aproximadamente 8 años ella sufrió su divorcio y tuvo que mantener sola a sus tres hijos. Por esta razón ella aprendió el oficio de "peluquería y belleza". Ella hoy en día tiene su gabinete de belleza en un local propio, está orgullosa de su esfuerzo ya que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ama su trabajo. Su hijo que ya no vive con ella trabaja vendiendo mariscos la visita constantemente y le ayuda en algunas actividades del negocio.

Su gran meta es comprarse un auto nuevo para así movilizarse con mayor facilidad y poder compartir más tiempo con sus hijos. Ella solicitó un crédito en Fundación Alternativa para mejorar su negocio, comprando mobiliario nuevo para atraer a más clientes y así lograr su ansiada meta.

Esta mujer que con empeño ha sabido superar sus obstáculos hoy nos cuenta con mucha alegría que sus sacrificios han dado frutos ya que ejerce su profeción con mucha alegría y tiene cerca a sus hijos. Ahora el siguiente paso es mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the Santo Domingo canton in the Zaracay parish.  She is 47 years old and divorced.  She has three children, but only her 13 year old son lives with her.  Her other two children are a 20 year old woman and a 23 year old man.  They have their own independent lives.

Approximately eight years ago she suffered through a divorce.  She had to support her three children alone.  That is why she learned the hairdressing and beautician profession.  She now has her beauty station in her own locale. 

She is proud of her effort because she has known how to get her children ahead, and she loves her work.  Her son that no longer lives with her works selling seafood.  He visits her all of the time, and he helps her with some activities in her business.

Her big goal is to buy a new car in order to move around easier and to be able to share more time with her children.  She requested a loan from the Fundación Alternativa in order to improve her business.   She will buy new furnishing in order to attract more customers. That way she will achieve the goal that she longs for.

With determination this woman has known how to overcome obstacles.  She now very happily tells us that her sacrifices have born fruit.  She practices her profession with great joy, and she is close to her children.  Now, the next step is to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.ru:
Андрей имеет свой бизнес – торгует бытовой и компьютерной техникой. Занимается он этим уже 7 лет. Вначале ремонтировал технику, а затем по совету друзей занялся продажей. Андрей хорошо знает свой товар и имеет постоянных клиентов. Это положительно сказывается на его бизнесе.

Андрей просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 20,000 гривен на приобретение товара. В данном регионе лето – время сезонных заработков, поэтому люди могут позволить себе приобретать необходимую бытовую и компьютерную технику.
Данный бизнес – единственный источник дохода Андрея, поэтому он планирует развивать его дальше, увеличивая оборот и помогая большему количеству людей приобрести технику.
texts.en:
Andrey has his own business – he sells household and computer appliances. He has been in this business for seven years. In the beginning he was repairing the equipment and then later took advice of his friends and started selling it. Andrey knows his products very well and has regular customers. This has a positive effect on the business.

Andrey is asking to provide him with a loan in the amount of 20,000 hrivnas to purchase necessary household and computer appliances. This business is the only source of income for Andrey and this is why he plans to grow it further by increasing sales and helping a large number of people to purchase appliances.

loans.use: to increase the variety of applicances

loans.name: Jose Servando

texts.es:
José, habita en la ciudad de León, de 50 años de edad, padre de tres hijos. El es un hombre multifacético pues el además de ser comerciante dueño de una pulpería, es también agricultor y albañil (trabaja en la construcción), muy a pesar de que su nivel académico es básico solo curso hasta el sexto grado de primaria, el sabido sobrevivir con lo poco que la vida le ha enseñado. A la edad de 20 años inicio en el mundo del comercio, también combinaba sus otros oficios, como trabajos de albañil que le salían por ocasión y trabajando como agricultor, el siempre ha buscado la manera de sobrevivir de otra forma pues el es un hombre que le gusta el trabajo. Hoy en día lleva 7 años con su pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación. 
Requiere el préstamo para compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, maíz, trigo, huevo, pollo y carne. Con esta inversión el podrá ofrecer y vender mas productos, y surtir su pulpería pues necesita mas productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. En lo futuro el desea ampliar su pulpería, acondicionar mejor la pulpería, comprar dos vitrinas, de vidrio, comprar 2 estantes de metal. También quiere sembrar 2 manzanas de frijoles, 2 manzanas de maíz.
texts.en:
José lives in the city of León.  He’s 50 years old and the father of three children.  He’s a multifaceted man because besides being a grocer he’s also a farmer and bricklayer (he works in construction) even though his educational level is quite basic having only finished sixth grade in elementary school.  He’s learned how to survive with what little life has taught him.

At the age of 20 he started in the world of commerce while combining his other occupations, like the bricklaying jobs that he’d occasionally get, and working as a farmer.  He’s always sought out other ways to survive because he’s a man who likes to work.  Today, he’s had his home-based grocery store for 7 years.

He needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, corn, wheat, eggs, chicken and meat.  With this investment he’ll be able to offer and sell more products and stock his grocery store because he needs more products to satisfy customer demand.  In future, he’d like to expand the grocery store, equip it better, to buy two glass display cases and two metal shelves.  He also wants to plant two manzanas (Central American unit of land measurement) of beans and two manzanas of corn.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business of buying and selling maize at the market to her market dwellers and neighbours. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation from the rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards.

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize to resell.

loans.name: Xiomara Arely

texts.es:
Xiomara, vive con su esposo, su hija y su madre, ella se dedica a vender pupusas: de chicharrón, revueltas, de loroco, de queso y bebidas: gaseosas, refrescos, chocolate, dos días por semana en las tardes.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar material para las pupusas como: quesillo, chicharon y aceite, para obtener mejores ingresos económicos y darle mejor atención a sus clientes y mejorar más sus ventas.
El sueño de Xiomara es crecer en su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos y tener una buena atención a sus clientes y de esa forma mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Xiomara lives with her husband, daughter, and mother. She sells pupusas [stuffed corn tortillas] of chicharrón [fried pork meat ground to a paste consistency], revueltas [mixed ingredients], loroco [shredded vine flower bud] and cheese; as well as beverages, such as sodas, juices, and chocolate (twice a week in the afternoons). The loan will be used to buy ingredients for pupusas, such as quesillo [soft cheese], chicharrón, and oil. This will help her earn more income, provide better service to her clients, and improve her sales. Xiomara’s dream is to expand her business, increase her income, provide good service to her customers, and support her family.

loans.use: to buy soft cheese, fried pork rind, and oil to prepare stuffed corn tortillas.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Beatriz; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un televisor para su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Kanchary Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Beatriz, 42, is single and has two children.  She works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m.  She gets her children ahead with this job.

Beatriz wants to set up her house.  She is requesting the loan to buy a television set for her house.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy a television set for her house.

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is 31 years old. She is married and has four children. Miriama owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has three years of experience in this business. Miriama needs a loan of 1750 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or $146 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Miriama joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Miriama's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxone.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 47 years old and is an enterprising business man. He and his wife Mary, a house wife, are blessed with five children ages 18, 16, 14, 10 and 8 years. He has been selling plastic housewares for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 9,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Joseph is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joseph will use the loan to buy plastic basins to add to his stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop, which will cater to the family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy plastic basins to add to his stock.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Analyn has a retail shop that sells used clothing like pants & shirts. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy a stock of used clothing or ukay-ukay.
Analyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing or ukay-ukay

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 28 years and married to Salim. They are blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall selling business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells fish which adds another source of income. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish, wheat flour and cooking fat oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish, wheat flour and cooking fat oil for resale.

loans.name: Mwambuli Women Group

texts.en:
Enos is the facilitator of Mwambuli Women group. Enos and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Enos is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund to grow enough in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Enos had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Enos was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 3/4 acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Enos and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Enos will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mwambuli Women group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land. He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Sylivia has been working hard to manage her business, which sells engine oil retail and wholesale. 

To help expand her business, Sylivia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more oil for resale, and will help Sylivia to generate greater profits and cater to her family's basic needs. Sylivia hopes that in the future she will be able to establish another branch of her business. 

Sylivia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylivia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more oil for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 29 años, es una mujer buena y colaboradora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 9 años, a quien brinda todas las comodidades que puede ya que desea que tenga la mayor tranquilidad para que estudie. JUntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Elizabeth consiste en la costura, a diario desde su casa realiza su propia creación, además de realizar el trabajo para otras personas. Siempre esta con una sonrisa en los labios y con su buen trato amable y servicial es como cautiva a sus cliente que siempre la buscan para solucionar los problemas que puedan tener con sus prendas, tiene un buen acabado y es por eso que es muy solicitada, además de trabajar con esta actividad, también vende en su casa bebidas heladas y algunos cosméticos y perfumes. Lleva trabajando con la costura desde hace mucho tiempo ya que desde muy joven se inicio con este trabajo y le permitió poder realizar muchas cosas en su vida. Al principio tuvo algunas dificultades, pero con el pasar del tiempo lo supero y ahora lo realiza de manera normal y tranquila. Espera mas adelante poder crecer y así aumentar su negocio. Este será el crédito número cuatro con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete una vez más a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo de costura, quiere abastecerse con cierres, telas, hilos y otros materiales más.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old.  She is a good and collaborative woman.  She lives with her partner and they have a 9 year old son whom they provide with all comforts that they can.  They want him to have a tranquil environment so he can study.  They live in their own home.  

Elizabeth works as a seamstress out of her home every day.  She does her own designs and those of other people.  She is always smiling. Her friendly and helpful nature is how she attracts her clients, who always seek her out to solve problems with their clothing.  She does good finish work and is therefore in high demand.  She also sells cold drinks, cosmetics and perfumes in her home.  

She has worked as a seamstress for many years.  She started when she was very young and it has allowed her to do many things in her life.  It was difficult at first, but over time she overcame challenges and now she does her work easily and calmly.  She hopes to be able to continue to grow her business.  

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she hopes this small loan will help her achieve her goals.  She promises to again make her payments punctually.  She is very content to be part of her communal bank as all of the members are good and united.  With the 1500 soles she has requested she will purchase materials to continue her work as a seamstress.  She wants to purchase fasteners, fabric, thread and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase fasteners, fabrics, thread, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 43 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez. She is married and has 2 children. To earn a living, Jocelyn has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 4000 each month doing this type of work. 

Jocelyn has requested a loan of 1,500 to purchase raw ingredients for her viand business.  Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Jocelyn would like to engage in another food business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her viand business

loans.name: Graciela Daniela

texts.es:
Graciela es una joven mujer de 28 años que vive junto a su bebé de 10 meses de nacido y su esposo en la parroquia "Río Verde" en Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda su capital entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

Mientras el esposo de Graciela es profesor de Artes Escénicas, ella vende calzado puerta a puerta y así contribuye económicamente a su hogar. Trabaja sola un promedio de 8 horas al día, la jornada es muy agotadora ya que debe recorrer largos tramos. Nos cuenta que ha sido difícil iniciar en este negocio por la falta de créditos y apoyo de las instituciones financieras; por este motivo Graciela ha confiado en Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que intermediará su crédito y además le brindará capacitación y asesoría de tal manera que Graciela pueda crecer sustentablemente;  así mejorar su calidad de vida. Lleva pocos años en este oficio por lo que esta inversión la pone muy optimista. Su sueño es crecer y tener su propio local de calzado.

Graciela como toda madre piensa en dar a su familia lo mejor. Quiere ver a su bebé crecer sano y que no pase necesidades.
texts.en:
Graciela is a 28-year-old young woman who lives with her 10-month-old baby and her husband in Río Verde Parish in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a canton in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, one of the most densely populated in Ecuador.  It has great charm because of several monuments distributed throughout the capital, including the Monumento al Indio Colorado [Monument to the Red Indian, a historic reference to the dyed hair of the Tsáchila people]. Santo Domingo is a privileged canton, with wonderful, hard-working, and enterprising people who struggle tirelessly for development and progress, and always welcome tourists with open arms and take them to see the wonders of their culture and surroundings.

While Graciela's husband is a professor of theater arts, she sells shoes door-to-door and in this way contributes economically to her home.  She works alone an average of eight hours a day.  The day is exhausting because she has to cover long stretches.

She tells us that it has been difficult to get started in this business because of the lack of loans and support from financial institutions.  For this reason Graciela has trusted in Fundación Alternative, the institution that will administer her loan and also offer her training and assessment in such a way that Graciela will be able to grow sustainably and so improve her quality of life.  She has been in this work for a few years, which is why this investment makes her very optimistic.  Her dream is to grow and have her own shoe store.

Graciela, like every mother, thinks about giving her family the best.  She wants to she her baby grow healthy and not lack necessities.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.ru: Nariman zanimaetsa selskoxozaystvennim biznesom vot uje 9 let i odnovremenno rabotaet masterom po remontu domov. On jenat i imeet 3 detey.  Nariman xochet sdelat remont u seba doma I poetomu xochet priobresti kredit v summe 700 azn dla togo chtobi kupit stroy materiali. Vse doxodi s biznesa emu prixoditsa tratit na remont i poetomu on ne mojet rasshirit svoy biznes chto i oslojnaet emu jizn. Ego mechta eto chtobi ego deti smogli poluchit dostoynoe obrozovanie i on kak predanniy otec staraetsa radi ix budushego.
texts.en: Nariman has been involved in an agricultural business for nine years and concurrently works as a home repairs handyman.  He is married and has three children.  Nariman wants to make repairs in his home, and this is why he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 700 AZN to purchase construction materials.  He has to spend all of his business profits on repairs, and this is why he cannot expand his business, which makes his life difficult.  His dream is that his children are able to get a decent education, and, as a devoted father, he tries hard for their future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Agée de 55 ans,  mariée et mère de 6 enfants, AMINATA réside avec son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier  Kouloukoro de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Elle a prématurément abandonné les études, ainsi elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle mène plusieurs activités, mais pendant l’hivernage, elle se base sur l’achat-vente du bois de chauffe, qui est un des éléments essentiel pour les femmes Maliennes  dans la  préparation des plats alimentaires (cuisine). AMINATA peut vendre 1 chargement de camion remorque par mois. Elle est une cliente de Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 8 ans. Après des  prêts en groupe (prêt solidaire), elle est à son 6ème prêt  individuel, dont les  5 précédents ont été bien remboursés. Aminata envisage utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter   3 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe dans les villages  environnants  de la ville de Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte  à une clientèle mixte au comptant et en détail. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 70 000 FCFA par mois, qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de bois de chauffe

loans.name: Diana Karina

texts.es: Diana vive en un sector norte de Guayaquil llamado las Orquídeas, es casada tiene 2  hijos que estudian en una escuela pública del sector. Ella comenzó hace 4 años atrás cuando su suegro le regalo una maquina de estampado y fue cuando le dio la idea a su esposo para un crear negocio propio que es la venta de globos estampados. En la actualidad venden globos estampados. Ellos trabajan juntos de lunes a viernes en las noches los estampan y en el día salen a vender los globos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar fundas de globos. Su sueño es tener un local propio y expandir su negocio por otros sectores
texts.en:
Diana lives in a northern sector of Guayaquil called las Orquídeas.  She is married and has two children who study at a public school in the neighborhood.  

Diana began four years ago when her father-in-law gave her a embossing machine.  This gave her husband the idea to start their own business selling embossed balloons, which they currently sell.  They work together from Monday to Friday:  they emboss them in the evenings and during the day, they go out to sell the balloons.

With the loan, she would like to buy bags of balloons.  Her dream is to have her own store and expand her business into other sectors.

loans.use: to buy bags of balloons

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en: Nicholas Stephen, Mercy, Nicholas and Eunice reside in an informal settlement in Nairobi called Kawangware. They have spent much of their youth moving between low-paying jobs and long periods of unemployment. They are all passionate about becoming business owners and currently sell environmentally-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves to their communities and other slums in Nairobi. Their biggest challenge is not having enough capital to purchase more stock to sell. The group will use the loan to buy more inventory so that they can earn a decent wage and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: St. Denis Makondo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fr. Paschal. He is the Treasurer of St. Denis Makondo SS School, a mixed School in the rural area of Lwengo with 450 students. St. Denis Makondo SS School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of their budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration systems will therefore save the schools money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment systems with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Denis Makondo SS School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fr. Paschal ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo A., who was born in Loja, Ecuador has lived in Guayaquil for 10 years. This 40 year-old small business owner is divorced and has 3 children. He sells household items and ice cream and has been doing so ever since he arrived in Guayaquil. Wilfredo’s venture is run out of the home, and his most frequent customers live in the neighborhood. This hardworking entrepreneur opens his shop at 6:00 am and closes at 9:00 pm. He needs a $950 loan so that he can purchase more goods and diversify his product supply. Don Wilfredo is trying very hard to move forward and work himself out of poverty, giving his children opportunities that he never had.

loans.use: Purchase goods for small market

loans.name: Gozal

texts.en:
Gozal is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. She is 36. She vidow and has 3 children. Gozal has lost the husband. Not looking all difficulties in current of 9 years this mother has grown up the children lonely. 3 year ago she rented the mini market and has bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc.
Now Gozal wants loan amount of $1000 to build her own food market and to buy the new refrigerator.

loans.use: To build her own food market and to buy the new refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of used children clothes stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his vegetable selling business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. is married with three children. She is forty-seven years old and sells utensils. Her husband is also a small business owner in the same town, Magburaka.

Kadiatu's business expanded after her first loan. Although the loan amount was quite small, Kadiatu is grateful. She is now requesting another loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Increase her business and expand her operation

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina S. is a hard-working woman of thirty four years of age. She has five children who are all attending school. She runs an Ice Cake business at home and sells cakes to the people of her village, especially the school kids. Penina sells her cakes every day of the week and she is able to earn more money than she expected. Her husband and the kids also help out in their business if and when they have free time. Penina really appreciates the help of  S.P.B.D for lending her the money that has allowed her to run her own business.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags, sugar and other supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Dafina

texts.en: Dafina V. lives with her boyfriend and has three children. Dafina breeds about 100 birds, mainly ducks and geese. Some of them have been bred for meat and some of them for eggs. Her boyfriend works as a builder. Dafina wants to make some repairs of the hen house and needs $775.

loans.use: To make some repairs to the hen house

loans.name: Cridia

texts.en: Cridia is a young businesswoman and mother of three daughters, aged 8, 7 and 2.  Her husband makes a living driving a taxi. For the last two years, Cridia has helped her husband support their family by selling boiled beans and plucked chickens. She uses her income to buy items her family needs and to pay for the education of her children. Cridia's long-term goal is to open a large store that is visited by not just by the people of her town, but by people who live in surrounding communities as well. She is working hard to achieve that goal, and has come to us for a loan to buy beans and chickens that she can sell to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase beans and chickens needed to run a small business.

loans.name: Sonia Francisco

texts.pt:
Sonia is 30 years old. She's single but lives with a man with whom she has two children. Sonia's partner isn't employed; he lives by odd jobs to support the family. Because of this, Sonia decided to enter the program. This is the first loan that she will borrow. She wants to help her husband meet the household expenses, because what her husband manages to bring in is not enough to cover the expenses. She says she is going to do everything to be a good client, she wouldn't think of abandoning the program, as, from what she's seen, it has really helped people improve their lives.

If all goes well and in accordance with her dreams, she will persuade her husband to begin the construction of an improved residence so that her children gain decent housing. She is also going to ask her husband to open a shared account in the bank where they can deposit the profits from the business, thinking of the future of the children. The eldest is already in school, in the third grade. The youngest still is not old enough but will enroll next year.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Sonia tem 30 anos. Ela e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 2 filhos. O marido de Sonia nao esta empregado., vive de pequenos expedientes para sustentar sua familia. Por isso Sonia resolveu entrar para o programa. Este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar.Ela que ajudar o marido a custear as despesas da casa, pois que o que o marido tem conseguido nos biscates que faz nao e suficiene para cobrir todas as despesas. Ela diz que vai fazer de tudo para que seja uma boa cliente, pois que nao pensa abandonar o programa pois que pelo que tem visto este tem ajudado muito as pessoas a melhorar a sua vida.

Se tudo correr bem e de acordo com aquiloo que sao os seus sonhos, ela ira perssuadir o marido a iniciarem a construccao de uma residencia melhorada para que os seus filhos nham uma habitacao condigna. Vai tambem pedir o marido para abrirem uma cona conjunta no Banco onde poderao depositar os rendimenos do negocio , pensando no futuro dos filhos. O mais velho ja vai a escola esta na terceira classe o mais novo ainda nao tem idade mas o proximo ano sera matriculado.

loans.use: Sonia wants to use the money for the purchase of more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Anna S.. She is single with two children, aged 10 and 15, and has two other dependents, who live with her because their parents died of HIV/AIDS.

In 1983, Anna established a general store and clothing business. Working 9 to 12 hours a day, seven days a week, and assisted by her brother and one employee, she earns about $170 per month from this business. Anna has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

Anna thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store and clothing business.

loans.name: Lizeth Karina

texts.en:
Lizeth Karina P. G. is a distributor for the cosmetic company Eskia in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. As a representative, Lizeth sells shampoos, perfumes, colognes, soaps, and deodorants. She is very sociable, loves building relationships, and sells her products to her many friends.

Lizeth is 30 years old with one child and happily married. She loves having her own income and the independence of running her own business. Lizeth will continue to look for opportunities to work hard and earn more money for her family.

A member of the community bank Siete Estrellas, Lizeth is requesting a loan of s/2000 (US$ 725) to repay over six months. She will use her loan to restock her supply of beauty products.

loans.use: restock her supply of beauty products

loans.name: Cecilia Ama

texts.en:
Ama Cecilia M. is married and has five dependents. She sells clothing materials and shoes but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more clothing materials and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayawa A. was born in 1984 in Tabligbo (P/Yoto). Being a girl in a family of 11 children, she lacked financial means and did not have a chance to pursue any schooling. She used her first loan of $75 to retail poplin to provide for her needs. She is very courageous and determined, and she easily paid back that loan. She is currently requesting a second loan to strengthen her business, and to buy poplin wholesale that she will retail. This will enable her to make a much more significant profit and fulfill her socio-economic needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mlle A. Ayawa est née en 1984 à Tabligbo (P/Yoto). Fille d’une famille de 11 enfants, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études scolaires par faute de moyens financiers. Avec son premier prêt de $75 elle se lança dans le commerce des popelines pour subvenir à ses besoins. Très courageuse et déterminée, elle à remboursé sans peine ce crédit et sollicite actuellement un second crédit pour renforcer son commerce, acheter en gros les popelines et les revendre en détail. Ce qui lui permettra de gagner une marge bénéficiaire beaucoup plus considérable et satisfaire à ses besoins socio économiques.

loans.use:
To strengthen her retail business, to buy poplin wholesale and resell it

Pour renforcer son commerce, acheter en gros les popelines et les revendre en détail.

loans.name: Prisca Emilola

texts.fr:
Ms Prisca Emilola A. was born on the 26th of October in 1984. She was born in the city of Cotonou in the south of Benin. She is not married and does not have any children. She manages a phone booth and also sells charcoal. In order to be able to stock up on charcoal she has come to us for a loan. She is asking for a second loan of $250.00 (100000.00 XOF).

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Célibataire sans enfant, Mademoiselle A. Prisca Emilola est née le 26 Octobre 1984 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN. Elle gère une cabine téléphonique et vend parallèlement des sacs de charbon. Pour constituer un stock assez important, elle sollicite notre apport financier à hauteur de 100000F CFA à travers le renouvellement de son deuxième crédit.

loans.use: Purchase 20 bags of chargoal

loans.name: Graciana

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling Andean products turned into the main source of income for Graciana, a diligent mother who, after separating from her husband, responsibly took the reins of her household. She became responsible for the education and well-being of her 2 children, who after many years of effort and dedication are now independent adults. This industrious woman obtains Andean products from markets in different areas of her city. After collecting the adequate amount of products such as barley, potatoes, oca (an Andean vegetable root), and cheese, she sells them as a street vendor in the Manco Cápac market of her district. Over the last few months, her products have been in high demand, which is why Graciana would like to increase her capital—her reason for requesting this current loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de productos andinos, se convirtió en el principal ingreso económico de Graciana, madre diligente y laboriosa, que al separarse de su esposo tomó responsablemente las riendas de su hogar, haciéndose cargo de la educación y bienestar de sus 2 hijos, quienes después de muchos años de esfuerzo y dedicación ya son mayores e independientes. Esta hacendosa mujer adquiere producto andinos en las ferias de los distintos pueblitos de su ciudad, luego de reunir una buena cantidad de estos tales como: cebada, papa, oca y queso se dedica a venderlos en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Manco Cápac de su localidad. En estos últimos meses sus productos están logrando tener gran demanda, motivo por el cual, Graciana desea aumentar el monto de su capital de inversión, por lo que solicita el presente préstamo.

loans.use: Invest in Andean products

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica B. is unmarried and owns a small grocery store. Angélica lives with her partner who helps her with her business. They have four children, all of whom are adults. Three are marries and one daughter is still single and studying at the university.

She runs her business in her home and also makes fast food such as empanadas, milanesas, omelets and sandwiches to increase her income. Selling fast food gives her some good extra income.

She starts working very early in the day, around 4am, so that she can go to the market to buy all that she needs for her business.

One of her hopes is to expand her business soon in terms of equipment and furnishings so that she can have her own store and offer her customers a more comfortable and pleasant atmosphere.

Angélica is taking out this loan to purchase various grocery store products such as yerba (an herb to make a hot caffeinated beverage), drinks and also food products such as meat, cheese, chicken, oil, flour and others.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Angélica B., es soltera, y es dueña de una pequeña despensa. Angélica vive en pareja, este la ayuda en el negocio, tienen cuatro hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad, tres están casados y una hija aun sigue soltera y estudiando en la universidad.

El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio y se dedica también a la fabricación de comidas rápidas como empanadas, milanesas, tortillas y sándwich para así tener mayor ingreso. La venta de las comidas rápidas le genera un buen ingreso extra.

A muy tempranas horas del día inicia sus actividades, aproximadamente a las 04:00 de la mañana, con el fin de ir al mercado a comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para su propio futuro salón comercial y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes. La señora Angélica retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén como yerba, bebidas y también insumos para comidas como carnes, quesos, pollo, aceites, harinas y otros

loans.use: Purchase various grocery store products such as Yerba, sugar, flour, dairy products, drinks and others.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Née le 23 avril 1973 à Cotonou, dame A. Florence réside avec sa petite famille à Kowégbo depuis environ dix ans. Elle est mariée à AGOSSA Thierry, soudeur de son état et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés.  Actuellement vendeuse de pagnes et de chaussures, elle a embrassé nombreuses activités par le passé. Coiffeuse de profession, elle s’était lancée très tôt dans la vente ambulante de riz. En décembre 2006, elle vint contracter son premier crédit d’un montant de 40000 F CFA afin de renforcer son capital. Avec ce crédit, elle a  réalisé des économies suffisantes. Envisageant de commencer par acheter au marché de Dantokpa des produits de beauté et peu à peu des pagnes, elle sollicita pour son troisième crédit un montant de 50000 F CFA. Grâce à sa méthode de distribution, elle s’est déjà fait beaucoup de clients et a une bonne assise dans le domaine de vente de pagnes. Elle veut maintenant contracter son cinquième crédit et demande pour cela un montant de 120000 F CFA.
texts.en:
Born on April 23, 1973, Ms. Florence A. has been residing with her small family in Kowégbo for about 10 years. She is married to Thierry AGOSSA, a welder, and is the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. Currently a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and shoes, she has embraced numerous kinds of work in the past. A hairdresser by profession, she had gotten started very early on selling rice door-to-door. In December 2006, she came to sign her first loan contract for the amount of 40,000 francs CFA in order to bolster her capital. With this loan, she realized sufficient savings. With a plan for commerce in beauty products and, little by little, pagnes purchased at the Dantokpa marketplace, she requested as her third loan the amount of 50,000 francs. Thanks to her distribution method, she has so far procured many customers and a good foundation in the domain of selling pagnes. She nows wants to sign her fifth loan contract and is asking for the amount of 120,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lengths of pagnes, pairs of shoe, and boxes of soap and detergent

loans.name: Iván

texts.es: El Sr. Ivan tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado y le tienen dos hijos que son menores de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Ivan es taxista tiene diez años de experiencia, y diariamente lucha por poder llevar el sustento a la familia ya que él es el único proveedor de ingresos. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para mejoras de su vivienda para hacer reparaciones a su casa, ya que con este invierno el agua se le está filtrano por las paredes y techo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ivan is 36 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Medardo Andina in Ticuantepe, is married, and has two young children. His spouse is a housewife. Ivan is a taxi driver and has ten years of experience. Every day, he fights to be able to give sustenance to his family since he is the family’s only source of income. With the money that he is requesting, he will improve and repair his home, because this winter the water is leaking through the walls and roof.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his home

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun N. is a villager in Damnak Rovang village in Takeo Province. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. 

Mrs. Aun N. buys hens from other people and resells them. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to continue her business. In order to deal with this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy some hens to add  to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living condition with this loan. 

Her husband, Mr. En Sam Oeurn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Her husband appears to her right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy hens

loans.name: Mabelle

texts.en:
Mrs. Mabelle L. is a young wife and mother of 2 from Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and decided to put up a little business retailing cosmetics from which to earn a meager income. She started the business by applying for a loan from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She describes the hardships of living as a young couple. They have a motocycle for another source of income. Her husband drives it daily as a motor taxi. They work hard to support the family.

At present, the family business needs working capital. They would like to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics. They feel that their retailing business is doing well. They approached Paglaum MPC for Mabelle's 2nd loan of PHP 10,000. They hope to stretch their income out from cosmetics retailing as they need money for motorcycle repair. Moreover, Mabelle's husband has to renew his driver's license. They know that if one of them stops working, the family will suffer.

Sometime in the future, Mabelle wants to own additional motorcycles and wishes to become a cosmetics wholesaler one day. She smiles at the thought of seeing their children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics

loans.name: Las Ardillitas Group

texts.en:
The women of the Las Ardillitas are requesting a loan of 5,600 Nuevo Soles to fund their various endeavours. The Ardillitas (or “Little Squirrels”) are a new bank: they are just completing their third loan cycle (each cycle comprising four months of payments) as a group. Because they are a new group, their loan amounts are small, varying between two and six hundred Nuevo Soles. They meet monthly in one bank member’s home near downtown Pucallpa, Peru – a bustling capital in the eastern jungle region of the country.

Most of the women in the group sell food for a living or operate a small corner store, or "bodeguitas", from their homes. The Ardillitas are requesting loans of individual amounts, but they collectively guarantee the repayment of the entire bulk loan. The bank members will be using the loan to fund a variety of individual businesses including: sales of fast food, bottled drinks, groceries, snacks, beauty products, artisanal crafts and bananas. Each woman will repay her portion of the bulk loan within the same four month term.

The bank members requesting a group loan are: Lucy Guinaraes Q., Margarita G. C., Adelina Y. S., Carmela Q. O., Juana A. B., Rogelia P. C., Reina D., Marcelina S. I., Antonia V. Y., Lastenia V. Y., Juana V. R., Jessica Liliana V. Q., Yurema Marice F. G., Adela Insalicio C., Elena V. S., and Priscila G. C..

The bank president is Lucy Guinaraes Q.; the bank treasurer is Juana A. B.; and, the bank secretary is Marcelina S. I..

loans.use: to fund a variety of individual businesses

loans.name: Ahror

texts.en:
K. Ahror is 39 years old and lives with his 4 children. For the past 8 years he has been farming, planting potatoes, onions and corn to sell as well as for his own family's consumption. Every day he tends to his fields. In the case of corn, he dries it and later threshes it, puts it in sacks and stores it for future sales. The process for planting his fields is first to prepare them with organic fertilizer, plow and sow them, and afterwards irrigate and apply fertilizer and insecticides, if necessary. All this is to insure a good harvest.

Ahror has a friendly family who always tries to help others. In the picture you can see Ahror’s son who also helps him with his business. At the same time, Ahror raises cattle in his house. He will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of organic fertilizers to prepare his land to raise potatoes and other crops.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy S., 49, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She has been running a grocery store to earn a living since 2004, and is able to make around US$8 every day. Her husband is a taxi driver and makes US$8 a day as well. The couple has two children, each with different jobs. Mrs. S. would like to take out a loan to purchase more groceries for her store to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for the store

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: M. Fred owns a shop in Rwebikona Mbarara where he sells spare parts. He has been in the business for over 12 years. He is using the loan funds to purchase more spare parts so as to enlarge the business. Fred has 2 children whom he plans to look after well alongside the success of the business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí distante a 200 mts. de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres activas con ganas de salir adelante, quienes se pusieron en contactos con nosotros (Fundacion Paraguaya) para conocer el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Luego de la reunión informativa decidieron aceptarlas, por los beneficios que les presenta. Además de darle la materia prima el “El Capital” tanto para aumentar y a otras para poder emprender alguna actividad comercial. Actualmente se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo del programa y están integradas por 15 activas y trabajadoras mujeres, quienes han mejorado considerablemente sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus respectivas familias, brindándoles lo mejor posible.

Eunilda A.	      Venta de Leche, dulce y azúcar.
Ramona O.	      Despensa
Arminda M.	      Panadería
Lilian González	      Despensa
Leónidas M.      Empleada
Brigida P.       Chipera
Nilsa G.	      Empeada
Evangelista A.   Venta de Frutas y Verduras
Tomasa O.	      Empleada
Natalia A.	      Venta de Comestibles 
Cintia B.	      Docente
Ramona Servían	      Panadera
Reina V.      Venta de Pescado
Dora R.            Flores Artificiales
Zulma Servían	      Panaderia
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, which is 200 meters from the office in Paraguarí, some very active women meet with the desire to get ahead. The contacted us (Fundación Paraguaya) to become familiar with the Enterprising Women program. After the informative meeting, they decided to become members because of the benefits they would receive. They were also given capital to expand or to start a commerical activity. Currently they are on their seventh loan with the program. The group is made up of 15 active and hard-working women, who have considerably improved their incomes and the quality of live of their respective families, offering them the best that they possibly can. Eunilda A. Milk, sweets, and sugar sales Ramona O. Grocery store Arminda M. Bakery Lilian González Grocery store Leónidas M. Employee Brigida P. Snack sales Nilsa G. Employee Evangelista A. Fruit and vegetable sales Tomasa O. Employee Natalia A. Food sales Cintia B. Teacher Ramona Servían Baker Reina V. Fish sales Dora R. Artificial flower sales Zulma Servían Bakery

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They have invested in their respective businesses to buy dairy scales, sugar, flour, yeast, anise, meat, eggs, noodles, dairy products, drinks, fruit, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 41, is married and has four children. She sells bags of garri (cassava grains) in wholesale and retail to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Mariam hopes to take out a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell.

loans.name: Mavlida

texts.en:
Mavlida H.  is 30 years old. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Together with her husband (pictured) they are running the business of manufacturing  wooden doors and window frames. Mostly Mavlida participates in selling their products. Her husband inherited the business from his father. Now Mavlida wishes to improve the working conditions of their shop  to be able to provide the services of the best quality in the neighborhood. After 13 years of operation, Mavlida is applying for a loan for the tenth time. She has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. Mavlida requests 4000 Somoni. She would like to thank everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing materials like lumber and improving working conditions.

loans.name: Sitsofe

texts.fr: Sitsofe A. est une femme de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuses de poissons et des légumes au marché de Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle exerce ce commerce depuis 4 ans et désire avec ce crédit accroitre la taille de son activité. Sitsofe compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sitsofe A. is a 41-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three. She is a retailer of fish and vegetables at the marketplace of Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this business for four years and would like to use this loan to expand her business. Sitsofe is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 25-year-old single man. He live with his mother and father and he is responsible for their living expenses.

Issa has a butcher's shop.He provides the markets with meat and his family with food. Now Issa is requesting a loan of $1,500. Due to the determination of this micro-entrepreneur, the profitability of his business, and his experience, Issa is qualified to receive this loan. He is counting on your help – your support will really help him.

loans.use: To buy more meat to expand his business

loans.name: Abdualim

texts.en:
I. Abdualim is 23 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Abdualim is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him because raising animals is what he enjoys most.

Abdualim needs money to increase the number of his cows. His goal is to increase his product and thereby increase his household income. He wants to be solvent in order to continue buying and selling animals.

In the picture you can see Abdualim’s sister who works in this business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia N., 38 years old, lives with her husband Tito, 42, an electronics repairman, and their four school-aged children.  Their family is just one of the many poor families who benefited from the socialized housing facility of Habitat for Humanity.

She buys used electronic appliances and her husband repairs them and sells them back to willing buyers.  But the main source of their family's income is her buy and sell of used clothing (ukay-ukay).  She has been in this business for four years now and it's doing good.

Her business has been helping her send the children to school.  She has just received a loan of Php 12,000.00 from CCT Credit Cooperative, which she used to buy more used clothes.  She wishes to own a tricycle that she can use in hauling used clothes from her suppliers.  

CCT is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is part of 47-year-old Hem K.’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Teang Buntoeun, assists her with the farm work and he appears in the photograph above.

On the other hand, the family also raises a few pigs at home to generate extra profit. Two of their children are working in different jobs, while the other five are still unemployed and help on the farm.

Hem K. will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and seed to facilitate rice-growing. With the remainder of loan she will buy a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for rice cultivation

loans.name: Suo

texts.en:
Suo J., 25, is a local pig-raiser, and is the good mother devoted to her one young child who is still not yet enrolled in school. Suo J. is married to Mr. Sok Thai, age 24, who is a construction worker in the village. The family usually generates their daily income of $7 each day to meet their family’s financial crisis.

Suo J.’s husband is facing difficulty with transportation to work. He needs to pay a lot of money to taxi drivers because he doesn’t have his own vehicle for traveling to work. Because of this, Suo J. requested a loan to add to her little savings in order to buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to his workplace.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora JUANA ANTONIA A. C.  tiene 75 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Juana es Viuda y es socia del  Banco comunal Cachanchugo II.
La empresaria es analfabeta, refiere que ella es la mayor de 9 hermanos por eso su padre desde la edad de 5 años de dedicaba a la  jalca  desgranar maíz, cosechar las papas, dar de comer a los animales y también se dedicaba a ayudar a su madre con la crianza de sus hermanos menores preparando la comida, cuidando  a sus hermanos, aseándolos, etc ,
Tiene 9 hijos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Actualmente vive con una hija de 29 años quien es profesora y trabaja en Usquil y la apoya económicamente 
Juana se dedica  a la crianza de sus animales como: patos, pollos, gallinas. Pavos, cuyes etc
Que los lleva a vender al mercado de Usquil.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles compró sus cuyes y empezó a dedicarse a la crianza y reproducción de cuyes.
Con este crédito de 1,200  soles, comprará más animales y también como tiene áreas de chacras preparará la tierra para sembrar maíz.
Juana tiene como sueño aumentar la crianza de su animales y empezar con el sembrado de maíz para obtener  mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Antonia A. C. is 75 years old and lives in the District of Usquil, Otuzco Province, Department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a widow and also a member of the Communal Bank “Cachanchugo II”.

This entrepreneur is illiterate and the oldest of 9 siblings. When she was 5 years old, her father taught her to shuck corn, harvest potatoes, and feed the animals. As she grew older, she helped her mother raise her younger siblings, prepare food, clean house, etc.

Sra. Juana has 9 adult children and all of them are financially independent. She lives with her 29 year old daughter, who works as a teacher in Usquil and supports her financially.

Sra. Juana raises animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, guinea pigs, etc. She then sells them at the market in Usquil. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased guinea pigs for breeding.

With her current loan of 1200 soles, she will buy more animals and prepare her land for planting corn. Sra. Juana dreams of increasing the number of animals for breeding and starting her corn crop for higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals & prepare her land for planting corn

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 35 years married with two children aged between 3and 15 years All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Harriet resides and rents three roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.Harriet owns a drug shop in Kampala city.  She buys these.  She uses public transport to and from work.  She sells to all categories of people .Harriet has been with MCDT for four year servicing her eigth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more drugs and syrups  Harriet is aspiring of owning a fully refurnished hospital .

loans.use: to buy more medicines for her drug shop

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. She has been selling tubers of yams for a long time to earn income to satisfy the needs of her children and husband. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
El señor Wilmer P. de 39 años de edad se dedica a vender ropa usada, Administrando su negocio desde hace 9 años, vende todo tipo de ropa para adultos y niños. cuenta con la ayuda de una tia y 
una de sus sobrinas, ellas viajan a talanga a vender de casa en casa la ropa y de igual manera el lo hace en las colonias cercanas. Wilmer vive con su mama quien tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual don Wilmer quiere surtir con parte del credito que esta solicitando, al igual que comprar mas ropa para vender.
los clientes  son sus vecinos y personas que transitan el lugar, que lo conocen y lo admiran mucho ya que a pesar de tener una deficiencia fisica (Deformacion de Columna) no deja de trabajar y su sueño es crecer y aumentar sus ganancias el cliente invierte mensualmente $417.00 y vende $767.00
teniendo una ganancia de $350.00 mesuales. 
Wilmer se siente muy feliz y es muy amable, fue muy grato pasar la tarde con el.
texts.en:
Señor Wilmer P. is 39-years-old and sells used clothing. He has had this business for 9 years. He sells all types of clothing for adults and children. He has the help of his aunt and one of his nieces. They travel to Talanga to sell clothing from home to home and they also do this in nearby towns. Wilmer lives with his mom, who has a small grocery store that Wilmer wants to supply with part of the credit he is requesting. He will also buy more clothing to sell. His clients are his neighbors and people who travel in the area. They know him and admire him a lot since he has a physical shortcoming (a spinal deformation). He doesn't stop working, and his dream is to grow and increase his profits. He invests $417 and sells $767 every month, which means he has a monthly profit of $350. Wilmer is very happy and is very friendly. It was very pleasant to spend the afternoon with him.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es:
la señora Cristina Isabel S. F. tiene 56 años de edad es soltera y tiene dos hijos que ya estan casados, ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace 40 años, este negocio le ha 
dado para comprar y mejorar su casa. 
ella vende desayunos, pescado frito, curiles y sopa marinera que es su especialidad.
 
atiende a todo los visitantes que vienen del interior del pais, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en Coyolito que es el lugar donde se toma la lancha para ir a la isla de Amapala.
 
ya que se aproxima la navidad y desea tener su negocio bien equipado para llamar la atencion de los clintes.

su deseo es que la crisis politica de su pais se mejore.
texts.en:
la señora Cristina Isabel S. F. tiene 56 años de edad es soltera y tiene dos hijos que ya estan casados, ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace 40 años, este negocio le ha dado para comprar y mejorar su casa. ella vende desayunos, pescado frito, curiles y sopa marinera que es su especialidad. atiende a todo los visitantes que vienen del interior del pais, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en Coyolito que es el lugar donde se toma la lancha para ir a la isla de Amapala. ya que se aproxima la navidad y desea tener su negocio bien equipado para llamar la atencion de los clintes. su deseo es que la crisis politica de su pais se mejore.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de mariscos, vegetales, condimentos, leche de coco, gas, leña

loans.name: Lilly

texts.es:
La señora Lilly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Mujeres Talentosas II”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun depende de ella. 

Lilly, lleva 10 años dedicándose al negocio, motivada por ella misma y buscando alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le ayudo a iniciarse en la venta de chupetes, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece, tiene una buena sazón y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. 

Lilly, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Lilly belongs to the communal bank, "Las Mujeres Talentosas II" (Talented Women II) in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, in the department of San Martin. She lives with her boyfriend, is 33, and has 3 children who are all her dependents. Lilly has had her business for 10 years and motivates herself and looks for alternatives of generating sources of income. Thanks to her qualities of being a hard-working and enterprising woman, this has helped her get her start in selling popsicles. She tells us that it is going very well for her and she has earned customers little by little. Currently, she is continuing with the same business, and her customers see that the product she offers has good flavor and above all, she offers friendly service, which characterizes her. With this loan of 1,500 PEN, she will buy ingredients to make her products like sugar by the kilogram, boxes of milk, and fruit. She has a variety of products every day to be able to attract a bigger clientele. Lilly feels very strong to be able to continue working and persevering every day. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and for having opportunities to develop in their fields.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients to make her popsicles

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
