A. Musa is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to set up a commercial building and purchase more land for a farm expansion. She is 35 years old and blessed with four children, all in school. She owns a retail shop dealing in cosmetics, which she has been running since 2004. 

She is using the loan to purchase items for her business, that is to say various types of cosmetics (lotions, jelly, powders, creams, lipsticks, lip balm and so forth). She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase various types of cosmetics (lotions, jelly, powders, creams, lipsticks, lip balm and so forth)

loans.name: Ndeye Nogaye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye Nogaye M. sollicite son premier crédit, pour un montant de 100,000 FCFA.  Elle vend de tissus et chaussures à sa communauté de Bambey, situé 100km de Dakar.  UIMCEC y a ouvrit une caisse en Juillet 2009 pour mieux servir les clients ruraux.  
Elle appris le commerce dès l'age très jeune et, elle explique, qu'elle trouve généralement la commande dans leurs association de femmes sans en demarcher.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Nogaye M. is requesting her first-ever loan in the amount of 100 000 CFA francs. She sells fabric and footwear to her community in Bambey, located 100 km (60 miles) from Dakar. UIMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) started a loan fund in Bambey in July 2009 to better serve rural clients. She learned this business at a young age. She says that she usually gets her orders from the women’s association without having to sell door to door.


Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and footwear

loans.name: Laura Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buscando el Éxito esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan que cada las mejores oportunidades para salir adelante y tratar de darles una mejor  calidad de vida a sus familias, viven Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una riqueza arquitectónica y obras artísticas que le hicieron merecedora del nombramiento como Patrimonio Cultural del la Humanidad. 

Laura Q. vive en el Sector de Totoracocha en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 46 años de edad, se encuentra casada pero no convive con su esposo desde hace 15 años su separación se dio  por falta de comprensión en el hogar, juntos procrearon 5 hijos, que ya son mayores trabajan y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar,  aún no posee casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia es vendedora ambulante de confites, colas, cervezas, lleva 15 años en este oficio tiene un puesto en el estadio de fútbol, y también se dedica a vender en espectáculos públicos, además se dedica a  reciclar papel, plástico, vidrio y más en esta actividad  lleva 25 años, estos oficios le han permitido  sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia.

Lleva 4  años trabajando con su banco comunal y con los créditos recibidos ha ido incrementando poco a poco su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que  reciba va a comprar confites, aguas, colas, cervezas, etc. para abastecer su puesto.

Su gran sueño es comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
The Buscando el Éxito Communal Bank is comprised of a group of women who look for the best opportunities to get ahead. They try to give their families a better quality of life. They live in Cuenca, a city that has rich architecture and works of arts that make it deserving of being named a Cultural Heritage Site. Laura Q. lives in the Totoracocha area in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is 46 and married. She and her husband have been separated for 15 years and do not live together because of lack of understanding in the home. They have five children, who are now grown. They work and help her with the household expenses. She still does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives. She is a traveling salesperson, and she sells sweets, sodas, and beer. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has a stand in the soccer stadium. She also sells entertainment guides and recycles paper, plastic, glass, and more. She has been doing this for 25 years. These jobs have allowed her to survive and get her family ahead. She has been working in her communal bank for four years. With the loans she has received she has been increasing her business little by little. With the new loan she will buy sweets, water, soda, and beer, etc. to stock her stand. Her big dream is to buy a small house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, water, soda, and beer, etc.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz, 38, a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., has requested a loan of 15,000 Php as additional capital for her business in rice farming. She tills a 1-hectare rice field in Surallah, South Cotabato. She maintains the farm very well to have a plentiful harvest.

In 1999 she started rice farming. She now has 2 children; her eldest is 11 years old. With rice farming, she has been able to provide for the basic needs of her family. This loan will help a lot to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 36 years old. He is married to Daisy Cherutich and they have three school-going children. He has been contracted by a local baker to distribute bread for him in Naivasha town. He uses his cycle to do so as the quantity is not that big. He has been doing this for the last three years.

He now wants to open up his own bakery and that is why he approached KADET, a Kiva partner, for this loan. He was told about KADET by his friend.  

After opening the bakery shop, he plans to grow it and be able to supply bread in the area on a large scale.

loans.use: Start-up capital to set up a small bakery

loans.name: Bagdagul

texts.en: Bagdagul A. was born in 1974. She is married and has two children. Bagdagul and her family live in Absheron region. Bagdagul is a teacher at school. Five years ago she started a home tutoring business. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy a new computer to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha es una comerciante y ala ves ama de casa, ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio tienen una pulpería, de igual manera distribuyen ropa en zona norte de nuestro país, tiene una hija en España el cual le ayudara con su crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is a merchant and a homemaker. Together with her husband, she manages a general store. They also distribute clothing in the northern part of the country. She has a daughter in Spain who will help with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor N. is from the village of Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old and married, and she has four school-aged children. To make a living, Amor owns and operates a specialized retail store. She also sells firewood. Amor has been engaged in her retail business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Amor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Amor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Amor is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her specialized retail business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes P. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business retailing rice grains in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica, de 26 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Nilson de 31 años  y de sus 3 pequeños hijos que aún están en etapa escolar. Desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar en los campos agrícolas, por lo que aprendió  observando a sus padres y vecinos como trabajaban las tierras. Hoy siembra junto a su esposo, papa de buena calidad, a pesar que el precio de este tubérculo es bajo en el mercado, aún se muestra optimista, puesto que le gusta este trabajo, aunque algunas veces es tedioso tener que vigilar sus cultivos, peros sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado cuando su producción es vendida a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad, recibiendo buenas ganancias. Con estos ingresos, puede vivir tranquila con su familia, por lo tanto desea mas adelante aumentar su producción de papa y empezar a sembrar alverjas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que el crédito la ayude a continuar trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo comunal porque todos los integrantes son bien responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Yessica tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar y proteger la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Yessica, age 26, lives in her own home in the company of her husband Nilson, age 31, and her 3 small children, who are still of school age. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young, learning from her parents and neighbors as they worked their fields. Today, she farms together with her husband, growing high-quality potatoes. Although the price of potatoes at the market is low, she is still optimistic, because she enjoys her work. She sometimes finds it tedious when she has to constantly care for her crops, but she knows that all of her efforts will pay off when she sells her harvest to the city's wholesale buyers, receiving a good profit. With this income, she can live in tranquility with her family, and accordingly she would like to increase her potato production in the future and also begin planting peas. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who have made the loan possible, allowing her to continue with her work. She is also very satisfied with her communal bank, because all of the members are very responsible in making their payments. Yessica plans to invest the loan in buying compost and fertilizer to protect and nourish her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying compost and fertilizer for her next crop

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Dulce Amistad, ubicado en el cantón Rocafuerte a media hora de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, en esta bella localidad contamos con la producción de arroz y con los mas deliciosos dulces de la región, nuestra socia es madre de dos niños, casada desde hace 8 años, a sus 25 años se siente muy feliz con la actividad que realiza, ella es dueña de la venta de joyas de plata, se dedica a su negocio de dos a tres veces por semana y el resto del tiempo es madre a tiempo completo, la mayoría de sus clientas la buscan en casa cuando necesitan alguna de sus joyas como regalo para sus compromisos, hay un día a la semana que la señora María viaja a 20 minutos a su tierra natal que es Charapoto ahí tiene muchos clientes fijos.

La señora María con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo el capital en mas joyas, hay una persona que le trae directamente desde Cuenca y le vende al contado, ya lleva un año y medio con sus ventas y le ha ido muy bien, cada tres meses renueva su mercadería e invierte de 200 a 300 dólares, con las ganancias que ha obtenido ha podido ayudar al esposo en casa ya que no es mucho lo que el gana como técnico de  equipos de música de disco móviles y orquestas, y es una gran ayuda para sus hijos siendo el mayor sueño de nuestra socia es ver a sus hijos realizados.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Dulce Amistad (Sweet Friendship) Community Bank located in the community of Rocafuerte, a half hour from the city of Portoviejo. This beautiful spot is known for its rice production along with having the most delicious sweets in the region. María is a mother of two children and has been married for the past eight years. She has been happy with what she has accomplished in her 25 years. She is the owner of silver jewelry business to which she dedicates herself two to three times a week, and the rest of her time she spends as a full-time mother. The majority of her customers visit her at her home when they need some piece of jewelry for their loved ones. One day a week María travels 20 minutes to her native town of Charapoto, where she has many established customers. With this new loan, María plans to invest all of the capital into more jewelry. There's a person who brings it directly from the city of Cuenca and sells the items for cash. María has a year and a half of experience in this work and it has gone very well. Every three months she renews her merchandise and invests $200 to $300, and with the profits she has made she has been able to help her husband with household expenses since he doesn't earn a lot as a mobile music technician. It is a big help to her children, and María's biggest dream is for her children to become successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silver rings, necklaces, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl L. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Cheryl owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2007, Cheryl joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to build a shelter for her pigs. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair her house. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old. Jenalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jenalyn has been engaged in her business for over 12 years now.

Jenalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jenalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Jenalyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela del Carmen S. F. es una joven trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora originaria del barrio Altagracia, Managua. Ella tiene en su hogar una pequeña y modesta venta de gaseosa, fresco y leche agria.
Carmen también comercializa por encargo ropa de todo tipo y estilos.
texts.en:
Adela del Carmen Chávez F. is a strong, hardworking and resourceful young woman who comes from the Managua neighborhood of Altagracia. She has set up a small and modest stall in her house, where she sells fizzy drinks, fruit drinks and filmjölk (similar to yoghurt but less sour). Carmen also sells different kinds and styles of clothes by order.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, yogurt, and clothes.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar S. is a 39-year-old man who has been breeding sheep for the last 12 years. He is married and has four children. 

Vuqar sells sheep in the livestock bazaar and to the local butchers. His monthly income is 250 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). He would like to increase his profit and improve the life of his family. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN and will use it to purchase six sheep and one calf.

loans.use: Purchase six sheep and one calf

loans.name: Basilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Basilia del Carmen L. se dedica a la venta de verduras como papas, cebollas, chiltomas y otros. Es una dama que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y por preocuparse por llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación con el fin de beneficiar a su familia.

Con el crédito solicitado logrará la compra de las papas, cebollas, chiltomas y otras verduras para continuar ofertándolas en su localidad y así favorecer a sus clientes que le visitan a diario.
texts.en:
Basilia L. sells vegetables such as potatoes, onions, bell peppers and others in Managua's wholesale market. She is a hardworking woman who is busy supporting her home to benefit her family. She will use the requested loan to purchase potatoes, onions, bell peppers and other vegetables. She wants to continue to offer such vegetables in her shop and to please the costumers who visit her every day.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 40 years old and married to a hairstylist. She has two children who are 11 and 16 years old, and she says that it’s a challenge paying for their school fees.

Olive sells food products on two market days at different locations. She sells onions on Tuesdays and sells pineapples on Fridays in a different market. She has done this business for 14 years and her business is well-known because there are only two people who supply pineapples at her market.

loans.use: Expand her business by buying more onions and pineapples

loans.name: Jhanet

texts.es: Jhanet, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Robert de 33 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Sus días los pasa tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, entre otras prendas. Sus tejidos son comprados por tiendas de ropa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde son vendidas con mucha rapidez, es por eso que tiene una gran demanda y trabaja mucho para satisfacerla, ya que sabe que es un muy buen ingreso para su negocio. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también ha logrado poner una tienda de abarrotes, negocio que la ayuda a obtener los ingresos familiares. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados en las prendas que teje. Con todo el trabajo realiza, espera tener más adelante una tienda de ropa, donde pueda vender ella misma la ropa que teje y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para confeccionar más prendas y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a las tiendas con las que trabaja.
texts.en:
Jhanet, 32-years-old, is a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Robert (33-years-old), and their 3 beloved children, to whom she wants to be able to provide a better quality of life. She spends her days knitting sweaters, scarves, gloves, and other garments. Her knitted products are bought by clothing stores in the city of Huancayo, where they're sold very quickly. She works hard to satisfy the high demand for her products because she knows it's a good income for her business. In addition to this activity, she has also managed to start a grocery shop, a business that helps her cover her family expenses. What she loves most about her job is knitting, which she does very well. She's knitted for 12 years and says that the most difficult part is putting the finishing touches on the garments that she knits. With all the work she does, she hopes to eventually open a clothing shop, where she herself will be able to sell the garments she makes and improve her income. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she's saving money to make her payments on time because she doesn't want to cause problems with the members of her communal bank, where she is very happy. With the money she's requesting she will buy more wool to make more garments and offer a better variety to the stores with which she works.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of wool to increase her knitting production

loans.name: Pay

texts.en: Pay Sreyleang, 42, is a professional tailor making US$1 each day in Takeo Province. Her husband, pictured here, makes approximately US$2.50 daily working in construction. Pay is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband so that he can operate a moto-taxi whenever he is free from construction duties.

loans.use: To purchase and operate a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years. Her mixed farm produces maize and vegetables which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her business of selling clothes to the local market. Her major challenge in farming has been unpredictable weather conditions and lack of a solid market for her products.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her improve the livelihood of her family. She hopes that in future she will be a major breeder and supplier of dairy and poultry products to a wider market.

Hellen is 40 years old. She is married with 3 children ages 3, 16 and 17. Two of the children are currently attending school. She hopes that Juhudi will diversify its products to other ventures like school-fees loans and general business loans.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. María Ursula; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella tiene una carreta de venta de golosinas en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m y por miedo de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio teniendo otra carreta y asi ir aumentando su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como galletas, dulces, chupetes y gaseosas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María Ursula belongs to the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

María is 27 years old, a single mother and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business, selling sweets.  She has a cart from which she sells sweets in an itinerant manner.  She works from 8.00am until 3.00pm and through her small business she supports her children.  María would like to expand her business by buying another cart and thereby steadily grow her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets such as cookies, candies, lollipops and soda.

María would like to thank those who are participating in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase sweets such as cookies, candies, lollipops and soda

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco S. is from the village of Brgy. San Nicolas, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. He is 29 years old and is single. To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport in the local community. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Francisco from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

location.town: Brgy. San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es:
El Sr Fabio F., es un microempresario jóven, tiene  31 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres en el barrio San Pablo, es el mayor de tres  hermanos.
Fabio cuenta que ha trabajado mucho tiempo en otras Empresas dedicados a la confección de prendas y bordados de las mismas.
Pero con el tiempo y considerando ya el conocimiento que adquirió en cuanto a las producciones, el manejo de las máquinas, la atención al cliente, decidió ir formando de a poco para su microempresa y de esa manera independizarse, fue así que ayudados por sus familiares  quienes le cedieron espacio en la casa para que pueda habilitar una oficina y un taller de producción, más adelante fue adquiriendo  su primera máquina de hacer los bordados, que en un principio era suficiente para los primeros trabajos que realizaba por su cuenta.
Pero luego de unos años ya no abastecía con los pedidos de trabajos, y fue así que con mucho sacrificio adquirió una nueva máquina más sofisticada, que producía 10 diseños de bordados  en 10  minutos, y de esa manera hoy día puede cumplir con todos los clientes que tiene en las diferentes empresas renombradas del país.
A parte le encanta realizar sus propios diseños de bordados, para poder inclusive  ofrecer una gama de sugerencias a todos sus usuarios.
Dice que:  “Contar con un crédito siempre es bueno ya que le permite poder adquirir las diferentes materias primas que necesita para poder cumplir en tiempo y de esa manera brindar también calidad a los clientes”.
texts.en:
Fabio F. is a young businessman.  He is 31 years old and lives in his parents' home in San Pablo neighborhood.  He is the oldest of three siblings.

Fabio tells us that he has worked for a long time for other companies who make garments and embroideries.  However, over time and bearing in mind the knowledge which he had acquired as regards the production process, working machines and serving customers, Fabio decided to set up his own small business.  Helped by family members who provided him with space in their homes, he was able to set up an office and a workshop.  He acquired his first machine for making embroideries which was originally enough to cover the first jobs that he carried out in his own business.

However, for some years he couldn't manage with the orders which he had and so, through a lot of hard work, he acquired a new, more sophisticated machine which was able to produce 10 embroidery designs in 10 minutes.  In this way he is currently able to satisfy his customers who work for a number of well-known companies.

Fabio loves creating his own embroidery designs since it allows him to offer a range of suggestions to all his customers.

He says “Having a loan is always good because it allows me to acquire different raw materials which I need to fill my orders on time and thereby provide quality to my customers”.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fabric and colored threads to create embroideries

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs.Sim C. is a 50-year-old married woman and a local villager living in Kompong Cham Province. She and her husband are local farmers. This couple is blessed with three children, two are single and one is married. Sim owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy some fertilizer. She will use the remainder of the loan to buy some seed for additional planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for additional planting

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun K., 33, sells fish and vegetables, earning an income of $5 US per day. K. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple.

The family has to spend $50 US on food, $7 US on electricity supply, and $80 US on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase more fish and vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fish and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Lucy Paquita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a Lucy. Tiene 39 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Está en el  Banco Comunal ya por dos años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer, además porque le han ayudado mucho para mantener su negocio.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su mama le ayuda en la atención de los clientes, también vende helados y artículos de bazar, los productos los recibe en su local, nos cuenta que tiene su tienda ya por 10 años y que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '11 de Septiembre' (September 11th) community bank meets in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Lucy.  She is 39 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home.  She has been a member of the community bank for two years and she likes it because the loan repayments are easy to make and also because they have helped her a lot in supporting her business.

Lucy has a store where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oils and detergents.  She works in her store every day from 6.00am to 9.00pm and sometimes until even later.  Her mom helps her to serve her customers.  They also sell frozen treats and general market-place items.  Her products are delivered to her premises.  She tells us that she has had her store for 10 years and, thanks to God, it has done very well.

Lucy will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other household essentials.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business and for her store to keep growing every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other household essentials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a plumber since 1992. In 2002, he decided to work as a freelance plumber depending on customers' requests. He is the only income provider of his family. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed products so he can enlarge his business and be able to stick with multiple construction projects as a result of increasing his income.

loans.use: to purchase needed products

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en: Faustin is 25 years old, and his shop is called Amizero. He is single and very hardworking. Faustin owns a boutique in which he sells rice, flour, wheat and other foodstuffs. Faustin has done this business for 3 years, and it has enabled him buy his own motorcycle and a piece of land. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs and hence make more profits. Faustin plans to use his profits for his house construction.

loans.use: Buying foodstuffs for his shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family as a wholesaler/retailer of charcoal. She lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard selling charcoal, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Gloria is borrowing PHP 25,000 to fund the operation of her business. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund the operations of her business

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is water bills.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past two years, selling at retail prices to her neighbors and passersby. Claris faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en:
Kochkorka is one of many villages that keep a vast variety of animals including sheep, goats, cows and horses. Kyrgyz people are proud of their horsemanship. It is often said that Kyrgyz boys learn to ride before they can walk. Cattle and other animals have played a tremendous role in Kyrgyz culture and history since nomadic times. Anarkul A., 54, is the leader of this group. A proud mother of five children, she values animals like her own family. Her mother taught her to have a tender attitude towards animals so that they, in turn, can feel and reward you with help in hard times.

Anarkul's husband coaches in a local sports school and devotes his entire free time to helping Anarkul feed the cattle and take them to a cattle yard. Their children are no longer financially dependent on Anarkul and her husband. The reselling of cattle allows the couple to cover their daily expenses and improve home comforts. The idea originated two years ago, thanks to the advice of close friends, well-trained cattle breeders. The couple borrowed some funds to start up the business. They later earned enough to repay their debts in time. Now that the business allows her to cover her costs, Anarkul gathered together this group, which she believes deserves financial assistance from Kiva lenders. Anarkul is a very responsible and self-organized leader who promises to repay the loan on time. Her personal purpose for the loan is to purchase extra heads of cattle for further resale. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mosses A. Koroma's Group

texts.en:
These are the teachers of the RC Primary School in Pamlap village, which is located on the outskirts of Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. RC Primary School was built during the 1973/74 academic year by the local community with help from the Catholic Church, and has a total of fourteen staff members and 564 pupils. 

Mosses A. K. is the headmaster at the school. He was born in Yele, in the Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has eight children, three of whom are in college. Mosses has been a teacher for 45 years and is requesting a loan to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for his children

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina K. is 32 years old and is currently in a restaurant business.  She will use her loan to stock more food.  She is married to a farmer and they have two children.  Only one of the children are going to school.  Her future goal is to open a shop.

loans.use: Stock more food to sell.

loans.name: Sren

texts.en:
Sren S. is 27 years old, married and devoted to two children who are students at the local public school. She stays at home to manage the family and is also involved in planting rice crop on her farmland for income. She is married to 29-year-old Vor Sovann, who helps support the family by running a motor taxi.

Sren S. thinks that it is time to open new small business in order to increase their income to support the family. Sren S. said she doesn’t have enough funds to run her retail business. So she is applying for a loan to buy some goods like cooking ingredients, water, shampoo, and other items for sale. With this loan, she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy water, shampoo, cooking ingredients and other items for retail sale.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Jeune femme mariée de 26 ans et mère de deux enfants, Virginie est revendeuse de chaussures à Lomé depuis 2000 et pour les besoins de sa clientèle elle se ravitaille sur place .cette activité lui a permis d’aider son conjoint dans les charges qui lui incombe. Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt et est une  femme de bonne moralité.
texts.en: A young married woman of 26 and a mother of two, Virginie has been selling shoes at Lomé since 2000 and for the needs of her clientele, she stocks up on site. This business has allowed her to help her spouse with the expenses that fall on her. She is on her third loan and is a moral woman.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Elenita has a retail shop where she sells beverages, coconut wines & snacks. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additonal stocks of beverages. Elenita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal stocks of beverages

loans.name: William

texts.es: William de 29 años, convive con alejandrina de 26 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijas, Jenifer de 3 años y Yazury de 3 meses de nacido. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. William es un hombre lleno de vida con un futuro muy prospero quien decidió emprender un negocio en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene 07 años en este negocio y considera que aún le es rentable, pues durante estos años ha logrado posicionar su tienda y ahora es muy concurrido por todas las personas que viven en la zona.  William con el crédito obtenido desea  ampliar su bodega, además abastecerse de variados productos. Sin embargo el no contar con movilidad para transportar los productos que comprar al por mayor y  trasladarlos hasta su bodega le resulta complicado, ya que el costo de transporte es muy caro. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo espera que lo apoyen con el desarrollo de su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, ampliará su bodega y abastecerse de productos.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old and lives with his partner, 26 year-old Alejandrina.  The couple have two daughters: 3 year-old Jenifer and 3 month-old Yazury.  They live together in a rental house in the village of Natividad, in Pichari district.

William is a man who is full of life and has a very prosperous future.  He decided to set up a business selling basic household products.  He has been in this business for seven years and considers it to be profitable.  Over the years, he has managed to position his store and now it is very popular with all the people who live in his area.  William would like to use his loan to expand his store and stock it with a variety of products.  However, he does not have a vehicle which he can use to transport the products that he buys wholesale to his store.  It is complicated and the transportation costs are very high.

This is William's second loan from MFP.  He hopes that you will support him in developing his business.  He will use the money he is requesting to expand his store and stock it with products.

loans.use: to expand his store and stock it with products

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es: Hugo Alberto de cuarenta años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una venta de sorbete artesanal que junto a su esposa preparan en su misma casa y posteriormente distribuye en  diferentes colegios y universidades, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan los jovenes estudiantes, exquisitos sabores naturales y a precios accesibles, de coco, tamarindo, arrayan, nance, entre otros, Hugo es muy servicial y atento con sus clientes. Es un hombre de trabajo que se levanta desde muy temprano a ganarse el pan de cada día,  él piensa que hay que disfrutar el trabajo que nos lleva al éxito por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de materias primas como hielo, azucar, jarabes y frutas, para producir mayor cantidad de helados, así crezca el negocio y siempre tenga lo que sus clientes demanden. Hugo Alberto tiene la confianza que esta es la mejor forma de llevar a su hogar estabilidad económica y una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo Alberto is forty years old and lives with his life partner and children in his own house.  He owns a business selling handmade sorbets that he and his wife prepare in their home to then distribute to different schools and universities.  He has a lot of customers because they prefer his product since he always has what the young students need, and exquisite natural flavors at reasonable prices.  He sells sorbets made from coconut, tamarind, myrtle, and nance, among others.  

Hugo is very service-oriented and attentive to his customers.  He is a worker that rises very early in order to be a breadwinner each day.  He believes that one must enjoy the work that brings us success.  This why he requests a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy a greater quantity of raw materials such as ice, sugar, syrups and fruits to make more of his ices.  This way, his business will grow and he’ll have what the customers demand.  

Hugo Alberto has confidence that this is the best way to bring financial stability to his home and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: buy ice, sugar, syrups and fruits.

loans.name: Masinambane Group

texts.en:
Thembisile is 53 years old and married with nine children between 22 and 32 years old. She also takes care of two relatives in her home in Mandini, South Africa. Over the last three years, she has been in business raising chickens and selling them from her home. She requested a loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase more chickens to increase her stock.

Over the next five years, Thembisile hopes to expand her stock to include general items like food and clothes. She says that the biggest problem her business faces is that her customers buy on credit and fail to repay her. She would like to thank Kiva and WDB for helping her a lot. The money she makes from her chickens will help to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 30 años, convive con Nelly de 25 años, con quien tiene 2 hijas. Juntos residen en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito de Sivia. Félix es una persona que se caracteriza por tener muchos proyectos, pero él asegura que debe realizarlo con mucha cautela, para llegar a cumplir su meta. Es por ello que empezó cultivando cacao, actividad que lo realiza con su esposa. A medida que sus ventas incrementaron, incursionó en la producción de cacao injertado, pues el desarrollo de este fruto es más grande de lo normal y crecen en un menor tiempo. Hasta el momento lo que ha producido no le basta, es por ello que espera ampliar su siembra de esta planta, pues aún tiene tierras que le falta sembrar. Además se siente tranquila por que sabe que una vez llegue la cosecha, su familia le dará su apoyo en la extracción de sus frutos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.500 soles que solicita, desea comprar más plantas de cacao.
texts.en: Félix is 30 years old and lives with his partner Nelly, 25 years old, with whom he has 2 daughters.  Together they live in their own house located in the Santa Rosa Alta community in the district of Sivia.  Félix is a person who has many projects, but he asserts that he has to undertake them with great caution in order to meet his goal.  This is why he started growing cacao, an activity that he carries out with his spouse.  As his sales grew, he moved into the production of grafted cacao, since this fruit grows larger than normal and grows in a shorter amount of time.  Up to this point, what he has grown has not been enough for him. That is why he hopes to increase the amount of this plant that he sows, since he still has fields that are not planted.  Also, he feels calm because he knows that once the harvest time comes, his family will help him to bring in the produce.  This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time.  With the 2,500 soles he is asking for, he would like to buy more cacao plants.

loans.use: to purchase cacao plants.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
La  señora María de Lourdes, es casada con el señor Abildai y tiene una hija a su responsabilidad de nombre tahalí de ocho años de edad.

    Ella se dedica a su  hogar y solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía ay surtir su negocio de abarrotes en donde lleva un año y comenta que le va bien ya que  con ello  tenido un mejor ingreso para sacar adelante a su familia.

    Lo que lo inspiro a esta actividad fue su familia ya que para mejorar sus ingresos tenía que tener un trabajo el cual le dejara una buena ganancia para sostener a su pequeña hija, así también apoyar a su esposo con el trabajo.

     Lo que más desea es que la sigan apoyando para que con el tiempo su  actividad sea más amplia con mercancía de mejor calidad, para así tener sus propios ahorros y apoyar a su hija con su educación.
texts.en:
María de Lourdes is married to Abildai and she is raising a daughter named Tahalí, who is eight years old.  

She is a homemaker who is asking for the loan to invest in buying merchandise to supply her small grocery store she has had for a year. She remarks that it has gone well for her since with it she has had more income to get her family ahead.

What inspired her to do this activity was her family, since to improve their income, she had to have a job which would get her good earnings to support her young daughter, as well well as support her husband in his job.  

What she wants the most is to keep having support so that in time her activity will be bigger with better quality merchandise so that she will have her own savings and be able to support her daughter in her education.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of merchandise to supply her small grocery store.

loans.name: J. Santana

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora J Santana le está haciendo falta la construcción de un cuarto al frente de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es  block, cemento, varilla y arena, para empezar a construir la recamara que será para su hijo, y así podrá tener su propio espacio en la casa. 
Doña J Santana planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, ya que su esposo el señor José se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una agencia, como guardia de seguridad. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
J. Santana needs a room to be built at the front of her house.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy material like cement blocks, cement, rods, and sand.  She needs these to start building a bedroom for her son.  That way he will have his own space in the house.

J. Santana plans to pay back the loan with the earnings she gets from selling beauty products by catalog.  

Her husband, José, takes care of the family expenses and school expenses with the salary he gets from working as a security guard for an agency.  They want to improve their family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to start building a room on the front of the house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a determined businessman who is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last three years, he has been operating a retail shop to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to buy a plot. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sweets, torches and biscuits. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy sweets, torches and biscuits

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesus

texts.es:
Mercedes, es madre soltera, vive junto con sus dos hijos de 19 y 25 años, su esposo murió hace seis meses, por el cual a ella le toca trabajar, se dedica a vender pollos y cerdos en el mercado de 4:00 am a 6:00 pm todos los días.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar pollos y cerdos, para mejorar sus ventas, y generar más ingresos, para el sostén de su familia.
El sueño de Mercedes es que salgan adelante sus hijos en el estudio y que el futuro sean unos profesionales, y dar un apoyo económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a single mother who lives with her two children, ages 19 and 25. Her husband died six months ago, which is why she has to work. Mercedes sells chickens and pigs at the market from 4am to 6pm every day.

She needs a loan to buy chickens and pigs so that she can improve her sales and generate more income to sustain her family. Mercedes dreams of seeing her children move forward with their studies so that they can become professionals in the future and provide financial support for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Ruth Liliana

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos.
Ruth tiene una tienda de Bicicletas y repuestos, ella siempre tenía este negocio, claro que antes era poco, pero ahora aumentó su capital y ventas, esta feliz porque en su Banco Comunal le brindan la ayuda que necesita, las capacitaciones y el apoyo que ha recibido han hecho que ella pueda crecer en su tienda, le encanta el ahorro que gracias a ello se puede trazar metas a largo plazo. Con el préstamo comprará repuestos para las bicicletas, la meta que siempre se traza es poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Ruth is a member of the communal bank Tarpuy.  She is 30 and has two children.  Ruth runs a bicycle and repair parts shop which she has had for a long time.  Before she did not have a lot of business but now her sales and capital have increased.  She is pleased that the communal bank has given her the help she needs as well as training and support so she could expand her store.  She loves being able to save so she can establish long-term goals.  She plans to use the loan to buy repair parts for the bicycles.  He ongoing goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lily is 46 years old, widowed, and has four children. Lily owns and operates a business, providing clothing alteration and tailoring services to local community members.  She has been in this business for three years.  

Lily is requesting a loan for 2,700 WST, which she will use to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the profits from her business, estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week, to improve and expand her business.

Lily joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lily's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 MAI 2001. Il  est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Khadidiatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 13 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge une partie de sa belle famille.

Elle s’active dans la vente de cacahouette. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité,qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de rembourser ses prets et d'épargner.
texts.en:
This cooperative group was created on May 28, 2001.  It is made up of eleven women who live in the same neighborhood.  Their primary activity is sales.

Mrs. Khadidiatou, at right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group leader.  She is 66 years old, married, and the mother of 13 children.  She is also responsible for some of her in-laws.  She sells peanuts and has several years of experience in the business.

This loan will allow Mrs. Khadidiatou to increase her capital and better develop her business.  The profits will allow her to repay her loans and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 54 years old, married and lives with her husband and her son who are both working.

Samira is an owner of a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing through.

She decided to apply for this loan of $1800 in order to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her store's inventory. She is aiming to gain more profits to allow her to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her store's inventory.

loans.name: Webanania Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Webanania Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne is the facilitator of the Webanania group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Everlyne is a mother to two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest two bags of maize on half an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Webanania group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
46-year-old Imelda earns a living providing mobile prepaid credit and selling softdrinks. She has had this business for 10 years. Imelda earns 10000 PHP each month. She plans to use her loan to buy more mobile prepaid credit and soft drinks to sell.

Imelda works hard to support her family of a husband and a 3-year-old child. One of her goals is to save for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more mobile prepaid credit and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the tailoring industry for the last six years, and he earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. He is 57 years old, married to Mary, and they have three children who are in secondary school.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more cloth fabric to make dresses.

The anticipated profits he will save and purchase a modern sewing machine. John hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy cloth fabric for making dresses.

loans.name: Las Limas Group

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es uno de los miembros del grupo las limas el cual esta integrado por 16 personas, este grupo esta ubicado en una comunidad la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido ya que a sus alrededores hay muchos arboles principalmente arboles de hule. 

Doña Gloria tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio hasta el bachillerato y esta casada con don Juan que trabaja como jornalero, ella tiene tres hijos pero actualmente solo depende de ella el mas pequeño de nombre Alan Emilio el tiene 16 años y estudia la preparatoria. 

Doña Gloria es una señora muy trabajadora y alegre y platica que desde hace mas de 15 años con el apoyo de su esposo abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar con el propósito de ayudar un poco a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, con el pasar de los años su negocio ha ido creciendo y surtiéndose mas,ella dice que ella y su familia atienden su negocio abre todos los días de ocho de la mañana a nueve de la noche y siempre le gusta tener aunque sea un poquito de todo para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que necesitan y así animarlos a que vuelvan a comprar con ella.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Arroz, Frijol, Sopa, Aceite, cloro , jabon, dulces, papel higiénico,azucar, cafe, sal y refrescos   para resurtir su negocio y continuar con sus ventas.

Doña Gloria espera que con este crédito su negocio continué creciendo ya que desea poder a poyar a su hijo para que estudie una profesión.

los demas integrantes del grupo son: 

Abel venta de pan
Georgina venta de frescos
Maria venta de manualidades
Antelma venta de manualidades
Dulce Maria club nutricional 
Leonor venta de cosmeticos
Lidia venta de topper 
Maribel venta de pollo 
Jeny Damaris venta de catalago 
Nieves venta de reposteria
Nidia venta de zapatos 
Irene molino 
Martha cocina economica
Nayrobi panaderia 
Zulibet abarrotes
texts.en:
Doña Gloria is one of the members of the group "Las Limas," which consists of 16 people. This group is located in a community which is characterized by its warm climate, since there are many trees on its outskirts, principally rubber trees.

Doña Gloria is 49 years old. She studied up to the high school certificate level, and she is married to Don Juan, who works as a day-laborer. She has three children, but now only the youngest, Alan Emilio, depends on her. He is 16 and goes to preparatory school.

Doña Glora is a very hard-working, happy, and chatty woman who, more than 15 years ago, with the support of her husband, opened a little grocery store in her home with the idea of helping her husband a little with the household expenses. With the passage of time, her business has been growing and providing more. She says that she and her family tend to the business, which is open every day from eight in the morning until nine at night, and she always likes to have even just a bit of everything so that her customers always find what they need and thus are encouraged to come back to buy from her.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, soup, oil, bleach, soap, sweets, toilet paper, sugar, coffee, salt, and soft drinks to restock her business and continue with her sales.

Doña Gloria hopes that with this loan her business will continue growing, since she wants to support her son so that he can study for a career.

The other members of the group are: Abel, who sells bread; Georgina, who sells beverages; Maria, who sells handicrafts; Antelma, who sells handicrafts; Dulce Maria, who has a nutritional club; Leonor, who sells cosmetics; Lidia, who sells tupperware; Maribel, who sells chicken; Jeny Damaris, who does catalog sales; Nieves, who sells confectionery; Nidia, who sells shoes; Irene, who has a mill; Martha, who has a home-style restaurant; Nayrobi, who has a bakery; and Zulibet, who sells groceries.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soup, bleach, soap, sweets, toilet paper, sugar, coffee, salt, and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia extracts palm oil for sale at Efutu. She has been doing this for the past 10 years now.  Her husband also extracts oil for sale.  They have 4 children. Cecilia assists her husband in paying utility bills.  She needs this loan to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale.  With the new profits, Cecilia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract the oil for sale.

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
Jairo, de 34 años, originario de Telpaneca municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene tres hijos de 12,10 y 4 años de edad, de oficio comerciante , el vende monturas para caballo. Inicio sus actividades con capital propio que tenia ahorrado de su trabajo anterior donde elaboraba monturas para caballos en el taller de su tío pero el soñaba con un día tener su propio negocio y con la experiencia adquirida salir delante de forma independiente para sacar adelante a su familia. 
El realizo el crédito compra de materia prima tales como baquetas, clavos, cuero y pago de mano de obra para elaborar monturas. Esto le ayudara a la fabricación de un mayor números de monturas y poderlas vender por cantidad al por mayor. El tiene como meta agrandar su negocio darse a conocer fuera de Estelí para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Le gustaría hacer mejoras a su casa ya que actualmente donde vive la casa es de tabla y cuando llueve se moja todo.
texts.en:
34-year-old Jairo is from Telpaneca, Estelí.  He is married and has three children who are 12, 10 and 4 years old.  He is a salesman by trade and sells horse saddles.  He started his business with his own capital which he saved up from his previous job making horse saddles in his uncle's workshop.  He dreamed of one day owning his own business and used the experience he had gained to move ahead independently in order to provide for his family.

Jairo will use this loan to buy raw materials such as rods, nails and leather.  He will also pay people to make saddles.  This will help him to make more saddles and he will be able to sell them in bulk, wholesale.  Jairo's goal is to expand his business and to become known outside of Estelí, so that he can provide his family with a better standard of living.  He would like to make some improvements to his home as the house in which he currently lives is made from wood and, when it rains, everything gets wet.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as rods, nails and leather, and to pay people to make saddles

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a farmer, which she has been doing for seven years, producing and selling milk, eggs, and maize to the local market in her hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya.

Beatrice is requesting a loan for 102,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to expand her farming business in two areas: dairy and poultry farming. She will use 52,000 KES  to buy and insure a dairy cow and the rest to expand her poultry business by buying more birds. 

Beatrice states that her seven years of experience in farming has proved to her that someone can rely on farming for her family upkeep. Her major challenge in farming remains the rampant animal diseases but she is optimistic that she will be owning five dairy cows in five years.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zagnanabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, WAWA personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115.000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: para la compra de todos los materiales de construccion necesarios y pago de mano de obra

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah has been a good member of Mercury Mothers Women Group since 2002. She is hard working and utilizes every opportunity to her disposal. She has managed to educate her children and bought 2 dairy cows. She grows and sells vegetables, beans and maize. Her sales per month total $100 but in a dry season it falls down because of limited water to irrigate the crops. This is why she wants to buy a water tank in order to store enough water. After buying a water tank, her income inflow will remain positive and growth will be realized.

loans.use: She wants to buy a water tank to store water for irrigation in a dry season.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region. He relocated to Sumgayit city with his wife and one child. He has owned his butcher shop for the past seven years. Isa is applying for a loan to increase the amount of goods at his shop as well as to purchase new scales.

loans.use: To increase the amount of goods and buy scales

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en: Aiga is a married mother of four. Her husband is an experienced designer and painter. He designs T-shirts and wraparounds sold at local stores that attract tourists, and she runs the business.

loans.use: Purchase of brushes, paints, and materials wholesale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 40 and has 4 sons aged 5 to 14. Her main business is raising ducks. She buys eggs and breeds the ducks at her house. With the help of TYM she has been able to increase her flock to 1,000 ducks. Now she wants to buy an incubator to breed more and under stable conditions. She also needs to buy vaccines, since her home province Nghe An was hit by the bird flu.

loans.use: buy an incubator for raising ducks

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José Raúl (in the center of the photo) is originally from a place called Creel in the state of Chihuahua. He is married and has three small children. His wife is a nurse and works in a town near Creel. To take care of his little ones and obtain the resources the family needs, José started his carpentry workshop next to his house. Fortunately, the good work he does has helped him increase his sales and now, in order to fill all the orders, he uses the help of two employees.

In order to imoprove the quality of his service and to offer more detailed work José needs tools, for which he is requesting a loan for $475, which he promises to repay in 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help this family. They thank you very much for your generosity and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

José Raúl (al centro de la foto) es originario de la localidad de Creel en el estado de Chihuahua, está casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos, su esposa es enfermera y trabaja en un pueblo cerca de Creel, para estar al cuidado de sus pequeños y obtener los recursos que necesita su familia José inició su taller de carpintería al lado de casa. Afortunadamente el buen trabajo que realiza le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas y para cubrir sus pedidos ahora cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleados.

Para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y brindar trabajos más detallados José necesita de herramienta, para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Oger

texts.en:
Oger is a butcher in Marcory, which is south of Abidjan. He is 34 years old and has been running his butcher business for more than 8 years. He has a slaughterhouse and a butcher table where he resells meat in the market.

Oger wants to purchase some cows for the end of year period when the demand for protein and meat is very high for Christmas, New Year's, and AId el Kebir. He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,050.

Oger is dynamic and honest. He works very hard and he has been a very good performer in AE&I's microcredit program.

loans.use: Oger wants to purchase cows

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen B.. I want to have a loan for my husband who is a rickshaw driver.  He will use this loan to pay all the remaining installments of his rickshaw . This way he will no more have to pay heavy interest rate to the moneylender, if he manages to pay him upfront.
 I am a textile designer and I make designs on ladies shirts with sequins and other ornaments. Moreover, I am a mother of seven, five of whom attend a local school whereas the other two will be enrolled in school in a near future.Our economic conditions are not very good and we need to earn a better living for ourself.

loans.use: Pay for the installments of the rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his milk selling business

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Venancia Justin. She is married with three children, ages 8, 12, and 13. In 2001 Venancia established an African clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of African clothing.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat M. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, is married with 5 children and has a high school diploma. Muhabbat has an agricultural business. She owns a piece of land where she plants wheat. She wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоева Мухаббат Умбаровна проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 51 год. Замужем имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее.Домохозяйка, занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли, который засеивает пшеницей. Планирует получить кредит для покупки семян пшеницы и удобрений. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seedsa and fertilizer

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Alejo is 27 years old, single and earns a living as a jeweler and merchant. He completed his High School education at a public school in his native city of Luque.

Alejo used to work in his parent's butcher shop where he used to deliver the customer's orders. Currently he has a small workshop in his house, where he makes different types of gold and silver jewelery such as bracelets, necklaces, rings, etc.

In the future, Alejo would like to obtain a college degree and open a large jewelery store in his city's downtown area, since he has great skills and has several clients that order pieces every month which they resale.

The loan will be used to purchase materials such as pure silver, copper, wire and a few tools he is in need of.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Alejo es soltero tiene 27 años es de profesión joyero y comerciante; culmino sus estudios secundarios en un colegio nacional de su ciudad natal, Luque.

Alejo trabajaba con sus padres en la carnicería que poseían, en donde el realizaba los repartos de pedidos de clientes. Actualmente cuenta con un pequeño taller en su casa, en donde reliza todo tipo de joyas en plata y oro, como brazaletes, collares, anillos, etc.

En el futuro le gustaría seguir una carrera universitaria y montar una joyería grande en el centro de la ciudad, ya que posee muy buenas técnicas de trabajos y varios clientes que mensualmente le solicitan joyas para vender.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales tales como plata pura, cobre, alambre y algunas herramientas que necesitaba.

loans.use: Purchase precious metal such as silver, gold and a few tools.

loans.name: Nora Nelly

texts.es:
