Nelly is married. Her husband works in transport and her children are now grown and no longer live with her. Even so, she wanted to embark on a project that would allow her to generate more income to help her husband with the household expenses. Three years ago she started selling jewelry from a catalog. At first she sold to relatives and friends; over time her clientele has grown and she has achieved good sales.

Nelly is currently requesting a loan for $575, which she will repay in 6 months and will invest in the purchase of merchandise to sell. With your help Nelly will continue her progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly esta casada su esposo trabaja como transportista y sus hijos ya son mayores y ya no viven con ellos, aun así ella deseaba emprender alguna actividad que le permitiera generar mas ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Inicio hace 3 años con la venta de joyería por catalogo, vendiéndole a sus familiares y amigos, con el tiempo su cartera de clientes se ha incrementado y ha logrado buenas ventas.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu ayuda Nelly seguirá con su negocio

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia E. is forty-two years old. She is married and has two sons and three daughters who are currently in school. Anastasia owns and operates a grocery store, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She enjoys running her own business and is motivated to work hard, because she dreams of a better future for her children. However, Anastasia is constrained by insufficient capital. She is therefore requesting a loan to be able to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, and other items to increase her sales and income. Anastasia is a member of a community group called Nyame kye Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Abilio Guillermo

texts.es:
Mr. Abilio B. is a 54-year-old married father of a 2-year-old-son. Mr. B.’ wife looks after their son and the house. He and his family live in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua.

Mr. B. has been working as a driver for ten years. He needs this loan for home improvements such as building a cement wall that used to be made of wood.

He plans to finish building his cement house in order to provide his young son with more safety.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Abilio tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Hialeah, tiene un niño de 2 años de edad, su esposa es quien se encarga de cuidar la casa y el niño.

Don Abilio trabaja como conductor y lleva diez año laborando en esta profesión. El préstamo lo requiere para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, como es la construcción de una pared de concreto que anteriormente era de madera.

Sus planes es terminar de construir su casa de concreto, para darle mayor seguridad a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Build cement wall

loans.name: Tarangire Group

texts.en:
Hamida, 37 years old, is a mother of three girls. They are 12, 9, and 7. She is widowed and raises the children on her own. She runs a clothing store called 'Babiki' in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She has operated the business since 2003 and works from 9am to 4pm daily. She earns about $120 a month. With this loan from Kiva, Hamida hopes to renovate her business. By adding a new frame and supporting structure she will be able to increase the size of her business and add more inventory. She has taken out three loans from Tujijenge previously and successfully paid back all of them.

Hamida is the group leader of the Tarangire group. Along with five other members, who operate in the clothing, charcoal, and food sector, she will share this loan. The group members take out the loan together, and guarantee each other's payments. Therefore, the repayment of the loan is guaranteed.

loans.use: To renovate the business and add a new frame to her shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Señora Maria lives on Ave. José Antonio Chambilla in the Neighborhood Alianza Mazocruz. She is 33 years old and she studied until the fourth year of secondary school. She is now married and a mother of three children.

She is a member of the Community Bank Julia Jiménez in the District of Santa Rosa of the Province of Collao, Region Puno. With the first loan, she bought ingredients to prepare foods, and little by little she went increasing her capital. Changing businesses two years ago, she is now dedicated to selling appliances like: radios, recorders, televisions, DVD, and spare parts.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy three TVs with DVDs, two normal DVD players, converters, and spare parts for appliances.

Doña Maria always works with the support of her husband. Her dream is to make her business grow and sell in other markets like Capazo, Huaytiri, and others. She always liked doing business; she began doing sales when she was eight years old.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria vive en la Av. José Antonio Chambilla s/n Barrio Alianza Mazocruz. ella tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto año de secundaria es casada y madre de tres hijos.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez del Distrito de Santa Rosa de la Provincia del Collao, Región Puno, con el primer préstamo compró víveres para seguir preparando viandas ( comida ), poco a poco fue aumentando su capital cambiando de negocio hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de artefactos como : radios, grabadoras, televisores, DVD y repuestos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 03 DVD con pantalla, 02 DVD normales, conversores, repuestos para artefactos.

Doña Maria siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Su sueño es hacer crecer más su negocio y vender en otras ferias como Capazo, Huaytiri y otros, siempre le gustó hacer negocio, ella empezó a vender desde la edad de ocho años.

loans.use: Buy DVD systems, converters, and spare parts for appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials and products for her small beauty salon.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 52 años, un padre muy responsable, mas aún, cuando la madre de sus hijos los abandonó, desde entonces  su mayor anhelo es darles una buena educación a ellos.   En horas de la mañana, todos días prepara los alimentos de sus hijos, y luego se va a trabajar  a su chacra hasta horas de la noche.  Desde muy niño se dedicó al campo, le gusta la actividad que realiza, pero lo que le falta son herramientas adecuadas para sus cultivos, aun así ha sembrado maíz con dificultades.   Alfredo se desvela por la educación de sus hijos desde hace tres años, ellos son el motivo de su trabajo y esfuerzo.  Desea adquirir herramientas de trabajo para la chacra, que le permitan limpiar de su chacra, de ese modo agrandar sus tierras para ser mejor aprovechadas.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 52, is an exceptionally responsible father. When the mother of his children abandoned them, he decided that he would provide the children with the best possible education. In the early hours of each day, he fixes meals for the children and then sets out to work his land, working until nightfall. He's been farming since he was a small boy, work that he likes. He needs better tools to cultivate his land, though, because he can only plant maize now with difficulty. Alfredo worries day and night about his children's education; they're the reason for his sweat and toil. He wants to buy work tools for the farm so that he can clear it. By clearing it, he can expand his land and better provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for farming business.

loans.name: Mrs. Nhy Sorung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of twelve people is located in Pou Khvet Village in Takeo Province and Mrs. Nhy S. is a village bank president. She is a fish seller. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell. Mrs. Nhy S. is a 52-year-old widow with two children who are all attending the local school. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% to Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha D. is a group leader of six members who all live in Trabek village in Kampong Chhnang province.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

Aside from this plantation, he is a fish seller in the local market.  Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it.  Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy more fish to re-sell.  He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.  

His wife, Mrs. Meas Chakriya, is a pig breeder.  Mr.Chantha D. is 23-years-old, and he does not have a child yet.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These four members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add his savings to buy more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Oliana

texts.en: Oliana M., 30, is married with two children.  She has four years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the villagers and general public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 US).  SPBD loans are Oliana’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase mutton flaps, chicken, sausages, soy sauce, onions, garlic, plastic plates, tissues, and pots

loans.name: Irshad Begum M. Sharif Group

texts.en:
Irshad begum baji is 48 years old, married, and has resided in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. Growing up, she unfortunately could not attain education due to her family’s financial difficulties. She is currently married to M. S., a sweetmeat maker. He has owned his own store for the past 28 years. Irshad baji is the mother of four kids: three sons and one daughter. All of her kids are currently attending the local school, and one of her sons is memorizing the holy book “Quran-e-Pak”.

Irshad baji is a very responsible lady. She helps her husband at the family business, making sweetmeats. She has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is applying again for a loan to buy materials (sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits) to expand her husband’s sweetmeat business.

She joined her current loan group with several women in her local community, all of whom are seeking to expand their family businesses. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. Atharan baji wants a loan to expand her sweetmeat selling business. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business. Ashran baji wants a loan to drive an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for sweetmeat selling business

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en: At the age of 38, Neneta C. has to find ways to earn a living to provide for the needs of her family. Her husband died 2 years ago, leaving her with 6 children. Currently, she is into buying and selling bananas; at the same time, she joins her neighbor in their traditional system of gold mining. Her first and second loans from HSPFI were used for family expenses and helped her finance her small business. She wants to engage in ready-to-wear buying and selling and needs PHP 11,000.00 as capital. She wants to see all her children finish their studies and open up a ready-to-wear store of her own.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Doña Gladys es una mujer de noble corazón y muy cariñosa, sobre todo con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos a quienes ha tratado siempre de ofrecerles lo mejor para su desarrollo, y gracias a la casa que logró instalar, sus hijos han crecido bajo un techo donde pasaron los mejores años de su infancia. Su deseo de progreso la condujo a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que con el tiempo ha aprendiendo a manejar y ha administrar, pues en un inicio tenía deudas por falta de pago, pero se percató que lo más importante es ser constante en el cobro y atender muy bien a sus clientes. Después de obtener experiencia  fue creciendo poco a poco y ahora está a punto de ser una de las jefas de promotoras de la línea que vende, pues su gran capacidad la llevaron a ser una de la mejores consultoras de belleza. Estos resultados la motivan a seguir adelante, y espera que con el tiempo no solo sea una empleada más, sino ser una directora y tener un stand de diversa variedades de productos para que las personas no tengan que esperar la entrega de sus pedidos sino tener la facilidad de encontrar los mejores productos en su tienda. Gladys trabaja con MFP más de cuatro años, este es su octavo préstamo, y junto a sus compañeras de grupo, trata de seguir trabajando con mucho compromiso y responsabilidad. Ella con los 800 soles que solicita aprovechará las ofertas de los catálogos y adquirirá grandes cantidades de productos para venderlos a mejores precios y generar ingresos adicionales en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladys is a very noble-hearted and caring woman, especially with her husband and their four children, to whom she has always tried to offer the best for their development. Thanks to the house she was able to build, her children have grown up under a roof where they have passed the best years of their childhood. Her desire to advance led her to work selling cosmetics, which she has learned to manage over time. In the beginning, she was owed many debts, but came to realize that being constant in collection and attending to her customers was most important. After obtaining some experience, her business grew little by little and now she is about to become one of the head promoters of the line she sells, as her great abilities have made her one of the best beauty consultants. This motivates her to continue advancing, and she hopes that with time she will not be just another employee, but rather a manager with a stand of diverse products so people will not have to wait to place orders--they will have the convenience of finding better products in her store. Gladys has worked with MFP for more than four years; this is her eighth loan. Along with her group companions, she strives to keep working with much commitment and responsibility. With the 800 soles she is soliciting, she will take advantage of catalog discounts and acquire greater quantities of products to sell them at better prices and generate an additional income in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rubenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rubenia M. es una dama que desde hace 15 años inició su propio negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el municipio de Somotillo donde actualmente vive y atiende en su pulpería que tanto ha invertido en ella.

Sus inicios fueron un poco difíciles como todo negocio pero a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha venido mejorando su situación y hoy en día ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos para la pulpería y de esta forma continuar mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Rubenia M. is a lady that 15 years ago started her own grocery shop business in the city of Chinandega, specifically in the municipality of Somotillo where she currently lives and works in the grocery shop where she has invested so much. Her beginnings were tough as in any business but as times went by were was able to improve her situation and today she came to Ceprodel to request for a loan to purchase items for her store and, that way, continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her business

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa D. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse d’ignames, une denrée très comestible à au Togo. Elle désire avec ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des ignames pour la revente. Son activité consiste à aller acheter des ignames dans les fermes venir les livrer aux détaillants et aux détenteurs de bar restaurant. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawa D., age 40, is married and the mother of three. She sells yams, a very edible item in Togo. She would like to use this loan, her first with FECECAV, to expand her business by buying some yams for resale. Her work consists in going to buy yams from farms and coming to deliver them to retailers and pub owners. She’s counting on this opportunity to change her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams for resale

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr: DAOUDA S. EST UN VIEL HOMME QUI EST EMPLOYE DANS UNE BOULANGERIE A THIES.IL EST MARIE ET PERE DE CINQ ENFANTS.AVEC CE PRET qu'il demande il veut acheter un four d'occasion qu'il souhaite utiliser chez lui pour avoir des revenus supplémentaires.
texts.en:
Daouda S. is an older man who works in a bakery in Thies. He is married and the father of 5 children. With this loan he wants to buy a used oven that he intends to put to work in his home to make supplementary income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of an oven

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul A. is a lovely 43-year-old divorced mother raising two children. She runs a small business at the local market, selling many types of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Ugul is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of goods and expand her merchandise selection.  She believes this will improve her business and increase her profits. Her dreams are to have her own large store one day, but most importantly, to enable her children to have a better future - one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. On behalf of Ugul and everyone here at IMON International, thank you for your support! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new fabrics for her market shop.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun P. is 20 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has been blessed with a lovely young child who is still not in school. She and her husband are local rice cultivators. Besides the farming work, Khun P. raises a few sows for their piglets to sell, which is the main source of the family's income. Khun P. will take out a loan from Kiva's partner HKL in order to buy an extra sow to raise its offspring and to purchase a cart to make transportation easier during the approaching rice harvesting season.

loans.use: To buy an extra sow to raise its offspring

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia P. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 49 years old. Delia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Delia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en: Ernalyn D. is from the village of Zone 1, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Ernalyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ernalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ernalyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a sewing machine to engage in a new business. This loan will be the 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to engage in a new business

location.town: Zone 1, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta M. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 65 years old, is widowed, and has eight adult children.

Laureta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Laureta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Laureta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline J. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 35 years old. Evangeline is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Evangeline raises livestock (pigs) for sale. Evangeline has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in a new business of buying and selling jewelriy in the local community. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a new business of buying and selling jewelry

loans.name: Barna's Group

texts.en:
Pay On Time is a group of 5 borrowers led by Barna M. who live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. Barna is 40 years old and married with 5 children ages 8-22. She also cares for 7 children who were orphaned in the war. Barna was unable to attend school, although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Barna’s sells dry goods, including palm oil, ground nuts, paper products, and toiletries that she buys wholesale in nearby Guinea and sells in a temporary market stall on the Kolahu-Foya highway. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because of the way she treats her customers. She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory to meet increased demand. Her dream is to expand her business so that, one day, she can have the biggest table in the central market. With the profits from her business, Barna dreams of sending her younger children to school.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil, ground nuts, and paper products

loans.name: Mirna Yolanda

texts.es:
la sra. MIRNA YOLANDA J. se dedica al comercio, vende ropa para dama, caballero y niños como ser pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, ropa interior, trajesitos, calsonetas, calcetines etc. el producto lo vende de manera ambulante en diferentes comunidades circunvecinas a Villa Santa y tambien vende en su casa de habitación,  tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y desde que inicio con el negocio su condición de vida a mejorado en gran manera,  vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos.
Su compañero de hogar es contratista de madera y aserrador de la misma, ya que esta es una zona 
con abundante bosque de pino.
Doña Mirna, expresa sentirse muy agradecida ya que todo por los momentos le esta saliendo y esta vendiendo mucha mercaderia, por tal razon desea un credito y asi comprar mas ropa al por mayor ya qye las exigencias de sus clientes son muchas y desea complacer a todos.

loans.use: compra de ropa para dama, caballero y niños

loans.name: Believe

texts.en: Believe makes lovely hair for her clients in her salon.She also sells hair extensions.she hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.She is a young and hard working woman.She is 31 years old and married with 2 children.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ledenisa

texts.en:
Ledenisa C. is from the village of Anonang, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old. Ledenisa is married and has two school-aged children. Ledenisa sells "alimango" (crabs) on a retail basis. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling crabs in the local community. Ledenisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ledenisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ledenisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional crabs to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ledenisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay tuition for her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: José Serafín

texts.es:
El señor José Serafín A. es padre de familia y dos hijos pequeños de edad a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la diferencia de una vivienda ya que actual mente está pagando renta y le está pidiendo que desocupe la casa, y el mejor desea tener su propio patrimonio y un lugar seguro para su familia. Es por eso que está solicitando su cooperación y así su familia tendrá su propia casa.
Don José Serafín trabaja para una canal de televisión en el departamento de productor y camarógrafo, esté ingreso es para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito. 

La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Enedelia Vázquez y un hijo, ya que cuando se realizo la visita a la casa del señor José Serafín A. el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Serafin A. is a family man with two small children, whom he wants to give the best. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for a house, since currently he is paying rent, and they are asking him to vacate the house. He desires to have his own patrimony and a safe place for his family. For this reason, he is requesting your cooperation, and this way his family will have their own house. Mr. Jose Serafin works for a television channel in the department of production and filming. This income is for his family, and in part will be used to pay back this credit. The person that appears in the picture is his wife, Mrs. Enedelia Vazquez, and one of their children, since Mr. Jose Serafin A. was at work when we visited his house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the difference of acquiring a home through a governmental credit

loans.name: Emilce

texts.en:
Emilce S. is 33 and married to Lopez Tranquilino, a professional mechanic, with whom she has two sons, aged 13 and 7 years.
About six years ago, Emilce decided to open an ice cream stall in her neighborhood. She needed to make some money because her family was going through a very difficult time financially. She decided to expand her stall to include other merchandise also. 
Now Emilce has a pantry fully stocked with a variety of goods. Thanks to her business, she was able to buy a small van to transport the goods she buys from her local market, thus avoiding delivery costs. She hopes to continue expanding her business and working with the Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sofy Azam Group

texts.en:
Hazra, 47 years old, wants to take out a loan for her bakery. She is a married woman with seven children who are in school. She needs this loan to buy wood for her business and other necessary materials.

Hazra is the leader of S. A. Group. There are four members in this group. Maryna wants to take out a loan for her quilt business. She wants to improve the business. Marzya wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Nargis wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business. She is new in her business and wants to develop her business to make a good income.

These woman are requesting a group loan of 30,000 afghani. With this loan, they can enlarge their businesses and support their families. They want to make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas, 33 years old, has a rice farming business. He is the father of three children, the eldest of whom is six years old. Tomas tills a one-and-a-half-hectare rice field to support his family. He lacks capital and has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., in order to request a loan. He has requested 15,000 Php to support his business. With the money he receives, he will buy farm supplies and fertilizers for his farm, ensuring a successful harvest. The loan has a low interest rate and is not burdensome to him.

loans.use: To fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Ndèye Mama

texts.fr: Ndèye Mama S. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de neuf enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE PEYRISSAC depuis neuf ans et demis et y a bénéficié de 17 prêts qu'elle bien gérés et remboursés. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit restaurant et de faire le commerce de volaille. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Mama S., age 48, is married and the mother of nine children. She's been a member of the Village Bank BOUCOTTE PEYRISSAC for nine years and obtained 17 loans that she managed and repaid well. Her loan enables her to develop a small restaurant and to sell poultry. She contributes to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her ability to invest

loans.name: Rafael Antonio's Group

texts.es:
Rafael U. es trabajador de una estación de combustible en el municipio de Condega. Es muy trabajador y ha tomado la decisión de duplicar sus esfuerzos en el trabajo porque tiene una finca donde siembra tomates. Por esta razón es que solicita el crédito, para ser utilizado en la compra de fertilizantes para la siembra de hortalizas. 

Rafael es soltero y tiene un hijo y en edad escolar siendo este pequeño el que le impulsa a trabajar arduamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio U. works for a fuel station (PETRONIC) as a driver, and he also washes cars. Rafael will use this loan to buy fertilizers because he has a tomato crop planted on his parents’ farm. The objective of the fertilization is to get great output and more earnings from his harvest. Rafael is single. He lives with his life partner and his school-age child. This is the third loan that he has had with Ceprodel. Rafael says that the previous loans have been a big help. He has purchased household appliances that he needs in his house, and he has paid for some personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith C. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Judith is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells. Judith is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua.
Eugenia es viuda, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, Eugenia tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Caceres en donD. venD. abarrotes en general y cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.
El sueño D. Eugenia son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Kuskanchik Communal Bank. Kuskanchik means “All Together” in Quechua. Eugenia is a 50 year old widow with 4 children. She has a stall in the Mariscal Caceres Market where she sells groceries and grain on a daily basis. Eugenia needs a loan of 1000 soles with which she would buy rice and sugar. Eugenia's dream is to have a home based shop.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos ya independizados, actualmente vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años al transporte publico en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el cubre rutas dentro de la ciudad de Olmos y sus caseríos. Estas unidades son de mucha ayuda en la zona ya que son el unico medio de transporte que utilizan los pobladores de las zonas rurales para llegar a sus caseríos.

Segundo es una presona muy entregada a su trabajo, el nos comenta que esta actividad le hace sentir util, activo y que disfruta mucho de ella. El problema es que los caminos de la zona son muy accidentados y esto siempre causa daños en los vehículos. En esta ocasión, su mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas técnicas que necesitan de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Segundo es muy conocido y respetado por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive. Ellos lo consideran una personas bastante responsable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudarlos cuando lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Segundo is 62, married, and with three grown children who are on their own. Currently he lives with his wife in the Olmos district, located in Lambayeque province, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past four years he has worked in public transport with a mototaxi (motorized vehicle used to transport people and cargo). He covers the routes inside the city of Olmos and its farm villages. These transports are a big help in the rural areas where they are the only means of transportation that the poor can use to get to their farms. Segundo is very dedicated to his work. He tells us that this work makes him feel useful, active, and he really enjoys it. The problem is that the rural roads are very rough and this always causes damage to vehicles. Now his mototaxi has begun to experience some technical problems that urgently need repair to be able to run correctly. That is why he is asking for a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 new sols. He plans to use it to repair and maintain his vehicle. Segundo is well-known and respected by the neighbors in the area where he lives. They consider him a very responsible person who is always ready to help them when they need him.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintence expenses of his mototaxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional equipment like cups and buckets

loans.name: Mary Fe

texts.en:
Mary Fe A. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Mary Fe owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials to make her handmade adornments

loans.name: Five Traders Group

texts.en:
Mamusu F. (left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Mankay village about 22 years ago. She is married to a security guard and the couple has two children who are not of school-going age. For over two years now, Mamusu has been selling fish.

This is the first loan that Mamusu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Mamusu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy fish wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale to add to her inventory

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice A. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 35 years old. Janice is married and has three school-aged children. Janice owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Janice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Janice is requesting her first loan, for 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Mrs. Sobon Naov Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group has twenty people who have selected Mrs. Sobon N. as its leader. They are located in Kaoh Reah Leu village in Kandal province and will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sobon N. was born in 1980. She sells fruit at her local market to earn money to support her family. Since her business in going well she wants to expand so she is seeking a loan to buy more papayas to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sophak Toem, is a farmer who rents a small piece of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. They have two small children.

loans.use: To buy more papayas to resell

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en: Magrate is 38 years old and married with two children aged 15 and 7.  She has been selling second-hand clothes for two years.  She was previously transporting clothes from the neighboring country, Uganda. She decided to leave the business because it was not very economical because of high transport cost. She has been saving part of her income with a group in Faulu Kenya.  The group members guarantee each other's loan and she has requested a loan for 80, 000 KES. This loan will be used to buy dresses, jackets and trousers for resale. She hopes to buy a plot of land to build residential houses in the future. Magrate describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia M.  is currently in the business of selling saddles, clothes and women's handbags at the market and is requesting a loan to stock women's headdresses and some pairs of shoes to sell.  

Lucia is 53 years old and married. She has seven children and three of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend her business by building another shop for a supermarket business.

loans.use: Stock women's headdresses and some pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eligio tiene 70 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Wenceslaa Amarilla quienes forman una familia de tres varones y una mujer las cuales todos ya se encuentran casados, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos y también tiene una despensa en su domicilio, negocio el cual administra con su esposa.
Es una persona que ha trabajado toda la vida y gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia puede gozar de una vida tranquila y sin aprietos económicos junto a su familia.
Don Eligio solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos y mercaderías para su negocio.
texts.en:
Eligio is 70 years old and married to Wenceslaa Amarilla. They have raised a family of three sons and one daughter, all of whom are now married. Eligio works buying and selling bricks, and he also has a small general store in his home, a business which he manages together with his wife. He is a person who has worked all his life, and thanks to his effort and perseverance, he can now enjoy a peaceful life without economic stress together with his family. Eligio is requesting the loan to buy bricks as well as merchandise for his store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials and merchandise to sell, such as canned and packaged foods, dairy products, cleaning supplies, etc.

loans.name: Raquel De Fatima

texts.es:
Raquel de 55 años, ella tiene un taller de costura, es madre soltera y vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil).

Inicio con el negocio porque necesitaba solventar los gastos de su familia, comenzó a coser ropa y poco a poco pudo comprar una maquina de coser. Trabaja todos los días hasta que termine todos los pedidos de ropa. Con el préstamo comprar una maquina de coser para tener mas producción de ropa. 

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y comprar mas maquinas para tener mas producción de ropa.
texts.en:
Raquel is 55 years old. She has a tailoring shop. She is a single mother and she lives in the region of Primavera de duran (a suburban region located farther than Guyaquil). She started her business because she needed to cover the family's expenses. She started making clothes and soon she was able to purchase a sewing machine. She works every day to complete the orders she receives. With the loan she requests she will pruchase a sewing machine to complete her projects faster. In the future she hopes to expand her business and purchase more sewing machines and increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
el sr. Oscar Armando G. P. se dedica al servicio de transporte de personas, posee un Taxi, actualmente tiene casi dos años brindando este servicio, pero lo hace solo con personas conocidas, ya que no tiene permiso ni numero para poder circular libremente como Taxi, osea que el por las mañanas se encarga de transportar personas a sus trabajos y en las tardes igual los lleva a sus casas.
en estos momentos esta realizando los tramites necesarios con Soptravi y la Dirección Ejecutiva de Ingresos  para poder realizar tramites de cambio de placas, porque ya tiene quien le alquile el Numero de Taxi.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar repuestos y arreglar el carro para dar un buen servicio cuando ya este listo como Taxi.
Soptravi y la DEI exigen que el carro debe de estar en buen estado para dar el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando G. P. has a taxi and provides services. He has been doing this for nearly two years but he only works for people he knows, because he does not have an official taxi license or number and cannot legally solicit freely. He takes people to their jobs in the morning and takes them home in the evenings. He is currently working with Soptravi and Dirección Ejecutiva de Ingresos (DEI) to obtain an official taxi license plate, because he has found someone who is willing to provide him with a taxi number. He will use the money from this loan to buy repair parts that he needs to fix up his car so that he can give better services when his taxi becomes licensed. Soptravi and DEI rules state that the vehicle must e in good repair in order to be used as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem V. is 24 years old and lives with his wife in the Takeo province. He is a construction worker building a house and is able to make about US $3 every day. His wife is a garment factory worker and makes US $3 per day as well. Since Sem V. spends a lot on transportation, he is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike as his way to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Carla Lilian

texts.es: La señora Carla es cliente antigua la actividad a la que se dedica es la comercialización de prendas de vestir, específicamente la de compra y venta de pantalones poleras y chamarras las mismas que las adquiere de la ciudad de Santa Cruz y las distribuye en varias zonas de la ciudad de la Paz, entrega su mercadería a crédito. Ella vive con sus dos hijas las cuales se encuentran en etapa de estudio.  El destino del crédito es el incremento de mercadería por mayor la cual en época de navidad sube de precio, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carla is an old client of Emprender.  She buys and sells clothes, specifically pants, shirts, and jackets.  She buys the clothes in Santa Cruz and distributes them in various zones in La Paz, making money off the merchandise.  She lives with her two daughters, who are in school.

She will use this loan to grow her inventory since the prices raise during the Christmas season.  Carla is a young hard-working woman.  She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support they’ve given her.

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell

loans.name: Mayra Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

La señora Mayra que es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal,  también antes de este fue fundadora de un Banco  Comunal en Rocafuerte su tierra natal. Ella tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 13 – 5 y 3 años de edad,  el mayor esta en colegio, otro en escuela y el menor aun no tiene edad para estudiar. Estudio en la Universidad en la cual se graduó de Lic. En Auditoria. 

Esta ama de casa para sacar a sus hijos adelante se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (perfumería, artículos de belleza y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 11am y en las noches. Además realiza trabajos  de asesoría contable trabajo que aprovecha para vender sus productos, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas cuando los productos salen más baratos y que cuando pasa la promoción los vende a precio normal con lo que se gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos e invertir en los que estén de oferta ya que estos  le dejan mayores ganancias.
 
Su sueño es darles a sus hijos una buena educación
texts.en:
The “Ceibos” communal bank meets every two weeks in the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of Portoviejo, a marginal urban zone whose residents are engaged in a variety of activities.

Mayra is a founding member of the communal bank.  Prior to this she was also a founding member of a communal bank in Rocafuerte, her place of birth.  She is 35 years old, a single mother of three children who are 13, 5 and 3 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the next one is in elementary school; the youngest is still not old enough to go to school.  She studied in the university graduating as an Auditor.

In order to support her children, this housewife sells Yanbal brand products (perfumes, beauty supplies and women’s accessories).  She works daily from 8am until 11am and in the evening.  She also works doing accountancy jobs and takes advantage of these occasions to offer her products for sale.  She tells us that she buys items when they are on sale and when the sale is over she resells them at regular price thereby earning a bit extra income.

This loan is to buy products and invest in those that are on sale because they are the ones that produce higher profits.

Her dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and Yambal brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan S. is a 24-year-old village woman who has a job as a fish seller. Her husband (pictured) repairs vehicles. The couple has one child. Kan S. buys fish from wholesale suppliers and other fisherman and sells retail. She earns approximately of $3 a day. The main income for her family comes from her husband who wants to buy old or second-hand motorbikes to fix and resell to make more profit. She said that she wishes to encourage her husband’s business, but does not have enough money, which is why she is asking for a loan.

loans.use: To buy an old motorcycle to fix up and sell.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo, de 47 años, enviudo hace 8 años y junto a sus 3 hijos: Goldi, de 22, Maryerli, de 19 y Devie, de 17 años de edad; sale adelante. Él vive solo en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Este excelente padre de familia, trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, a los que mira cada 15 días, ya que ellos realizan sus estudios superiores en la capital. 

Su principal actividad es la agricultura, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello, sus principales cultivos son de café y plátanos, los que comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pero sus producciones de café la entrega íntegramente a la cooperativa de su localidad. Pero está actividad no le proporciona muchos recursos, ya que tiene que mandar mensualmente una suma considerable de dinero. Por ello Oswaldo, viaja constantemente a Pucallpa, donde realiza obras civiles como: cunetas, pistas, carreteras. 

Para más adelante desea comprar más hectáreas de café y de esa manera invertir en los estudios de sus hijos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y agradece a su banco comunal por el apoyo que le brindaron en los momentos que más necesitaba y como presidente de su comunidad trabajará con honestidad e igualdad. 

Ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de 17 sacos de abono que le falta, para esparcirlos en sus plantaciones de 4 hectáreas de café, que oscilan entre S/. 48.00 soles cada una, asimismo invertirá en el pago a los peones quienes le ayudarán a sacar la maleza y aplicar abono en el campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Oswaldo, who is 47 and was widowed 8 years ago, is advancing, together with his three children, Goldi, who is 22, Maryerli, 19, and Devie, 17. He lives alone in his own house, located in the community of Sanchirio, in the central Peruvian forest. He is an excellent father to his family. He works very hard to bring up his children, whom he sees every 15 days, since they are working on their higher-level studies in the capital. 

His principal activity is agriculture, which he has already been working at for 10 years. His main crops are coffee and bananas. He sells the bananas at the wholesale market in his city, but he turns over his entire coffee crop to the cooperative in his area. But this business doesn't give him much return, and he has to send a considerable amount of money (for his children's education) each month. For this reason, Oswaldo travels constantly to Pucallpa, where he works on civil projects, such as on ditches, tracks, and highways.

In the future, he wants to buy more hectares of coffee and in this way have more income to invest in the education of his children. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is thankful to his community bank for the support that they have offered at the times when he most needed it. As president of his community bank, he will work with honesty and fairness. 

He is planning to invest this loan in the purchase of 17 sacks of compost, which he lacks, and which he will spread on his 4-hectare coffee plantation. They cost around 48 PEN each. He will also use part of the loan to pay his field workers, who help him weed and spread manure on his fields.

loans.use: Buy 17 sacks of compost

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Basilides E. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She sells noodles, soft drinks, toothpaste and other kinds of products.

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Basilides is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man and the father of one child who attends school. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in iron production for over six years. He started his own business in 2006.  His work is very delicate and he works hard to satisfy the needs of his family. Over the years, he has been able to build a good business reputation. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase special iron machinery that will facilitate his productivity. This machinery will help him deliver his goods faster and expand his business operations. He is planning to continue expanding his business and he is positive about the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase special iron machinery

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

La señora Ligia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, además se desempeña como presidenta del mismo función que desempeña con mucha responsabilidad y agrado. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante de carne.

Ella es consultora de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además vende calzados de las marcas Azalea y Dicaza, trabaja todos los días desde las 13h30 hasta las 19h00, ya que en las mañanas tiene que atender a su esposo que está muy delicado de salud. Su trabajo consiste en estar a cargo de surtir a 12 vendedoras que están a su cargo a quienes tiene que tomarles los pedidos y entregarles los productos. Lo que es la línea de zapatos los compra en Quito.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: zapatos de ambas marcas y productos Yanbal para sus ventas personales. Sus sueños son ser directora de Yanbal. .
texts.en:
The members of Avenida del Ejército communal bank meet every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known since many years ago as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Ligia is a founding member of the bank.  She also is the group President, a job she does with much responsibility and pleasure.  She is 57 years old, married and has four adult, independent children.  Her husband is a meat merchant.

She is a Yanbal consultant (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She also sells shoes of the Azalea and Dicaza brands.  She works every day from 1:30pm until 7pm because during the mornings she has to take care of her husband who is in delicate health.

Her work consists in stocking 12 sellers she’s in charge of and from whom she takes orders and delivers their products.  She buys the line of shoes in Quito.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: shoes of both brands and Yanbal products for her personal sales.  Her dream is to become a Yanbal director.

loans.use: To buy shoes and Yanbal brand products.

loans.name: Mirzoahmad

texts.en:
Mirzoahmad is married and has one child. He sells rice in the local market. His stall is well known for the good prices he offers, and his affordability compared to market prices. Mirzoahmad knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them the best quality of goods. He has been selling rice for a total of 25 years, with consistent profits. 

Mirzoahmad is requesting a loan of 7700 Somoni to increase the assortment of his goods. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profit. We believe that Mirzoahmad's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.   
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more rice for resale

loans.name: Jeanvier

texts.en: Jeanvier is 68 years old and has 8 children; her eldest was born in 1970 while her last was born in 1994. Jeanvier owns a store where she sells several items such as cooking oil, matches, soap and sugar. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory. She plans to save all her profits in order to build a house.

loans.use: Buy inventory of soap, cooking oil, and matches.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single woman living in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. Florence has operated a cloth-selling business for the past year, selling from door to door to her neighbours. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business but hopes to establish a boutique shop from which to sell clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase 50 pairs of lessos (Kikois) to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation.

loans.use: To purchase 50 pairs of lessos (Kikois) for sale.

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo, de 43 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad el Regadío, localizada en el departamento de Estelí, es casado, tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, de oficio agricultor, también comerciantes. Lleva 2 años en el negocio de destace de res.
Inicio en la agricultura en la comunidad el Regadío, ayudándole a su papa en el cultivo, arriar ganado a los 6 años de edad. Estudio la primaria en su comunidad de origen donde asistían todos los día caminando ida y vuelta, ya que la escuela queda algo lejos de du casa así mismo con la secundaria hasta lograr culminar su secundaria.  Después de eso tuvo que  trabajar para poder sobrevivir y se dedico al destace de cerdo y luego el  ganado. Con la primera vaca que compro y vendió le quedo una ganancia de C$4000 córdobas. Así logro trasladarse con su negocio hasta el centro de la comunidad el Regadío, municipio de Estelí, para vender carne a los mercados locales de Estelí, sin dejar atrás  la agricultura que es la actividad que aprendió desde niño.  
Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado, ya que con esto espera aumentar sus ventas al igual que su número de clientela.
Dentro de sus planes esta volverse proveedor exclusivo de carnes para los supermercados. Su meta próxima es poder etiquetar su producto con el nombre de su carnicería  darle una mejor presentación a su producto para atraer mas clientes fuera de Estelí y poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 43 years old. He is from the community of El Regadío, located in the departament of Estelí. He is married and has 4 children. He is a farmer by profession, as well as a merchant. He has been in the cattle butchering business for 2 years.   

He started in agriculture in the community of El Regadío, helping his father with the crops, driving cattle at 6 years old. He went to primary school in his home community, walking there and back every day, since the school was a little far from his house. He did the same in secondary school, until he finished secondary school. Afterwards, he had to work to be able to survive and he began to work in butchering pigs and later cattle. With the first cow he bought and sold he made C$4,000 cordobas. He also was able to transfer his business to the downtown of the El Regadio community, town of Estelí, to sell meat in the local markets of Estelí. He dis this without leaving farming behind, the activity he learned as a child.  
 
He is asking for the loan to buy cattle, since in this way he hopes to increase his sales as well as his customers. 

Among his plans is becoming the exclusive provider of meat to the supermarkets. His next goal is to be able to label his product with his butcher shop's  name, giving his product a better appearance to attract more customers outside of Estelí and be able to offer a better future to his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Korir

texts.en:
Korir, 25 years old, has been practicing mixed farming for the last 4 years in Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. His farm is currently producing milk and eggs, which are sold to the local market.

Korir has requested this loan of 40,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle, which he will use to transport his milk to the local market. His major challenges have been poor roads, diseases and not enough food for his animal. The extra income from this loan will help improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rachel Edith

texts.es:
Doña Rachel, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, donde administra un comedor llamado “Bendiciones de Dios”, ella vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, este negocio lo inicio por su madre, hace 10 años, con un horario de 7:00am a 5:00pm, de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para acondicionar mejor el comedor, mejorando sus paredes y volviéndolo más atractivo, esta inversión aunque no es su producción, pero si le ayudara para que sus clientes se sientan en un ambiente mejor y le visiten más a menudo.
Su objetivo es mantenerse bien en el negocio, tratar de solventar sus deudas, y ser independiente.
texts.en:
Rachel is 43 years old and lives in San Miguel where she runs an eatery called 'Benediciones de Dios' (God's Blessings).  She lives with her family: her husband and two children aged 11 and 15.  She started this business through her mother 10 years ago.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm, from Monday to Sunday.

Rachel is requesting a loan to better fit out her eatery, improving her walls and making it more attractive.  This investment will not affect her production but it will help her to make her customers feel that they are in a better environment and they will visit more often.

Rachel's goal is to keep running her business well, to try to clear her debts and to be independent.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her eatery

loans.name: Mawoulé Group

texts.fr:
MAWOULE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres font tous partie d'une même association de femmes. En vue d'accroître le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. 
La représentante du groupe, Mouibatou Justine (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Mouibatou Justine s'est installée avec sa famille à Atrokpocodji, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis près de six ans.Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Mouibatou Justine vend depuis quinze ans déjà, des poteries et diverses plantes médicinales à son domicile. Mouibatou Justine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Tori. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs obtenus. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mouibatou Justine désire, ensemble avec ses autres membres, obtenir un autre financement.
texts.en:
Mawoulé is a group composed of three women. They are all members of the same women's association. In order to increase their activity level and better meet their customers' demand, the group members came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for a loan.

The group's representative, Mouibatou Justine (raising her hand on the photo) is married to Pascal. They provide for three children, all attending school. Two of them are their own children. Nearly six years ago, Mouibatou Justine settled with her family in Atrokpocodji in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. The parents provide together for their family. Mouibatou Justine has been selling from her home, for 15 years already, earthenware and medicinal herbs. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Tori. She is a long-standing client of Alidé and has repaid her previous loans on schedule. In order to strengthen her activity and meet her customers' demand, Mouibatou Justine and the other members of her group want to get a new loan.

loans.use: to buy a diversified set of earthenware and a sizeable quantity of medicinal herbs.

loans.name: Digao

texts.en: F. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 53 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, F. runs a business selling fish in the community. F. has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. F. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. F. is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by F. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Mary  Wanjiku

texts.en: Mary is 70 years old and married to Samson, a farmer. She has been doing crop farming and raising livestock for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES.65,000. This is her fourth loan cycle from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy a dairy cow for milk production and sale. Mary intends to use the anticipated profits to rent a piece of land to grow more vegetables and hopes to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, age 44, earns a living by running a general store, where she sells both food items and daily-use products in her local community. Marieta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,560 PHP a month. She and her husband have four school-aged children and live in the city of Mobod, Oroq. City.
